One day, a little boy named Tim went to the library. It was a gloomy day outside. Tim felt sad because he wanted to play in the park. But he knew the library was a fun place too. Inside, he found many books with colorful pictures.
As Tim looked at the books, he met a girl named Sue. Sue said, "I like to spring and jump on gloomy days. It makes me happy." Tim thought it was a good idea. So they both started to spring and jump in the library.
Soon, the librarian came and said, "Please stop jumping. It is not safe in the library." Tim and Sue stopped and said sorry. They learned that it is important to follow rules and be safe. They sat down and read books together. The gloomy day became a happy day because they made a new friend and learned a lesson.

Once upon a time, there was a tidy little house. In this house, there was a girl named Lily. Lily liked to mix things in her big bowl. One day, Lily found a book with a picture of a spirit. The spirit had a big smile. Lily wanted to see the spirit, so she read the book.
Lily found a special mix to make the spirit come. She put all the things in the big bowl and mixed them up. The mix began to glow, and the spirit came out. The spirit said, "Hello, Lily! Do you want to play?"
Lily was so happy. She played with the spirit all day. They had so much fun. But when the sun went down, the spirit did not want to go away. The spirit began to make a big mess in the tidy house. Lily asked the spirit to stop, but the spirit did not listen. The house was not tidy anymore, and the spirit stayed with Lily forever.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She had a mop that she liked to play with. It was her favorite toy. Sue would push the mop around the house, pretending to clean like her mom.
One day, Sue saw a sour lemon on the floor. She used her mop to clean it up. As she did, she heard a whisper. She looked around, but no one was there. Sue felt a little scared, but she kept on playing with her mop.
The whisper came again, and this time Sue found out it was the mop talking! The mop said, "Thank you for cleaning the sour lemon." Sue and the mop became best friends, and they played together every day.

One day, a cat named Tom and a dog named Max were playing outside. They liked to exercise and run around the big yard. After a while, they got tired and smelly. Tom said, "Let's take a nap under the tree!"
As they lay down to nap, a little bird flew down and landed on Tom's head. The bird said, "Hello, I am Sam! Can I play with you?" Tom and Max looked at each other, surprised that the bird could talk. They said, "Yes, Sam, you can play with us after our nap."
When they woke up, they found a big pile of toys next to them. Sam had brought them from his nest. They all played together and had so much fun. The smelly cat and dog forgot they were tired and became best friends with Sam the talking bird.

One day, a big red ball went to class. The ball was very careless. It did not watch where it was going. It would roll all around the room. The other kids in class would laugh and play with the ball.
One day, the ball rolled up to a small girl. The girl said, "Ball, why are you always rolling around and not paying attention?" The ball just smiled and rolled away, not caring at all.
But then, something unexpected happened. The ball rolled into a big hole! It was stuck and could not get out. The small girl saw the ball and said, "I will help you, ball." She pulled the ball out of the hole. The ball was very happy and said, "Thank you, girl. I will be more careful now." From that day on, the ball was not careless anymore. It learned to roll and play without making trouble.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lucy. She had a pretty skirt with stars on it. Lucy loved her skirt very much. She wore it every day.
One sunny day, Lucy went to the park. She saw a deaf dog named Spot. Spot could not hear, but he was very good at playing. Lucy said, "Hi Spot! Do you like my skirt?" Spot wagged his tail and smiled. Lucy knew that meant he liked her skirt.
As the sun began to set, the stars on Lucy's skirt started to shine. Lucy and Spot played under the shiny stars until it was time to go home. They were very happy to be friends.

One day, a little girl named Lucy wanted to make soup. She asked her mom, "Can I make soup, please?" Her mom said, "Yes, but be careful."
Lucy started to make the soup. She put in some harsh things like a rock and a stick. Her brother Tom saw it and said, "That's not good soup!" Lucy was sad.
Tom said, "Let's guess what we need to make good soup." They took out the rock and stick. They put in nice things like carrots and peas. They made the soup together and it was yummy.
The moral value of the story is that we should work together and help each other to make things better.

One day, a little girl named Sue went to the park with her mom. Sue saw a big orange cat sitting on the grass. The cat was very pretty, and Sue wanted to play with it. She ran to the cat and said, "Hi, cat! Let's play!"
The cat looked at Sue and said, "I lost my tooth. Can you help me find it?" Sue wanted to help her new friend. They both looked around the park, under the trees and near the swings.
After a while, Sue found a small, white tooth on the ground. "Look, cat! I found your tooth!" The cat was very happy and thanked Sue. They played together all day, and Sue had a new orange friend.

Lily and Ben were playing in the park with their ball. They liked to kick the ball to each other and run after it. Sometimes they missed the ball and it rolled away. Then they had to chase it before it went too far.
One time, the ball rolled near a big road. Lily and Ben ran after it, but they did not look for cars. A loud horn made them stop and look. A big truck was coming fast. It had black smoke coming out of its back. The smoke smelled bad and made Lily and Ben cough.
"Stop!" shouted a voice. It was their mom. She had seen them run to the road. She was scared and angry. She ran to them and grabbed their hands. She pulled them away from the road and the truck. She slapped their legs and said, "No! No! No! You don't run to the road! The road is dangerous! You could get hurt by the cars! You have to look and listen before you cross the road! Do you understand?"
Lily and Ben nodded. They felt sorry and scared. They did not like the slap or the smoke or the horn. They hugged their mom and said, "Sorry, mom. We won't do it again. We love you, mom."
Their mom hugged them back and said, "I love you too, Lily and Ben. But you have to be careful and follow the rules. The road is not a place to play. The park is a place to play. Let's go back to the park and play with the ball. But first, let's wash our faces and hands. The smoke made them dirty."
Lily and Ben agreed. They followed their mom back to the park. They washed their faces and hands in a fountain. They felt better. They saw their ball. It was still on the grass, not too far from the road. They picked it up and kicked it to each other. They laughed and had fun. They did not go near the road again. They saw the truck go away. It was distant and small. They did not care about it. They only cared about their mom and their ball. They were happy.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, a little girl named Ann went to the store with her mom. They wanted to buy some interesting things for their home. On their way, they saw a big clock. The clock went "strike, strike, strike!" Ann looked at her mom and said, "Mommy, what is that sound?"
Her mom smiled and said, "That is the clock telling us it is three o'clock, Ann. It is time for us to go home and have some coffee!"
When they got home, Ann's mom made some hot coffee for herself and gave Ann a cup of warm milk. They sat down at the table and talked about their day. Ann told her mom about the interesting things she saw at the store and how she liked the sound of the clock.
Ann's mom laughed and said, "Yes, the clock has a lovely sound when it strikes. Maybe one day we can get a clock like that for our home." Ann nodded and smiled, happy to have a fun day with her mom.

Once upon a time, there was a normal prince who lived in a big, beautiful castle. The prince loved playing with his toys and having fun with his friends. One day, he decided to go on an adventure and explore the kingdom. 
He packed his bag and loaded it onto his horse before setting off on his journey. As he rode through the forest, he saw a little cottage. Inside was a sweet old woman. 
The prince asked the old woman if he could help her with anything. She told him that she needed logs to make her fire. The prince was eager to help and loaded the logs onto the back of his horse. He thanked the old woman before riding off. 
The prince really enjoyed his adventure, and when he returned home, he was excited to tell his family all about it.

One day, a little girl named Sally went outside to play. It was a gloomy day, but Sally didn't mind. She liked to play in the dirt and make mud pies. She brought her favorite toy, a pair of scissors, with her.
Sally saw her friend Timmy playing in his yard. "Hi Timmy!" she called. "Do you want to play with me?" Timmy smiled and said, "Yes, Sally! Let's play together!" They decided to play a game of hide and seek.
Sally had an idea. "I'll bury my scissors in the dirt, and you try to find them!" she said. Timmy agreed and started counting. Sally quickly buried her scissors and hid behind a tree. When Timmy finished counting, he looked all around for the scissors.
After a while, Timmy found the scissors in the dirt. "I found them, Sally!" he shouted. Sally came out from behind the tree and clapped her hands. They both laughed and decided to play some more games together. Even though the day was gloomy, Sally and Timmy had a lot of fun playing outside.

Once there was a big, impressive tree. It was very tall and strong. But one day, a small leak came from the tree. A tiny bug saw the leak and went to tell his friend.
"Look! The big tree has a leak," said the tiny bug to his friend. "It might rot if we don't help it."
The two tiny bugs knew they had to do something. They went to the tree and tried to fix the leak. But they were too small to fix it alone. They needed help from their friends. So, they asked more bugs to join them.
Many bugs came to help the big tree. They all worked together to fix the leak. The tree was happy and thanked the bugs. The bugs were happy too because they saved the tree from rotting.
The moral of the story is: when we work together, we can fix big problems.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Blue. Blue loved to sing. Every day, Blue would sit on a tree branch and sing a happy song.
One hot day, Blue was flying around and saw a hidden nest. Blue was curious and wanted to see what was inside. Blue flew closer and saw a little egg in the nest. Blue knew it was hot and the egg needed shade, so Blue decided to help.
Blue found a big leaf to give the egg some shade. Blue then sat by the egg and sang a sweet song to keep it company. Blue knew that singing would make the egg feel safe and loved. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a lazy cat. The cat liked to sleep all day. One day, a little mouse came to the house. The mouse saw the lazy cat and thought it was funny. The mouse wanted to play with the cat.
The mouse went near the cat and tickled its foot. The cat woke up and saw the mouse. The cat frowned and did not want to play. The mouse was sad but tried again. The mouse tickled the cat's foot one more time.
The cat got angry and chased the mouse around the house. The mouse was scared and tried to run away. The cat caught the mouse and the mouse was gone. The cat went back to sleep, but the house was not happy anymore.
<|endoftext|>


Sam likes to play with his toy motorcycle. He makes it zoom and vroom on the floor. He pretends he is a big rider. He likes the red and blue colors of his motorcycle. He thinks it is very pretty.
One day, his cousin Lily comes to visit. She sees his motorcycle and wants to play with it too. She asks Sam, "Can I have a turn?" Sam does not want to share. He says, "No, it is mine!" He holds his motorcycle tight.
Lily is sad. She says, "Please, Sam, just for a little bit. I like your motorcycle. It is so pretty." Sam still does not want to share. He says, "No, go away!" He turns his back to Lily.
Lily feels angry. She tries to grab his motorcycle. She says, "Give it to me!" Sam resists. He says, "No, stop it!" They pull and tug on the motorcycle. They start to cry.
Mom hears them and comes to see what is wrong. She sees them fighting over the motorcycle. She says, "What is going on here? Why are you not sharing?" Sam and Lily look at Mom. They feel ashamed. They say, "Sorry, Mom."
Mom says, "It is okay to say sorry, but you also need to learn to share. Sharing is caring. How about you take turns playing with the motorcycle? You can each have five minutes. Then you can switch. Does that sound fair?" Sam and Lily nod. They say, "Okay, Mom."
Mom smiles. She says, "Good. Now, let's play nicely. Who wants to go first?" Sam says, "Me!" Lily says, "Me too!" Mom says, "How about we flip a coin? Heads, Sam goes first. Tails, Lily goes first. Ready?" Sam and Lily say, "Yes!" Mom flips the coin. It lands on heads. Sam says, "Yay!" Lily says, "Aw!" Mom says, "Don't worry, Lily. You will have your turn soon. Sam, you have five minutes. Then you have to give the motorcycle to Lily. Okay?" Sam says, "Okay." He plays with his motorcycle. He says, "Zoom, vroom!" Lily watches. She waits for her turn. She says, "It is so pretty."
<|endoftext|>


Lily and Ben were friends who liked to play in the garden. They liked to dig and water the plants and look for bugs. One day, they saw a big red radish growing in the ground. They both wanted to pick it and eat it.
"I saw it first!" Lily said.
"No, I did!" Ben said.
They pulled on the radish from both sides, trying to get it out. They started to quarrel and shout at each other.
"Let go, it's mine!" Lily said.
"No, it's mine!" Ben said.
They pulled so hard that the radish snapped in half. They both fell back on the grass, holding their pieces. They looked at the radish and felt sad. It was not as nice as they thought. It was dirty and bitter and had a hole in it.
They looked at each other and felt sorry. They did not want to quarrel and hurt their friend. They wanted to share and have fun.
"I'm sorry, Lily," Ben said.
"I'm sorry, Ben," Lily said.
They hugged and made up. They threw away the radish and decided to play something else. They found a ball and a hoop and had a great time. They were happy and forgot about the radish. They were friends again.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play outside. They have a pet dog named Spot. Spot is huge and fluffy. He likes to run and jump.
One day, Lily and Ben decide to jog with Spot. They put on their shoes and hats. They hold Spot's leash. They say, "Come on, Spot, let's go!"
They jog down the street. They see a park. They jog to the park. They see a slide and a swing. They say, "Let's play, Spot!"
They let go of Spot's leash. They run to the slide. They take turns sliding down. Spot runs after them. He barks and wags his tail.
They run to the swing. They push each other. They laugh and shout. Spot jumps up and down. He tries to catch their feet.
They have fun. They jog back home. They are tired and happy. They hug Spot. They say, "You are a good pet, Spot. We love you!"

Once upon a time, there was a little monster named Momo. Momo lived in a big, safe cave with his mommy and daddy. They were a happy family. Momo liked to play with his toys and record his voice on a little box his daddy gave him.
One day, Momo went for a walk in the forest. He saw a big tree and decided to climb it. He climbed higher and higher. Momo felt very brave. He took out his little box and said, "I am the best tree climber in the world!"
Then, Momo saw a big bird in the tree. The bird looked angry. Momo got scared and started to cry. The bird said, "Why are you crying, little monster?" Momo told the bird he was scared. The bird said, "Don't worry, I will help you get down."
The bird helped Momo get down from the tree. Momo felt safe again. He thanked the bird and went back to his cave. He played the recording of his voice for his mommy and daddy. They laughed and hugged him. Momo learned that it's okay to be scared sometimes, and that friends can help you feel safe.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a hungry cat named Tilly. Tilly loved to play and spring around the house. One sunny day, Tilly saw a big sink in the kitchen. She thought it would be fun to jump in and play.
While Tilly was playing in the sink, she saw a little bug. The bug was also hungry and looking for food. Tilly wanted to catch the bug, but then she had a better idea. She decided to help the bug find food instead.
Tilly and the bug looked around the kitchen and found some yummy crumbs. The bug was very happy and thanked Tilly. From that day on, Tilly and the bug became best friends. They played together and helped each other when they were hungry. The moral of the story is to be kind and help others, even if they are different from you.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a toy scale. He liked to put things on the scale to see how heavy they were. One day, Tim found a small chair. He wanted to see if the chair was heavy or light. So, he put the chair on the scale.
Tim's friend, Sue, came over to play. Sue saw the chair on the scale. "Why is the chair on the scale?" Sue asked. "I wanted to see if it was heavy or light," Tim said. Sue thought it was a fun game. She found a toy car and put it on the scale too.
Then, a rude cat came into the room. The cat jumped onto the chair and knocked it off the scale. Tim and Sue were not happy. They wanted the cat to seat on the floor, not on the chair. "No, cat! Seat on the floor!" Tim said. The cat listened and sat on the floor. Tim and Sue put the chair back on the scale and continued their fun game.

Once upon a time, there was a generous farmer. He had a big farm with a lot of wheat. He liked to share his wheat with all his friends in the town.
One day, a big wind came and blew all the wheat away. The farmer was sad because he could not share his wheat. His friends were sad too. They wanted to help the farmer, but they did not know how.
Then, something strange happened. The wind started to reverse! It blew all the wheat back to the farm. The farmer and his friends were so happy. They all helped to put the wheat back in the right place. And the generous farmer could share his wheat again.

Mum was so excited. She opened the door, said hello and gave a big hug to the stranger who arrived to the house. The stranger had a big bag in her hands and she said hello to mum with a big smile.
"This is for you", the stranger said, while she gave mum a big bottle with a pink lid. Mum thanked the stranger and decided to take a closer look.
Inside the bottle, there were lots of colourful pieces. Mum was quite puzzled, so the stranger decided to explain her gift.
"These are interesting pieces that will provide lots of fun for your little one".
Mum was delighted, so she thanked the stranger again, and went to find her 3 year old son. He was so excited when mum showed him the bottle. He couldn't wait to start playing with the pieces!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Linda. She was 3 years old and she loved to use her magic. She had a rare power to make incredible things happen. 
One day, her best friend came to visit. His name was Jack and he was teasing her. He was laughing and saying things like "Linda can't do magic; she's just pretending".
Linda's face went red. She was so mad and she wanted to show Jack that she could do magic. She waved her hands in the air and said the magic words. Suddenly, a sparkling, rainbow-coloured butterfly appeared in the room! 
Jack was so amazed. His mouth opened wide and he said "Linda, you can do real magic!"
Linda smiled proudly. She knew that her magic was rare, and she had just shown Jack that she could do fantastic things. With her magic, she had just made a beautiful, rare butterfly appear. 
The End.

There were two friends named Amanda and Joe. They had just gotten a new melon. Amanda wanted to throw the melon, but Joe said it was too new. 
"No, let's not throw it," said Joe. 
"Yes!" cried Amanda excitedly. "Let's throw the melon!"
Joe disagreed. He said it was too new and he didn't want it to break. 
"Aww, let's do it together!" said Amanda.
Joe thought for awhile and then agreed, but said they should be very careful not to drop the new melon. 
They threw the melon back and forth. It was so much fun, until suddenly Amanda dropped the new melon. It split open and the juicy pulp spattered everywhere! 
Amanda and Joe looked at each other in horror. They felt so sad that they had broken the new melon. They hugged each other and promised to be more careful next time.

Once upon a time, there was a modest rabbit. He lived in a small house. The rabbit loved to eat salad. Every day, he went to the garden to pick fresh greens for his salad.
One day, the rabbit found a long string. He thought it would be fun to tie the string around his salad. So, he tied the string into a bow around the salad. The rabbit was very happy with his tied salad.
The rabbit hopped back to his house with his salad. He shared it with his friends. They all liked the tied salad too. From that day on, they always tied their salads with a string. And they lived happily ever after.

One day, a little dog named Spot went for a walk in the fog. The fog was so thick that he could not see his own tail. Spot felt scared and started to shiver. He wanted to find his way back home, but he did not know where to go.
As Spot walked, he saw a big cat named Fluffy. Fluffy was a selfish cat who did not like to share her toys. Spot asked Fluffy for help to find his way home. Fluffy thought for a moment and decided to help Spot, even though she was selfish.
Together, they walked through the fog, shivering and scared. Finally, they found Spot's house. Spot was so happy to be home and safe. He thanked Fluffy for helping him. From that day on, Fluffy was not selfish anymore. She learned that helping others made her feel good inside.

One day, a small dog named Spot went for a walk. He saw some green grass and thought it would be fun to play on it. Spot remembered that his friend, a cat named Fluffy, liked to play on the grass too. So, Spot called out, "Fluffy, come play with me on the grass!"
Fluffy came running over and said, "I love playing on the grass! Let's play a game of catch." They played catch for a while, but then Spot saw something in the grass. It was a small, shiny ball. Spot picked it up and said, "Look, Fluffy! I found a shiny ball!"
Fluffy looked at the ball and remembered that she had lost her ball a long time ago. "That's my ball!" she said. "I lost it when we played here last time." Spot gave the ball back to Fluffy, and they played with it together. They were happy to play on the grass and to have found the lost ball.

Once upon a time, there was a little frog in a pond. The frog was mysterious because it could change colors. One day, a boy named Tim saw the frog. Tim was very happy to see the frog.
Tim said, "Hi frog! I want to put you in a jar and take you home." The frog did not want to go in the jar. The frog wanted to stay in the pond with its friends. So, the frog changed colors to hide from Tim.
Tim looked and looked but could not find the frog. He felt sad. Then, Tim heard the frog say, "Please let me stay in the pond with my friends. I will be happy here." Tim thought about it and decided to let the frog stay.
The moral of the story is to let others be happy where they belong.

There was an ordinary little girl called Emma who loved to swim. Every day, she would go to her favourite pond to swim.
One day, Emma found a new pond with a maze around it. It was an exciting discovery and she couldn't wait to explore it.
"This pond looks so interesting!" said Emma.
When she got to the pond, Emma discovered it had a secret entrance. She followed the entrance leads her to a beautiful underwater maze. She could see all sorts of colours and shapes.
"This looks like a magical place," said Emma.
Emma started swimming through the maze, exploring all the twists and turns. She felt like she was flying. It was the most exciting experience she ever had.
When she finally reached the end of the maze, Emma was exhausted but overjoyed. She had never seen anything like it before.
Emma said to herself, "Swimming sure is magical!"

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his toy gun. He would run around the house and pretend to shoot, saying "bang, bang!" His mom would smile and watch him play.
One day, Tim's mom gave him a new puzzle. It had a picture of a spicy pepper on it. Tim was very excited to put the puzzle together. He sat down on the floor and started to find the pieces that fit.
As Tim worked on the puzzle, he thought about how spicy the pepper looked. He knew that spicy things made his mouth feel hot. Tim finished the puzzle and showed it to his mom. She was very proud of him. Tim went back to playing with his toy gun, and they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a messy bird who lived in a cage. The bird's name was Chirpy. Chirpy liked to sing, but his cage was so messy that he could not find his favorite toy.
One day, a little girl named Lily came to visit Chirpy. She saw the messy cage and said, "Chirpy, your cage is so messy! Let me help you clean it." Chirpy was happy to hear this.
Lily and Chirpy cleaned the cage together. They found Chirpy's favorite toy under all the mess. Now, Chirpy could sing and play with his toy. Chirpy said, "Thank you, Lily!" And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a long zip on his coat. One day, he went to the park with his mom. They saw a big tree with lots of birds. Tim liked the birds and wanted to play with them.
Tim ran to the tree, but his mom said, "Stop, Tim!" He did not listen. He tried to zip his coat, but the long zip got stuck. Tim felt a shock when he pulled on the zip too hard. The birds flew away, and Tim was sad.
Tim's mom came to help him. She fixed the zip and said, "You should listen when I talk to you." Tim learned that it is important to listen to his mom. But the birds were gone, and he could not play with them anymore. The day had a bad ending, but Tim learned a good lesson.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time, there were two friends, Bobby and Mark. They were playing chess outside in the park when Bobby suddenly noticed a bird flying in the air.
"Look at the bird," he said.
Mark looked up and waved at the bird as it flew away. "Bye bird," he said.
Bobby started to feel guilty. He had forgotten to wave goodbye to the bird.
Mark saw the look on Bobby's face and said, "It's okay Bobby, the bird is gone now. But next time, we should wave together."
Bobby smiled, and they went back to playing their game of chess.
<|endoftext|>

Once, there was a lovely pond. The pond was so clear and calm, nothing ever seemed to disturb it. Yet one day, something unexpected happened. Suddenly, a raven flew out from the sky and splashed into the pond! It caused lots of ripples and made a great big mess.
The splash made all the other animals around the pond take off in a hurry, but the raven stayed there, gliding and swimming around in the lovely water. It made the pond even more beautiful than before, and the other animals eventually returned, drawn by the new sight.
The animals watched the raven playing in the water and they were very happy. The pond felt so lively with the raven splashing around and having fun. Everyone was filled with love and joy. They were so happy to have a raven to share their lovely pond.
<|endoftext|>
One day, a little boy named Tim found a brilliant eraser. It was very pretty and shiny. Tim wanted to draw a big picture and use the eraser to fix any mistakes. He got his paper and crayons and started to draw.
As Tim drew, he made a mistake. He used the brilliant eraser to fix it. But something unexpected happened! When he used the eraser, it did not just fix the mistake. It also added a new color to his picture. The picture became even more pretty!
Tim was very happy and surprised. He kept drawing and used the eraser to add more colors. Soon, his picture was full of beautiful colors from the brilliant eraser. Tim showed his friends, and they all wanted to try the eraser too. They all had fun drawing and adding colors with the brilliant eraser.
<|endoftext|>
One morning, a big cat named Tom was very sad. It did not rain for many days, and the grass was dry. Tom wanted to find water for his friends, so he left his home to look for it.
Tom walked and walked until he saw a big tree. Behind the tree, he found a big, shiny rock. Tom was very happy because he thought the rock could help him. He picked up the rock and started to walk back to his friends.
But then, something unexpected happened. The shiny rock started to shake and made a loud noise. Suddenly, water came out of the rock! Tom was very surprised. He ran back to his friends and told them about the magic rock. Now, they all had water to drink and the dry grass turned green again. Tom and his friends were very happy and played together all day.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a friendly girl named Lily. She liked to play with her friends Tom and Sue. They loved to pretend and have fun together.
One day, they made a club. The club was for kids who liked to pretend. They made a sign that said "Pretend Club" and put it on their tree house. They were very happy.
In the club, they pretended to be animals, like cats and dogs. They also pretended to be superheroes who saved the day. They had lots of fun in their friendly Pretend Club, and they played there every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little yellow bird named Billy. Billy had a small foot that made it hard for him to walk. One day, he heard that there was a magic tree that could increase the size of his foot. So, he went on a long trip to find the magic tree.
On his way, Billy met a big, yellow cat named Tom. Tom wanted to help Billy find the magic tree. They walked and walked, and finally found the tree. Billy was so happy, he jumped up and down. He asked the tree to increase the size of his foot, and his foot started to grow!
But then, something unexpected happened. Tom the cat was actually a magic cat! He had been hiding his magic powers all along. Tom used his magic to change Billy's foot back to its normal size. He told Billy that it was better to be happy with who he was, and not to change just because he thought it would make him better. Billy realized that Tom was right, and they both went home, happy and thankful for their friendship.

Lily likes to read stories with her mom. She has a big book of stories with many pictures. She likes the stories with animals and fairies and princesses. She likes to cover herself with a pink blanket when she reads.
One day, Lily wants to read a story with her mom, but her mom is busy. She has to work on her computer and talk on the phone. She tells Lily to wait a little bit. Lily is sad and bored. She looks for something to do.
She sees her brother Jake playing with his cars. He has many cars of different colors and sizes. He makes them zoom and crash and honk. Lily thinks his cars are noisy and silly. She wants to play with her stories.
She goes to Jake and asks him to play with her. She shows him her big book of stories. She says they can read a story together and cover themselves with the pink blanket. Jake says no. He says he does not like stories. He says stories are boring and girly. He says he likes cars. He says cars are fun and cool. He says he does not want to share his cars with Lily.
Lily is angry and hurt. She thinks Jake is mean and rude. She wants to make him like stories. She grabs his cars and runs to her room. She puts them under her pink blanket. She says they are her stories now. She says she will not give them back to Jake.
Jake is shocked and mad. He chases Lily to her room. He tries to get his cars back. He says they are his cars. He says Lily is bad and selfish. He says he will not play with her ever again.
Lily and Jake start to yell and fight. They pull and tug and push. They make a big mess. Their mom hears them and comes to their room. She sees them and their toys and the pink blanket. She is not happy. She tells them to stop and listen. She says they have to share and be nice. She says they can both play with stories and cars. She says they can learn from each other and have fun.
Lily and Jake feel sorry and ashamed. They say sorry to each other and to their mom. They hug and make up. They decide to try to play with stories and cars. They pick a story from the big book and a car from the pile. They cover themselves with the pink blanket. They read and play and laugh. They are happy.

Once there was a boy named Tom. He liked to perform in front of his family. Tom would sing and dance. Everyone loved it.
One day, Tom saw his dad's wallet on the table. The wallet was very delicate. He wanted to use it in his show. But he was scared to break it.
Tom decided to ask his dad. His dad said, "No, the wallet is too delicate." Tom was sad. But then, his dad said, "Let's find something else for your show." They found a hat and Tom performed with it. Everyone was happy.

One day, a boy named Tim found a big, long thing in his yard. He did not know what it was. It looked like a missile. Tim thought it was cool and wanted to show his friend, Sam.
Tim went to Sam's house and said, "Look what I found! It's a missile!" Sam looked at the missile and said, "That's not a missile, that's just a stupid toy!" They started to play with it, and Tim tried to slap the toy to make it fly.
Suddenly, the toy missile started to shake and make a loud noise. Tim and Sam were very scared. They did not know that it was a real missile! The missile started to fly up into the sky, and they both watched it with big eyes.
The missile went up and up, but then it turned around and came back down. Tim and Sam thought it would hit them, but it did not. Instead, the missile opened up, and a lot of candy fell out! It was a special candy missile!
Tim and Sam were so happy. They laughed and ate the candy together. They learned that even if something looks stupid, it can still be a lot of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a creative little girl named Lily. She loved to draw and paint all day. One day, she saw a lost dog outside her house. The dog looked sad and hungry. Lily wanted to help the dog, so she went to her mom.
"Mommy, can we help the dog?" Lily asked. Her mom said, "Yes, we can give him a welcome and some food."
But the dog was scared of people. He would not come to Lily and her mom. Lily had an idea. She took her crayons and paper and made a big sign. The sign had a picture of a happy dog and said, "You are welcome here."
Lily and her mom put the sign near the dog. The dog saw the sign and knew he was safe. He came to Lily and her mom. They gave him food and love. The dog was happy and did not suffer anymore. They all became good friends and lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was an otter who was very clumsy. He stumbled around, always making a huge mess. He realized that he was not very neat and decided to clean up.
But, even when the otter cleaned, he was still very clumsy. No matter how hard he tried, he just could not seem to keep things neat. The otter got very frustrated and started to cry.
Soon, someone noticed the otter's mess and came to help him. But instead of cleaning up, the person just shook their head and walked away.
The otter was now all alone and he cried even harder. He accepted that he could not clean and that his mess would stay forever. He was very sad and his bad ending had come true.

Once upon a time, there was a big cat named Tom. Tom was not a normal cat. He had a very special taste for food. He liked to eat fish, but he did not like to eat mice like other cats. One day, Tom saw a big fish in the pond. He wanted to catch the fish and eat it.
Tom met his friend, a little bird named Sue. Sue asked Tom, "What are you doing?" Tom said, "I want to catch the fish." Sue had an idea. She told Tom to lie down and pretend to be asleep. She said, "When the fish comes near, you can catch it."
Tom did what Sue said. He lied down and closed his eyes. The fish saw Tom and thought he was asleep. The fish swam closer and closer to Tom. Just as the fish was about to touch Tom's nose, Tom opened his eyes and caught the fish.
Tom was very happy. He thanked Sue for her help. They both sat down to eat the fish together. From that day on, Tom and Sue were the best of friends. And Tom learned that it was good to have a friend who could help him catch his food.

Tim saw a big tree and thought it would be a good place to hide. He hid behind the tree and waited for his friends to find him. But they did not come. Tim started to feel a little sad.
Then, something unexpected happened. Tim heard a soft sound behind him. He turned around and saw a little bird hiding too! The bird was playing hide and seek with its family. Tim smiled and felt happy. He had found a new friend to play with, and they played hide and seek together all day long.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park. He saw a smelly dog. The dog had a stone in his mouth. Tim wanted to play with the dog and the stone.
"Give me the stone, dog," Tim said. The dog did not want to give Tim the stone. Tim urged the dog, "Please, give me the stone." The dog gave Tim the stone. They played together and had fun.
Then, something unexpected happened. The stone started to glow! Tim and the dog were surprised. The stone turned into a beautiful, shiny toy. Tim and the dog played with the toy and became best friends.

One day, a tall man went to the store. He had a cart. He put food in the cart. The tall man was happy. He liked to shop.
A little girl saw the tall man. She wanted to help. She pointed at some apples. The tall man smiled. He put the apples in the cart.
Then, something unexpected happened. A dog jumped into the cart! The tall man and the little girl laughed. They did not know the dog. The dog was a surprise.
The tall man, the little girl, and the dog became friends. They all went home together. They had fun and ate the apples. The tall man was happy to have a new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a pretty cat. She had a gear toy that she loved to play with. The cat would push the gear around the house, and it would make funny noises.
One day, the pretty cat saw a bug in the garden. She decided to follow the bug. The bug flew up and down, and the cat jumped and ran after it. The cat was having so much fun following the bug that she forgot about her gear toy.
After a while, the bug flew away, and the cat was tired. She went back to her house and saw her gear toy. The pretty cat was happy to see her toy again. She played with her gear toy all day long. From that day on, the cat knew that she could have fun with both her gear toy and following bugs in the garden.

Once upon a time, there was a little motor named Mo. Mo liked to blink his lights to say hello to his friends. One day, Mo went on a trip to the big city.
In the city, Mo saw many cars and buses. They were all very big and fast. Mo was a little scared, but he wanted to be safe. He blinked his lights to say hello, but the big cars and buses did not blink back.
Mo was sad, but he did not give up. He remembered that he had a big, bright light on his back. He blinked the big light, and suddenly, all the big cars and buses blinked back. Mo was happy and safe in the big city, and he made many new friends.

Mommy and Daddy smiled and said, "It's time to unpack." They grabbed a box, and Daddy opened it up. Inside were two special things! They were so rare.
Mommy and Daddy were excited, and they began to unpack all the boxes. They took out toys, books, and games.
When they were all done, Mommy and Daddy said, “Isn't this nice? Our lawn is so special now."
Mommy and Daddy hugged each other. They were happy.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park. He took a big red apple with him. Tim wanted to eat his apple under a tree. He felt safe there.
Tim saw a girl named Sue. She was crying. "Why are you sad?" Tim asked. "My apple is bad. It is spoiled," Sue said. Tim wanted to help her. He gave her his big red apple.
Sue was happy now. She said, "Thank you, Tim!" They played together in the park. They had a lot of fun.
Then, something strange happened. A big wind came and blew a lot of apples from the tree. Now, Tim and Sue had many apples to eat. They laughed and shared the apples with their friends. The spoiled apple was not so bad after all.

One day, Tom and Sue were playing in the park. They saw a long piece of paper on the ground. "Let's make a big picture!" said Sue. They needed scissors to cut the paper, so they started to search for them.
Tom looked under a big tree and Sue looked near the swings. Then, they heard a funny sound. "Ribbit, ribbit!" said a frog. "Hello, frog! Do you know where we can find scissors?" asked Tom. The frog jumped and showed them a hidden box.
When they opened the box, they found big scissors inside. But, the scissors were not normal scissors. They were magic scissors! As they started to cut the paper, the pictures they made came to life. A big, happy sun and a cute dog jumped out of the paper. Tom and Sue were very surprised and played with their new friends all day.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Bobo. Bobo loved to spring and play near a stream. The stream had pretty rocks and cold water. Bobo liked to drink from the stream when he was thirsty.
One day, the stream looked troubled. The water was not clear, and it had a bad smell. Bobo was sad because he could not drink from the stream. He did not want to play near it anymore.
Bobo decided to find out what made the stream troubled. He followed the stream and found a big pile of trash. Bobo knew he had to clean it up. He asked his friends, the birds and the squirrels, to help him. They all worked together to clean the trash. After they finished, the stream was clear and pretty again. Bobo was happy, and he could spring and play by the stream once more.

Tom and Sam were brothers. They liked to play with their toys. One day, they found a big box in the garage. It was a boat! They wanted to sail it in the pond.
They took the boat outside and ran to the pond. They put the boat in the water and watched it float. It was a regular boat, with a sail and a flag. They were happy.
But then, they saw a duck. The duck was hungry. It saw the boat and thought it was food. It swam to the boat and bit the sail. The boat tipped over and sank.
Tom and Sam were sad. They ran to the duck and shouted. "Bad duck! Give us back our boat!" The duck was scared. It quacked and flew away.
Tom and Sam looked at the pond. They could not see their boat. It was gone. They cried and hugged each other. They wished they had a different toy.

Once upon a time, in a big green forest, there was a little red bird named Tim. Tim was a very foolish bird. He liked to carry things in his beak and show off to his friends. One day, Tim found a shiny stone near a pond. He was so happy and wanted to show everyone.
Tim carried the shiny stone to his friend, the big brown bear. "Look at my shiny stone!" said Tim. The big brown bear looked at the shiny stone and said, "That's nice, Tim. But be careful not to drop it in the pond!"
Tim did not listen to the big brown bear. He wanted to show the shiny stone to his friend, the tiny green frog. As Tim flew over the pond, he dropped the shiny stone. It fell into the water with a big splash. Tim was so sad.
The tiny green frog saw what happened and jumped into the pond. With a big smile, the tiny green frog carried the shiny stone back to Tim. Tim was so happy and said, "Thank you, tiny green frog! I will be more careful next time."
From that day on, Tim was not foolish anymore. He learned to be careful and listen to his friends. And they all lived happily ever after in the big green forest.

Once upon a time, there was a little sheep. This sheep had incredible soft wool. The sheep liked to play with his friends in the field. They would run and jump all day long.
One day, the sheep saw something sharp on the ground. It was a pointy rock. The sheep wanted to keep playing, but he knew the sharp rock could hurt his friends. So, he decided to do something about it.
The sheep used his soft wool to cover the sharp rock. Now, the rock was safe, and his friends could play without getting hurt. The sheep felt happy and proud. His incredible wool had saved the day, and they all played together again.

Once upon a time, there was a little fish named Fin. Fin loved to race with his friends in the sea. They would swim as fast as they could, and Fin always tried his best to win.
One day, Fin decided he wanted to be independent and race by himself. He swam away from his friends and started to race alone. As he swam, he saw many new things in the sea. He saw big rocks, tall plants, and colorful fish he had never seen before.
Fin was happy being independent, but he missed racing with his friends. So, he swam back to his friends and asked if they wanted to race again. They all said yes, and they had a great time racing together in the sea. Fin learned that it was fun to be independent, but it was also fun to race and play with his friends.

Once upon a time, there were two parents, Mom and Dad, who went on a journey. Dad said, "Where should we go?" Mom replied, "Let's go to the original place we visited when we first met." So they adventure to the campground they had visited before.
On the way, they saw a sign that said, "Recommend a friend!" Mom and Dad were excited, so they decided to ask their friends. The first person they asked said, "The lake is great!" So they decided to go to the lake.
When they got there, all of their friends were waiting with a surprise. Everyone had built a beautiful, original campfire, and they cooked yummy food. Mom and Dad smiled and hugged each other. They were so thankful.
The night was lovely. The sun was slowly setting, and the stars were twinkling. Mom and Dad enjoyed the wonderful evening and thanked their friends for the incredible recommendation. 
From then on, Mom and Dad looked forward to the sunset with great anticipation, and the original campfire reminded them of their special day.

One sunny day, Carlton and his dad went to the beach. Carlton wanted to learn how to swim, and his dad said, "I'll teach you to manage!"
They waded into the ocean, slowly at first. When they got to the reef, Carlton was so excited. He said, "Daddy, the water is so cool!"
His dad taught him how to manage. He floated on his back and moved his arms and legs. When Carlton didn't feel tired, his dad said, "Good job! You are managing so well."
The next day, Carlton and his dad went back to the beach. Carlton wanted to keep managing, and he quickly learned how to float on his own. He was getting so good at managing, he couldn't wait to show his mom.

Once upon a time, there was a lucky ranch. It had lots of animals and people spent lots of time there. Then one day, the ranch was sold to a new owner. 
This made the animals and people very sad. They were used to spending time at the ranch and now they would have to find somewhere new. 
But then something amazing happened. It turned out that the new owner was very kind. He wanted everyone to keep visiting so he opened the ranch as a fun day camp! 
Now, everyone gets to spend time at the ranch and have lots of fun. Everyone is so lucky to have this special place. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily was going to church with her mom and dad. She was very excited because she loved to sing songs at church. But today, Lily was a bit selfish and didn't want to share her toys with other kids.
At church, Lily played with her toys alone. She didn't let other kids play with her toys. The other kids were sad, and Lily started to worry. She thought, "Maybe I should share my toys with them." But she was too scared to do it.
Then, something unexpected happened. A kind boy named Tom came to Lily and gave her a big, shiny toy car. Lily was so happy and surprised! Tom said, "I want to share my toy with you, Lily." Lily learned that sharing was fun and not scary. She decided to share her toys with the other kids too. They all played happily together, and Lily was not selfish anymore.

One day, a little girl named Sue was in the kitchen with her mom. Sue was very troubled because she wanted to help her mom cook, but her mom said, "No, Sue. You're too little to use the oven."
Sue's mom had to go to the store, so she warned Sue, "Do not touch the oven while I'm gone. It's very hot and could hurt you." Sue nodded and promised she wouldn't touch it.
While her mom was gone, Sue saw a cookie sheet on the table. She thought, "Maybe I can put the cookies in the oven for my mom." She forgot her mom's warning and opened the oven. The hot air came out and Sue felt scared. She quickly closed the oven door and decided to wait for her mom.
When her mom came back, Sue told her what happened. Her mom was happy that Sue was safe and said, "Thank you for telling me, Sue. Remember to always listen to warnings. They are there to keep you safe."
From that day on, Sue always listened to warnings and stayed safe. She learned that it's important to listen to her mom and to not do things she's not ready for.

One day, Joe was feeling a bit sleepy and decided to have a nap. His dad gave him a dictionary to read, in case he woke up. As Joe was getting ready to have a nap, he accidentally broke the dictionary. His dad saw what had happened and got very angry.
"Joe, why did you break my dictionary!?", Joe's dad asked.
Joe was too scared to answer and he started to cry. Joe's dad was so angry that he didn't want to talk anymore, he just took Joe to his room and slammed the door.
Joe was very sad, he lay on his bed and didn't want to move. He was devastated that he had broken his dad's dictionary, and he was very scared of what was going to happen now.
The next day when Joe woke up, his dad hadn't said anything about the broken dictionary. He just stayed in his room, with the broken dictionary on the floor. Joe knew that his dad was still angry and that he didn't want to talk to him. From then on, Joe and his dad never talked about the broken dictionary again.

One day, a little girl named Lucy went for a walk. She saw a person sitting on a bench. The person was looking at a map. Lucy thought the person looked lost. She went to the person and said, "Do you need help?"
The person was very impatient. They said, "Yes, I cannot find the park on this map." Lucy took the map to examine it. She looked at the map very closely. Then, she saw something unexpected. The map was upside down!
Lucy turned the map right side up and said, "Here is the park!" The person was very happy. They said, "Thank you, Lucy!" Lucy and the person went to the park together. They had a great time playing and laughing. The person was not impatient anymore.

One day, a boy named Tim wanted to paint. He was eager to paint a picture of the busy traffic outside. He saw big cars, small cars, and a big bus. Tim loved all the colors and sounds of the traffic.
But Tim's mom said, "No, you cannot paint right now. It is time for lunch." Tim was sad. He really wanted to paint the traffic. He did not want to eat lunch. He wanted to paint now.
After lunch, Tim's mom said, "Now you can paint." Tim was happy. He painted the traffic with all the colors he saw. He showed his mom, and she was proud. Tim was happy he waited to paint.

Lily and Tom are playing in the park. They like to run and jump and slide. They see a big light in the sky. It is yellow and bright. It is the sun.
"Look, Lily, the sun is smiling at us!" Tom says. He points to the sun.
Lily laughs. She thinks Tom is silly. "The sun is not smiling, Tom. The sun is just a light. It does not have a face."
Tom does not agree. He thinks Lily is silly. "The sun does have a face, Lily. It has eyes and a nose and a mouth. It is happy to see us."
They start to argue. They yell at each other. They do not listen to each other. They are not having fun.
A bird flies by. It sees Lily and Tom. It hears them yell. It thinks they are silly too. It lands on a branch near them. It makes a loud noise. It sounds like "squawk, squawk, squawk!"
Lily and Tom stop yelling. They look at the bird. They are surprised. They think the bird is funny. They laugh.
The bird flies away. It is happy. It likes to make people laugh.
Lily and Tom look at each other. They are sorry. They hug.
They look at the sun again. They see it is still bright. They think it is beautiful.
They decide to play together. They do not yell anymore. They are happy too.

Once upon a time, there was a crab. The crab was great at dancing. All the fish in the sea would watch the crab dance. They would clap and cheer. The crab was very happy.
One day, the crab met a little fish. The little fish was sad. The crab asked, "Why are you sad?" The little fish said, "I do not believe I can dance like you." The crab smiled and said, "I will help you."
The crab and the little fish practiced dancing together. Soon, the little fish started to believe. They danced and danced. All the fish in the sea came to watch. The crab and the little fish were very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a big lawn. On this lawn, there were many cheap toys. A boy named Tim and a girl named Sarah liked to play there. They both wanted the same toy, a red ball.
Tim said, "I want the red ball." Sarah said, "No, I want it." They did not know what to do. They did not want to fight, but they both wanted the ball.
A nice dog came to them. The dog said, "Why not take turns? I suggest Tim gets the ball first, then Sarah." Tim and Sarah thought it was a good idea. They played with the red ball and had a lot of fun.

One day, a little boy named Tim was very restless. He wanted to do something fun. So, he went to his mom and asked if they could make popcorn. His mom said yes, and they went to the kitchen.
In the kitchen, Tim's mom put the popcorn in a big pan. She told Tim to turn the pan on the fire. But Tim turned it too high! The popcorn started to pop very fast. It was too much!
Tim's mom quickly turned off the fire. The popcorn stopped popping. Tim was sad because he thought he ruined the popcorn. But his mom said it was okay. They tried again, and this time, Tim turned the fire just right. They enjoyed their popcorn together, and Tim was not restless anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a little train. Its engine was old and loud, but the little train was very happy with it. Every day it would meet all the other trains on the railway, and they would talk and share stories. But one train was very envious. It was brand new and had a much better engine than the little train. It wished that its engine could be just like the little train's engine.
One day, the little train’s engine broke down. It couldn’t move. The envious train was thrilled. It thought this was the perfect chance for it to get its wish. It slyly suggested to the little train that it should switch engines.
But the little train answered, "No thank you. Even though my engine is old, it is still my best friend. We can't switch."
The envious train was so surprised. It had never had a friend like that before. It quickly made a new friend with the little train and they have been friends ever since. The little train taught the envious train that there is more to friendship than having the best engine.
<|endoftext|>


Lily and Max were twins who liked to play and have fun. But sometimes they did not behave very well. They did not listen to their mom or dad, and they made a lot of noise and mess.
One day, mom and dad had to go to work, and they left Lily and Max with their grandma. Grandma was very kind and sweet, but she also had some rules. She told Lily and Max to behave and to eat their lunch when she made it.
Lily and Max nodded, but they did not really mean it. As soon as grandma went to the kitchen, they started to run around the house, playing with toys, books, and clothes. They threw things on the floor, on the sofa, and on the bed. They laughed and shouted and did not care about anything.
Grandma heard the noise and came back to the living room. She saw the mess and was very angry. She said, "Lily and Max, what are you doing? This is not how you behave! You have to clean up this mess right now, and then you have to eat your lunch!"
Lily and Max looked at grandma and felt sorry. They said, "We are sorry, grandma. We were just having fun. We will clean up and eat our lunch."
Grandma smiled and said, "Thank you, my dears. I know you like to have fun, but you also have to be respectful and polite. Now, come and see what I made for you. It is something very unusual and yummy!"
Lily and Max followed grandma to the kitchen and saw their lunch. It was a big plate of pancakes with bananas, chocolate, and whipped cream. They had never seen such a lunch before. They said, "Wow, grandma, this is unusual! But it looks so good! Can we try it?"
Grandma said, "Of course, you can. This is a special treat for you, because I love you very much. But you have to promise me that you will behave better from now on, okay?"
Lily and Max nodded and said, "We promise, grandma. We love you too. And we love your unusual lunch!" They hugged grandma and then ate their pancakes with joy. They learned their lesson and decided to behave better from then on.

One day, a purple cat named Luna went to a new place. This place had many fun things to play with. Luna was so happy to be there. But Luna saw a big sign that said, "Do not destroy anything."
Luna met a little dog named Max. Max said, "Hi Luna, let's play with the big ball!" Luna and Max played with the big ball and had lots of fun. But then, Luna saw a big tower made of blocks. She wanted to play with it too.
Luna said, "Max, let's play with the blocks!" Max said, "No, Luna, we can't. We will destroy it." But Luna didn't listen. She jumped on the tower and it fell down. All the blocks were all over the place.
Luna felt bad for destroying the tower. She said, "I'm sorry, Max. I shouldn't have destroyed it." Max said, "It's okay, Luna. Let's build it again together." So Luna and Max built a new tower with the blocks. They were more careful this time and did not destroy anything else. They had fun and played together all day.

Once upon a time, there was a smooth rock. The rock could sing a song. One day, the rock met a big bird. The bird was very strong. The rock and the bird became friends. They played together every day.
One day, the bird and the rock found a big wall. The wall was blocking their way. The bird had an idea. The bird said, "I can destroy the wall with my strong wings." The rock was happy. The bird started to hit the wall with its wings.
But, the wall did not break. The wall was too strong. Then, the rock had an idea. The rock started to sing its song. The wall started to shake. The wall broke into small pieces. The bird and the rock were very happy. They could play together again. The rock's song was more powerful than they thought.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a little lion named Leo. Leo had bright eyes and loved to play with his friends. One day, Leo heard a loud noise. It was a big roar! Leo was scared but wanted to find out where the roar came from.
Leo looked around with his bright eyes and saw a big cave. He thought the roar might have come from inside the cave. He was scared, but he wanted to be brave like his dad. So, he took a deep breath and went into the cave.
Inside the cave, Leo found a big bear. The bear was sad because he had a thorn in his paw. Leo was brave and helped the bear take the thorn out. The bear was so happy that he roared again, but this time it was a happy roar. Leo and the bear became best friends and played together every day.

Once there was a little girl named Sarah. She was very happy and always had a smile on her face. One day, Sarah was playing in her backyard when she spotted a small pass that her mom had made for her. She went over and stood by the pass, excited to use it.
That's when she spotted her friend Molly standing on the other side of the pass. Sarah waved and called out to Molly, "Hi Molly!" Molly waved back and shouted, "Hi Sarah!" 
Sarah was so excited to meet Molly on the other side of the pass, so she jumped up and down and shouted, "Let's play together!" Molly nodded eagerly and they crossed the pass to play together.
The moral of the story is that you can be very happy when you stand with friends and welcome them into your life. Sharing and working together is always a better choice than standing alone.

Tom and Sam were brothers who liked to play in the park. They saw a big slide and ran to it. Tom wanted to go first, but Sam was faster. He climbed up the ladder and sat on the slide. Tom was angry and shouted, "Move, Sam! It's my turn!"
Sam did not listen. He smiled and said, "No, Tom. I go first. You are too slow." He pushed his feet and slid down the slide. He laughed and said, "That was fun!"
Tom was more angry. He climbed up the ladder and saw Sam waiting at the bottom. He wanted to make Sam fall. He thought, "I will push him hard and he will cry." He did not see the guard who was watching them.
The guard saw Tom and knew he was going to be foolish. He said, "Stop, Tom! Don't push your brother. That is not nice. You can hurt him and yourself." He walked to the slide and reached for Tom.
But Tom did not stop. He pushed Sam with his hands and said, "Ha, ha, Sam! Take that!" He did not know that Sam was ready. Sam moved to the side and dodged Tom's push. Tom lost his balance and fell off the slide. He landed on the ground and hurt his knee. He cried and said, "Ow, ow, ow!"
The guard picked up Tom and said, "See, Tom? That was foolish. You should not push your brother. You should share and be kind. Now you have a boo-boo and you need a band-aid." He took Tom to his mom and gave him a band-aid.
Sam felt sorry for Tom. He said, "I'm sorry, Tom. I should not have teased you. You can go first next time." He hugged Tom and said, "Let's play something else. How about the swings?"
Tom said, "Okay, Sam. I'm sorry, too. I should not have pushed you. You are my brother and I love you." He hugged Sam and said, "Let's go to the swings. Maybe the guard will push us." They ran to the swings and had fun. The guard smiled and said, "That's better. Good boys."

Tim asked the dog, "Please give me my toy back." But the dog did not yield. The dog ran away with the toy. Tim cried and went home. He missed his intelligent toy very much. The story had a bad ending.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a boy named Tim. Tim was a happy boy who loved to play with his friends. One day, Tim and his friends wanted to have a meeting. They wanted to talk about a new game they could play.
At the meeting, Tim's friend, Sam, showed everyone a big, fake toy. It looked like a real toy, but it was not. Sam told everyone that they could play a game with the fake toy. They would take turns trying to make the toy yield, or give in, by pressing a button.
Tim and his friends started to play the game. They took turns pressing the button on the fake toy, but nothing happened. They tried harder and harder, but the toy would not yield. They started to get sad and upset. The game was not fun anymore.
In the end, the friends stopped playing with the fake toy. They were not happy, and the meeting was a bad one. Tim and his friends learned that sometimes, it is better to play with real toys and have fun together, rather than trying to make something fake work.

Once upon a time, there was a kind old man who lived in a small house near the woods. Every day, the man went to the woods to find something special.
One day, as he was walking in the woods, he saw a cherry tree and he was eager to pick some cherries. As he was reaching to pick a cherry, a squirrel jumped in his way to prevent him from reaching the cherries.
"What are you doing?" said the old man. "You are preventing me from getting cherries!"
"I'm sorry old man," said the squirrel, "But I must prevent you from picking cherries. These are my cherries."
The old man looked at the squirrel with kindness. He said, "I understand you. You don't have to worry. I won't take your cherries."
The squirrel smiled at the old man and let him pick a few cherries. The old man thanked the squirrel and went home with his cherries.

Once upon a time there was a raven who wanted to stand on a tree. But the trees in the forest were very tall. So the raven decided to build a ladder. 
The raven asked her friends, the birds, if they had a ladder they could give her. But they all said they didn't have one.
The raven said, "I guess I will have to buy a ladder. But they are so expensive." 
But then one of her friends, the robin, said, "I know a place where you can get one really cheap." So the raven followed the robin to the store. 
The raven was so happy when she found the perfect ladder. It was just the right size and it was so cheap! She bought it and thanked the robin for helping her. 
Then the raven carried the ladder to the tree, set it up and finally she could stand on top of the tree. 
The End.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a little rabbit named Remy. Remy had a friend named Tommy the Turtle. They liked to play together.
One day, Remy and Tommy had a race. Remy could move very fast with his big feet, but Tommy was slow. Remy said, "I will win the race because I am faster!" Tommy said, "We will see, my friend."
As they raced, Remy was far ahead of Tommy. Remy was jealous of Tommy's strong shell and wanted to find one too. So, Remy stopped to look for a shell. While Remy was looking, Tommy kept moving.
When Remy found a shell, he tried to put it on his back. But it was too big and heavy. Remy could not move fast anymore. Tommy passed Remy and won the race.
Remy learned that it is not good to be jealous of others. We should be happy with what we have and keep moving forward.

Tim thought for a moment and then took off his hat. He gave it to the grumpy man and said, "Here, you can have my hat!" The grumpy man put on the hat and a big smile came on his face. "Thank you, Tim!" he said.
Just then, a big gust of wind came and blew the hat off the grumpy man's head. The hat flew high into the air and landed on a tree branch. Tim and the grumpy man looked up at the hat, and then they looked at each other. They both started to laugh. They knew they could work together to get the hat back. Soon, other trees saw the thin tree with the big palm leaf. They wanted to be kind too. So, they shared their leaves with other trees that did not have many leaves. In the end, all the trees in the town were happy and had many leaves to display. The moral of the story is to be kind and share with others.

Jen and Ben are twins. They like to play in the park. They see a big tree with many loops on it. The loops are brown and dull. They are not shiny or bright.
"Look, Jen, loops!" Ben says. He runs to the tree and tries to pick a loop. But the loop is too high. He jumps and jumps, but he cannot reach it.
"Let me try, Ben," Jen says. She is taller than Ben. She picks a loop from the tree. She holds it in her hand. It is hard and rough. She does not like it.
"This loop is not fun," Jen says. She throws the loop away. It lands on the grass.
"Let's find something else to play with," Ben says. He agrees with Jen. The loops are not fun.
They run to the slide. The slide is shiny and smooth. They slide down and laugh. They have fun. They forget about the loops.

Lily and Max are friends. They like to play together. But today, Lily is restless. She does not want to play with Max's cars or dolls. She wants to do something new.
"Let's do yoga!" Lily says to Max. "Yoga is fun and good for you. You can stretch and bend and breathe."
Max does not know what yoga is. He thinks it sounds strange. He likes to run and jump and kick. He does not want to stretch and bend and breathe.
"What is yoga?" Max asks Lily. "Is it a game? Is it a toy? How do you play it?"
Lily shows Max her yoga mat. She says it is a soft place to do yoga. She rolls it out on the floor. She tells Max to sit on it with her.
"Yoga is not a game or a toy. It is a way to move your body and calm your mind. You can do different poses and follow your breath. It is easy and fun. I will show you." Lily says.
Lily starts to do some yoga poses. She does a cat pose, a dog pose, a tree pose, and a butterfly pose. She tells Max to copy her. Max tries to do the same, but he feels silly and bored. He does not like yoga. He wants to play something else.
"Yoga is not fun. It is hard and boring. I don't want to do it. Let's play something else." Max says.
Lily is sad. She likes yoga. She thinks it is fun and good for her. She wants Max to like it too. She does not want to play something else.
"Yoga is fun. It is easy and good for you. You just have to try it. Please, Max, do yoga with me." Lily says.
Max and Lily look at each other. They are friends. They do not want to make each other sad. They want to have fun together. They decide to compromise.
"OK, Lily, I will do yoga with you for a little bit. But then, you have to play with me something I like. Deal?" Max says.
"Deal, Max. Thank you for trying yoga with me. I will play with you something you like. What do you want to play?" Lily says.
Max thinks for a moment. He smiles. He has an idea.
"Let's play tag! Tag is fun and good for you. You can run and jump and chase. It is easy and fun. I will show you." Max says.
Lily agrees. She likes tag. She thinks it is fun and good for her. She wants to play with Max. She rolls up her yoga mat. She gets ready to run.
"OK, Max, let's play tag. But first, you have to catch me. I am fast and smart. You can't catch me. Ready, set, go!" Lily says.
Max and Lily start to play tag. They run and jump and chase. They laugh and shout. They have fun together. They are not restless anymore. They are happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tom. He loved to play with his toy grill. One day, Tom's mom asked him to be patient and wait. She told him that she needed to wash the grill first. Tom didn't want to wait, but he knew that he should listen to his mom.
Tom sat and watched as his mom washed the grill. She used water and soap to make it nice and clean. When the grill was all clean, Tom's mom said, "There you go, Tom. Now you can play with your grill."
Tom was so happy to have his clean grill. He played with it all day, pretending to cook yummy food for his family. His mom was proud of him for being patient and waiting while she washed the grill. They had a fun day together, and Tom learned that sometimes it's good to wait.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim liked to climb. He climbed trees, rocks, and even his bed. One day, he saw a big hill. Tim wanted to climb the hill.
As Tim climbed, he met a girl named Sue. Sue had a toy car. Tim had a toy boat. They decided to trade. Tim gave Sue the boat and Sue gave Tim the car. They were both happy with their trade.
Tim and Sue climbed to the top of the hill together. The sun was shining and the sky was brilliant. They played with their new toys and had a great time. They became best friends and climbed the hill every day.
<|endoftext|>
One day, a blue bird and a little dog were playing in the park. They were very happy. The sun was shining and the sky was blue.
Suddenly, they heard a loud noise. It was an emergency! A big tree had fallen down and was blocking the road. The blue bird and the little dog looked at each other and knew they had to help.
The blue bird said, "Let's discuss what to do!" The little dog agreed. They talked and decided the blue bird would fly up high to look for help, while the little dog would bark loudly to warn others about the tree.
The blue bird found a strong man who could move the tree. The little dog's barking helped keep everyone safe. In the end, the big tree was moved and the road was clear again.
The blue bird and the little dog were heroes! They were so proud of themselves. They went back to playing in the park, happy that they could help in an emergency.
<|endoftext|>


Sara and Ben are twins. They like to play with their toys in their room. But sometimes they make a big mess. They throw their toys on the floor and do not put them back in the box.
One day, Mom comes to their room and sees the mess. She is not happy. She says, "Sara and Ben, you have to clean up your room. You cannot waste your toys like this. They will break or get lost. And you have to share your toys with each other. Do you understand?"
Sara and Ben nod their heads. They do not want to make Mom sad. They start to pick up their toys and put them in the box. But Sara sees a doll that she likes. It is Ben's doll. She takes it and says, "This is mine now. I want to play with it."
Ben sees Sara take his doll. He is angry. He says, "No, that is my doll. Give it back to me. You have your own doll. You are not nice."
Sara and Ben start to fight. They pull the doll from each other. They yell and cry. The doll's arm breaks. They both feel bad.
Mom hears the noise and comes back to their room. She sees the broken doll and the tears on their faces. She is sad and angry. She says, "Sara and Ben, what have you done? You have broken your toy. You have hurt each other. You have not listened to me. You have to say sorry to each other and hug. And you have to fix the doll. Do you understand?"
Sara and Ben nod their heads. They feel sorry. They say sorry to each other and hug. They are pale from crying. They try to fix the doll. They use tape and glue. They make the doll look better. They smile and say, "We love you, doll. We love you, Mom. We love you, Sara. We love you, Ben."
Mom sees them and smiles. She says, "I love you, Sara. I love you, Ben. I am proud of you. You have learned your lesson. You have cleaned up your room. You have shared your toys. You have fixed your toy. You have hugged. You are good twins." She hugs them and kisses them. They hug her and kiss her. They are happy.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim liked to drink juice. Every day, he would go to the park with his mom. In the park, there was a stand that sold juice. Tim would always ask his mom if he could get some juice to drink.
One day, Tim saw a new friend at the park. Her name was Sue. Sue was sitting on a comfortable bench. Tim went to Sue and said, "Hi! Do you want to drink juice with me?" Sue said, "Yes! I like juice too!"
Tim and Sue went to the juice stand with their moms. They both got a big cup of juice to drink. They sat on the comfortable bench together, drinking their juice and laughing. From that day on, Tim and Sue became best friends who loved to drink juice at the park.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toy boat. One day, Lily found a small bulb in her garden. She was very enthusiastic and thought it was a treasure. She put the bulb in her pocket and went to show her mom.
Her mom told her that the bulb was a special seed. If she planted it and took good care of it, it would grow into a beautiful flower. Lily was excited and planted the bulb in a pot. Every day, she would water it and rock the pot gently, like her toy boat.
As the days passed, the bulb started to grow. Lily was so happy to see the little plant grow bigger and bigger. One day, she found a beautiful flower blooming from the plant. The flower was as bright as the sun and smelled very nice. Lily knew that her love and care had made the flower grow, and she felt very proud.
