Once upon a time, there was a giant. The giant lived in a big, bright house. The house was on a tall hill. The giant was very kind and liked to help people.
One day, the giant saw a little boy. The little boy was sad. He lost his toy. The giant wanted to help the little boy. The giant said, "I will send my bird to find your toy."
The giant sent his big bird to look for the toy. The bird flew high in the sky. It saw the bright, shiny toy on the ground. The bird picked up the toy and brought it back to the giant.
The giant gave the toy to the little boy. The boy was very happy. He said, "Thank you, giant!" The giant smiled. The boy and the giant became good friends. They played together every day.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a wealthy lady who loved to dance. She wore a big, red dress and danced in her big house. She had many gifts, but she wanted more friends to dance with her.
One day, a small, funny cat came to her house. The cat knocked on the door and said, "I want to dance with you!" The lady was happy and let the cat in. They danced and laughed all day long.
But then, the cat did something unexpected. It took off its fur and turned into a little girl! The little girl said, "I was a cat, but now I am a girl! Let's be friends and dance forever!" The wealthy lady was so surprised, but she was very happy to have a new friend. They danced together and shared their gifts with each other.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a lovely little duck named Ducky. Ducky lived near a pond with his family. Every day, they would swim and play in the water.
One day, Ducky's mom mentioned a tap near the pond. She said, "Never go near that tap, Ducky. It's not safe for little ducks like you." Ducky listened to his mom, but he was curious about the tap.
One sunny day, Ducky saw the tap and decided to go near it. As he got closer, he saw a big frog sitting on the tap. The frog said, "Hello, Ducky! I can make this tap give you a fun surprise!" Ducky was excited and asked the frog to show him. The frog turned the tap, and out came a lot of bubbles! Ducky was so happy, he played with the bubbles all day.
In the end, Ducky learned that it's important to listen to his mom, but also that sometimes, surprises can be fun. And he made a new friend, the big frog.
<|endoftext|>


Lily and Ben are playing with their toys in the living room. Lily has a doll and Ben has a top. Ben likes to spin his top and watch it go round and round. Lily likes to dress her doll and comb her hair.
"Look at my top, Lily!" Ben says. "It is so fast and shiny!"
Lily looks at Ben's top for a moment, then goes back to her doll. She does not care about tops. She thinks dolls are more important.
"Look at my doll, Ben!" Lily says. "She is so pretty and soft!"
Ben looks at Lily's doll for a moment, then goes back to his top. He does not care about dolls. He thinks tops are more important.
They play by themselves, not talking to each other. They stare at their own toys and ignore the other.
Mom comes into the living room and sees Lily and Ben. She smiles and says, "What are you playing, my sweeties?"
Lily and Ben look at Mom and say, "We are playing with our toys, Mom!"
Mom nods and says, "That's nice, but do you know what is more important than toys?"
Lily and Ben shake their heads and say, "No, Mom, what is more important than toys?"
Mom hugs them and says, "You are, my sweeties. You are more important than any toy. You are my precious children and I love you very much."
Lily and Ben smile and hug Mom back. They say, "We love you too, Mom!"
They put down their toys and cuddle with Mom. They forget about their top and their doll. They are happy and warm.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there lived a dog named Spot. Spot was a very upset dog. He was always hungry and wanted some meat to eat. One day, Spot saw a big piece of meat on the table in a house. He really wanted it.
Spot went to the house and tried to speak to the people inside. He said, "Woof, woof! Can I have some meat, please?" But the people did not understand Spot. They just looked at him and said, "Go away, dog!" Spot was very sad.
Spot tried to find another way to get the meat. He climbed up a tree near the house and jumped onto the roof. But he slipped and fell down. Spot was hurt and still very hungry. He did not get the meat and the people were still upset with him.

Once upon a time, there was a dependable dog named Spot. Spot loved to play with his sheet. He would run and jump and fetch the sheet all day long. Spot's best friend was a little boy named Tim. Tim and Spot played together every day.
One day, Spot and Tim were playing with the sheet in the park. A big, mean dog came up and wanted to play too. The big dog said, "Give me the sheet!" He was very demanding. Spot didn't want to give up his sheet, but the big dog was very big and scary.
Spot tried to be brave and said, "No, this is my sheet!" But the big dog didn't listen. He took the sheet from Spot and ran away. Spot and Tim were very sad. They went home without their sheet and never saw it again.
<|endoftext|>

Mommy took Lily to the safari. Lily loved looking at all the animals. She saw lions, tigers and monkeys. Everywhere she looked she saw something fun.
At the safari, Mommy paid for the tickets. They went to the zoo part of the safari. There were lots of animals to see. Lily was very busy looking at the animals and taking pictures.
She saw a giraffe. It was so tall! Then she saw a zebra. It had black and white stripes. There were also lots of monkeys swinging around in the trees.
Later, they went to the amusement part of the safari. Mommy paid for Lily to go on all the fun rides. They went on a train, a roller coaster and a ferris wheel. 
The safari was so much fun! Lily was very tired after a long day of being busy, but she had a smile on her face. It was the best day ever!

One sunny day, Andy and his mom walked in the woods. Andy was curious and wanted to explore everything. Suddenly, they heard a loud noise coming from the nearby bushes. Andy's mom grabbed his hand and said, "Let's follow it." 
They walked a bit and saw a baby animal - it was a prune. Its big eyes looked curiously at the two of them. Andy's mom said, "It's a baby prune. Let's take it home and take care of it." Andy wanted to keep it, so he nodded and smiled.
On the way home, the prune was running in the woods, and Andy and his mom were following it. They soon made it home and the prune followed them inside. 
 Andy and his mom were happy to have the prune as a pet and they named it Pruney. From that day forward, Andy and Pruney were the best of friends. Pruney liked to explore and follow Andy everywhere he went - even around the whole world.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. She lived near a big lake. One day, Mia saw a kayak on the lake. She wanted to try it.
Mia went to her mom and asked if she could go in the kayak. Her mom said yes, but she needed to speak to her dad first. Mia went to her dad and told him about the kayak. Her dad said it was okay, but she needed to be careful.
Mia went back to the lake and got in the kayak. She paddled around and had lots of fun. But then, she saw something in the water. It was a big, disgusting fish! Mia didn't like the fish, so she paddled away. She went back to her mom and dad and told them about her adventure. They were happy that she had fun, but they all agreed that the disgusting fish was not nice.
<|endoftext|>


Lily and Ben are twins. They like to play with their toys. They have many cars, big and small, red and blue, fast and slow. They like to race them on the floor.
One day, Mom says, "It is time to go to the park. You can bring one car each. Choose your car and put on your shoes."
Lily and Ben run to their toy box. They look at all the cars. Lily picks a big red car. She likes how it makes noise and has lights. Ben picks a small blue car. He likes how it is smooth and shiny.
They put on their shoes and go to the door. Mom takes their hands and they walk to the car. Lily and Ben put their cars on the seat next to them.
At the park, they see a big hill. They want to race their cars down the hill. They run to the top and get ready.
"Ready, set, go!" Lily says. She pushes her big red car. It goes fast and loud. Ben pushes his small blue car. It goes slow and quiet.
Lily's car reaches the bottom first. She cheers and claps. "I win, I win! My car is the best!"
Ben's car stops halfway. He frowns and sighs. "My car is stupid. It is too slow."
Lily runs to Ben and hugs him. "No, your car is not stupid. It is just different. I like your car. It is smooth and shiny. Do you want to trade?"
Ben smiles and nods. "Yes, I want to trade. Thank you, Lily. You are a good sister."
They trade their cars and race again. This time, Ben's car wins. He cheers and claps. "I win, I win! Your car is the best!"
Lily's car stops halfway. She laughs and shrugs. "My car is not the best. It is just different. I like your car. It makes noise and has lights. Do you want to trade back?"
Ben smiles and nods. "Yes, I want to trade back. Thank you, Lily. You are a good sister."
They trade their cars back and hug. They play with their cars until Mom says, "It is time to go home. You had fun with your cars. You are good twins."
Lily and Ben say, "Yes, we had fun. We are good twins. We love our cars. We love each other." They put their cars in their pockets and hold Mom's hands. They go back to the car and go home.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Bob. Bob loved to hop all day long. One day, he saw a big mountain and wanted to hop to the top.
As Bob hopped up the mountain, he met a bird named Sue. Sue asked, "Where are you going, Bob?" Bob said, "I am hopping to the top of the mountain!" Sue decided to fly with Bob as he hopped up the mountain.
As they went up the mountain, they found a big, shiny rock. The rock could talk! The rock said, "I am a magic rock! I can make one wish come true." Bob and Sue were so happy. Bob wished for a big pile of carrots, and Sue wished for a big pile of seeds. They both shared their food and had a big party on the mountain. They never knew that they would find a magic rock on their journey, but it made their trip even more fun.

Lily and Mia are sisters. They like to play with their mom's makeup. They think it is pretty and fun. One day, they sneak into mom's room and find her makeup bag. They open it and see many colors and shapes.
"Look, Mia, this is lipstick. It makes your lips red," Lily says. She puts some on her mouth and smiles.
"Wow, you look like a princess, Lily. Can I try?" Mia asks. She grabs the lipstick from Lily and puts some on her mouth too.
But Mia puts too much. The lipstick goes out of her lips and onto her cheeks and nose. She looks like a clown.
"Hey, give it back! You are wasting it!" Lily says. She tries to take the lipstick from Mia, but Mia holds it tight.
"No, it's mine! I want to play with it!" Mia says. She pushes Lily away.
Lily gets angry. She strikes Mia on the arm. Mia cries out and strikes Lily back. They start to fight and pull each other's hair.
Mom hears the noise and comes into the room. She sees the girls fighting and the makeup all over their faces and clothes. She is shocked and angry.
"What are you doing? This is not how you play with makeup! This is not how you treat your sister! You are both in big trouble!" Mom says. She takes the makeup bag and the lipstick from the girls. She makes them clean up and say sorry to each other.
Lily and Mia feel bad. They hug and apologize. They promise to not play with mom's makeup again.
Mom forgives them and gives them a hug too. She says they can have some yummy cookies as a snack. The girls are happy and go to the kitchen. They decide to play with something else next time.

Once upon a time, in a peaceful town, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was very excited for his birthday. He wanted to have a big party with all his friends.
On the day of Tim's birthday, his friend Sam came over. Sam saw the big cake on the table. "Wow, that's a big cake!" said Sam. Tim smiled and said, "Yes, it's for all of us to share!"
But then, a big, mean dog came into the town. The dog was angry and wanted to destroy everything. The dog saw Tim's birthday party and ran towards it. Tim, Sam, and their friends were scared.
The big, mean dog jumped on the table and destroyed the big cake. Tim started to cry. His birthday was ruined, and his friends were sad too.
The big, mean dog left the town, and the once peaceful town was not peaceful anymore. Tim's birthday was not happy, and everyone was sad.

Lily opened the package and found a big, red ball. She wanted to play with it right away. She took the ball outside and started to play. Suddenly, the ball started to burn! Lily was scared and didn't know what to do.
Then, a nice fireman came and put out the fire. He told Lily that the ball was magic and could only be played with in the water. So, Lily took the ball to the pool and had lots of fun playing with her new magic ball in the water.

Once upon a time, on a bright day, there was a graceful bird named Bella. Bella loved to fly high in the sky and play with her friends. She had the most beautiful wings and all her friends liked her.
One day, while Bella was flying, she saw a big tree. She wanted to sit on the tree and rest for a while. But when she tried to land, she did not see a branch and started to fall. Bella was scared.
Just then, her friend, a kind squirrel, saw her falling. He quickly ran up the tree and caught Bella in his arms. Bella was safe and happy. She thanked her friend and they played together for the rest of the day.

Once upon a time, a unique zebra liked to wander in the big jungle. He had fun playing with his friends. They would run, jump, and laugh all day long. The zebra was special because he had rainbow stripes. All the other animals loved his colors.
One day, the zebra wandered far away from his friends. He saw a big tree and wanted to see what was behind it. As he went around the tree, he found a big mirror. The zebra looked in the mirror and saw his rainbow stripes. He was so happy and proud of his colors.
But then, something unexpected happened. The mirror changed the zebra's stripes to black and white, just like all the other zebras. The zebra was sad, but he went back to his friends. When they saw him, they were surprised. They didn't know it was him at first. But they still loved him and played with him. The zebra learned that it's not the colors that make him special, but the love of his friends.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a hidden house. In this house lived a little girl named Lily and her pet bunny, Hop. They were best friends and loved to play together.
One day, while they were playing, they found a big horn. "Wow, look at this horn!" said Lily. But when Lily blew the horn, it made a very loud sound. The sound was so loud that it scared Hop, and he ran away to escape the noise.
Lily was very sad and started to cry. "I need to find Hop," she said. So, she went into the forest to look for him. Lily called out, "Hop, where are you?" After a while, she found Hop hiding behind a tree. Lily hugged Hop and said, "I'm sorry, I didn't mean to scare you." Hop forgave her, and they went back home, happy to be together again. And they never played with the big horn again.

Once upon a time, there was a big cat. The cat was very tired. It saw a soft bed and lay down. The cat let out a big yawn. It was ready to sleep.
Next to the bed, there was a piece of paper. The paper had a clear picture of a little mouse. The cat looked at the picture and smiled. It liked to play with mice.
As the cat slept, it dreamt of the mouse from the paper. The cat and the mouse played together in the dream. They ran and jumped and had so much fun. The cat was happy. And they all lived happily ever after.

Mia was in the park, playing with her toy. She was wearing a bright yellow dress and shoes. Suddenly, she saw a deep puddle of water and ran towards it.
"Mia, watch out!" said her mom. But Mia didn't listen. She already stepped in the deep puddle.
"Mom, look at my shoes, they are so dirty now!" said Mia.
"Ok, don't worry sweetheart. We'll clean them," said mom.
Mia's mom took out a cloth and wiped off the dirt from Mia's yellow shoes.
"There, all clean again!" said her mom.
Mia smiled and thanked her mom. Together, they went to play in the park.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Lily had a favorite pillow. She loved her pillow very much. It was soft, fluffy, and made her feel safe at night. Every night, Lily would hug her pillow tight as she fell asleep.
One day, Lily could not find her pillow. She looked everywhere in her room but it was gone. Lily was very sad. She asked her mom, "Mom, where is my pillow?" Her mom said, "I don't know, Lily. Let's look for it together."
Lily and her mom searched the whole house. They finally found the pillow in the living room, under the big chair. Lily was so happy! She hugged her pillow and said, "I missed you, pillow!"
That night, Lily lay in her bed and gazed at the stars through her window. She felt so safe and happy with her pillow by her side. The stars twinkled, and Lily whispered, "Goodnight, stars. Goodnight, pillow." And then she fell asleep, dreaming of fun adventures with her pillow.

Once upon a time, there was a man named Tom. Tom wanted to build a place to work. He wanted to build a small office. It would be a modest office, not too big or too small.
Tom had a friend named Sue. Sue wanted to help Tom build the office. They talked about how to build it. Tom said, "Sue, let's build the office with bricks." Sue agreed and said, "Great idea, Tom! We can make it strong."
They worked hard to build the modest office. They used bricks and put them together with love. When they finished, they were very happy. Tom said, "Thank you, Sue, for helping me build my office." Sue smiled and said, "You're welcome, Tom. I'm glad I could help."
Now, Tom had a nice place to work. He loved his small office. It was perfect for him. And he was very grateful to have a friend like Sue who helped him build it.

The cat saw dark clouds in the sky. A storm was coming. The cat started to run back to the house. The wind blew and rain fell.
But, the cat did not make it back to the house. The storm picked the cat up into the air. The cat flew far, far away. The grumpy cat was never seen again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She loved to play with her flute. Every day, she would play her flute and dance in her room. She was always alert and listened to the sounds around her.
One day, Amy wanted to make a cake. She put flour, sugar, and eggs in a big bowl. Then, she started to mix them all together. As she mixed, she played her flute and danced around the kitchen.
Amy's mom heard the flute and came into the kitchen. She saw Amy mixing the cake and dancing. She smiled and joined her. They both danced and played the flute together, having a happy and fun day.

Once upon a time, there were two friends: Monica and June. Monica had a big bar of chocolate and June was very jealous because she was not able to have a bar of chocolate too. 
"That's not fair", said June angrily. "I want a bar of chocolate too!"
Monica smiled and said, "It's okay, June! You can have some of mine!" 
So June smiled too and she began to share the chocolate with Monica. They both ate the smooth, tasty chocolate and June was very happy!
When they finished eating, Monica said, "It's nice to share with friends. That's why it's important to forgive when someone does something wrong."
June nodded and said, "That's true! Forgiving feels nice and it make us both happy."
The two friends hugged and shared more chocolate together. They taught each other an important lesson: Forgiveness can make life smooth, sweet and delicious just like chocolate!

Once upon a time, there was a gentle cat named Fluffy. Fluffy loved to sort her toys by color. She had a big box of toys and liked to play with them on the stairs.
One sunny day, Fluffy was sorting her toys on the stair. She put the red toys on one stair, the blue toys on another, and the yellow toys on a third stair. As she was sorting, she heard a little noise coming from the bottom of the stairs.
Fluffy looked down and saw a tiny mouse. The mouse was holding a green toy. Fluffy was surprised! She didn't know that mice liked to play with toys too. The mouse said, "Hi, I'm Squeaky! Can I help you sort your toys?" Fluffy smiled and said, "Yes, let's sort the green toys together!" So, Fluffy and Squeaky became friends and sorted all the toys on the stairs. They had a lot of fun and played together every day.

Once upon a time, in a big nation, there lived a kind queen. She had a big heart and loved to help everyone. The people in the nation were happy because the queen was so nice.
One day, a small, guilty dog came to the queen's castle. It had made a mess in the town. The queen saw the guilty dog and knew it was sad. She wanted to help the dog feel better.
The queen bent down and gave the dog a gentle kiss on its head. The dog felt happy and not guilty anymore. From that day on, the dog stayed with the queen and helped her make the nation a happy place.

One day, a little girl named Sally went to the store with her mom. They needed to buy some things for their house, like food and toys. Sally was very excited because her mom said she could pick a toy for herself. She looked and looked, and finally found a toy she loved. It was a pretty doll with a big, red dress.
At home, Sally played with her new doll. She loved the doll very much. But one day, Sally did something she was not supposed to do. She spread her mom's makeup all over the doll's face. The doll looked funny, and Sally laughed. But then, her mom came into the room and saw the mess.
Her mom said, "Sally, you should not have done that. Now the doll is dirty and I am sad." Sally felt ashamed. She knew she had done something wrong. She said, "I'm sorry, Mom. I will clean the doll and be more careful next time."
Sally and her mom worked together to clean the doll. It took a long time, but they finally got all the makeup off. Sally learned her lesson and never spread makeup on her toys again. And her mom was happy because Sally had learned to be more careful and responsible.

Once upon a time, in a small room, there was a crib. In the crib, there was a baby named Tim. Tim liked to play with his toys and sleep in his crib. He had lots of fun every day. But one day, something happened.
It was a harsh day outside. The wind blew hard and the rain fell. Tim was scared. He wanted his mom and dad to come and make him feel safe. But they were not there. Tim started to cry. He did not like the loud sounds from outside.
Tim wanted to be brave. He thought of a plan. He would rise from his crib and close the window. He held his favorite toy for courage. Tim stood up in his crib, reached for the window, and closed it. The loud sounds were gone. Tim felt proud and happy. He knew he could be brave, even when he was scared.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a long stick. He wanted to bury it in the ground. So, he went outside to the garden with his stick.
Tim started to dig a hole in the ground with his hands. He dug and dug until the hole was big enough. Then, he put the long stick in the hole and covered it with dirt. Tim was very happy that he buried the stick.
Later, Tim went inside his house and saw his mom cleaning the floor. He told her, "Mom, I buried a long stick in the garden!" His mom smiled and said, "That's great, Tim! Now, let's clean the floor together." They cleaned the floor and had fun doing it.

Once upon a time there was a little boy who loved to write. He had lots of paper and pens he used to make lots of stories and pictures. One day, he was writing a story about a powerful fairy. But then something happened! As he was writing, junk started to fly around him. It was huge, bigger than the boy! It was so powerful it filled up the whole room.
The little boy was scared. He tried to write but the junk kept getting in the way. He tried to move but it was too strong. Then, he heard a voice. It said, "Do not be scared, little boy. I can help you!" It was the powerful fairy from his story!
The fairy waved its wand and the junk disappeared. The room was clean and the boy felt much better. The fairy said to him, "Help keep your room clean. Don't let junk get in the way of your story!" The boy thanked the fairy and kept writing. He never had to worry about the junk again.

Once there was a rat who liked to dance. Everywhere he went, he would tap his feet and move to the music. He was the original dancing rat!
He loved to dance in the sunshine, flapping his arms and spinning around. He loved to dance with his friends too. They would join hands and dance in a big circle until they were all exhausted.
One day, the rat went to a big dance party. All of the other animals were there too, dancing and having fun. The rat hopped and danced around, doing all of his best moves. He was the best dancer at the party.
Everyone was having such a blast. Even when it started to rain, the rat would not stop dancing. He kept on dancing even when it was pouring.
When the rain stopped, the rat was the only one left dancing. Everyone was so amazed! He had put on the most original dance show ever. The rat was proud of himself, and from that day forward he always tried to show everyone how much he loved to dance.

One day, a boy named Tim wanted to build a big tower. He found some wood and a staff to help him. Tim started to build the tower in his yard. It was a sunny day and he was happy.
While Tim was building, he saw a mysterious girl. She was watching him from behind a tree. Tim asked, "Who are you?" The girl said, "I am Mia. Can I help you build the tower?" Tim said, "Yes, you can help me."
Tim and Mia built the tower together. But then, a big wind came and knocked the tower down. Tim was sad, but Mia said, "Don't worry, we can build it again." They worked together and built a stronger tower. Tim and Mia became good friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a toy gun that could shoot soft balls. He loved to play with his toy gun in the backyard. One day, he saw a broken tree branch on the ground. He thought it looked like a fun target to shoot.
Tim picked up his toy gun and aimed at the broken branch. Just as he was about to shoot, a little bird flew down and sat on the branch. The bird said, "Please don't shoot me or the branch. I have a nest with my baby birds up in the tree, and they need me."
Tim felt bad and didn't want to hurt the bird or her babies. So, he looked around for something else to shoot. He saw an olive on the ground and thought it would be a great target. He aimed and shot the olive, and it rolled away.
The little bird thanked Tim for not shooting the branch. Tim was happy that he could play and have fun without hurting anyone. From that day on, Tim only shot things that wouldn't hurt anyone, like olives and soft balls. And he and the little bird became good friends.

Sally was so glad. She took the big red ball and sat on the floor. She rolled the ball back and forth, having so much fun. Her cat, Mittens, saw the ball and wanted to play too. Mittens jumped and tried to catch the ball with her paws.
Sally and Mittens played with the big red ball on the floor all day. They were very happy and glad. When it was time to go to bed, Sally gave the ball back to her mom. She said, "Thank you for letting me borrow the big red ball, Mom." Her mom smiled and said, "You're welcome, Sally. I'm glad you had fun."

When Tom went outside, he saw that his friends were not there. He was sad and confused. He looked around and saw that his friends were hiding under the table. They wanted to surprise Tom! They all jumped out and yelled, "Surprise!" Tom was so happy and they all laughed. They ate the sandwiches that Tom served and played all day long.

Once upon a time, there was a little pupil named Tim. Tim went to school every day. He liked to play with his friends and learn new things. But Tim had a problem. He always felt hungry and wanted to eat all the time.
One day, Tim saw a big, yummy cake on the teacher's desk. He knew it was not his, but he felt so hungry. Tim looked around and saw that no one was watching. He went to the desk and took a big bite of the cake. It was so good! But then, he heard a voice.
"Why did you eat my cake?" asked his friend, Lily. Tim felt guilty. He knew it was wrong to eat someone else's cake. "I'm sorry, Lily," Tim said. "I was so hungry, and it looked so good."
Lily was sad, but she forgave Tim. They decided to share the rest of the cake with their friends. From that day on, Tim learned to ask before taking something that was not his. And they all lived happily ever after.

Lily and Tom are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big dog. The dog is brown and fluffy. It has a long tail and a wet nose.
"Can we touch the dog?" Lily asks Tom.
"I don't know. Maybe we should ask the owner first," Tom says.
They look around and see a man sitting on a bench. He is reading a book. He has a leash in his hand. The leash is attached to the dog.
"Excuse me, sir. Can we touch your dog?" Lily says.
The man looks up and smiles. He sees Lily and Tom. They are cute and polite.
"Sure, you can touch my dog. His name is Rover. He is very friendly and loves children," the man says.
Lily and Tom walk towards the dog. They reach out their hands and touch his fur. It is soft and warm. The dog wags his tail and licks their faces. Lily and Tom giggle.
"Hello, Rover. You are a nice dog," Lily says.
"You are a good boy," Tom says.
They pet the dog and play with him. They throw a ball and he fetches it. They rub his belly and he rolls over. They have fun.
But then, they smell something smelly. It is coming from the dog. They pinch their noses and make a face.
"Yuck! What is that smell?" Lily says.
"I think he rolled in something bad," Tom says.
They look at the dog and see some dirt and grass on his fur. They also see some poop.
"Ew! He rolled in poop!" Lily says.
"That's gross!" Tom says.
They run away from the dog and back to the man. They tell him what happened.
"Oh, no! Rover, you naughty dog! You need a bath!" the man says.
He apologizes to Lily and Tom. He says he will take the dog home and clean him. He thanks them for playing with him.
Lily and Tom say goodbye to the man and the dog. They are still friends. They are not mad at the dog. They know he did not mean to be smelly. They hope to see him again. But next time, they hope he will be clean.

Once upon a time, in a big tree, there was a fancy dove. She had pretty feathers and a nice nest. The dove loved to fly in the sky and sing happy songs.
One day, the dove found a big fruit on the ground. It was a round, red fruit. The dove wanted to eat the fruit, but it was too big to carry back to her nest. So, she tried to eat it where it was.
But the fruit started to rot. It got soft and smelly. The fancy dove did not want to eat the rot fruit anymore. She flew away to find something else to eat.
In the end, the fancy dove found a pile of yummy seeds. She ate the seeds and sang a happy song. She learned that it is better to eat fresh food than rot food. And she lived happily ever after in her big tree.

Once upon a time, in a small town, lived a happy old man. He had a big red apple tree in his yard. The tree had many apples. The old man loved to share the apples with the kids in the town.
One day, the old man picked a big apple from the tree. He wanted to give it to a little boy and girl. The kids were very happy to see the big red apple. But they did not want to share the apple. They both wanted the whole apple for themselves.
The happy old man saw this and had an idea. He took the big red apple and split it in half. He gave one half to the boy and the other half to the girl. The kids were now happy to have a piece of the apple each. They said thank you to the old man and went home.
The next day, the boy and girl came back to the old man's house. They had learned that sharing made them feel good. They asked the old man if they could help him pick apples to share with the other kids in the town. The old man was very happy and said yes.
From that day on, the kids learned that sharing made everyone happy. They always helped the old man share his apples with the town. And everyone lived happily ever after.

One day, a boy came to the shop. He saw a toy he liked very much. He asked the man, "How much is this toy?" The man said, "It is five coins." The boy was sad because he had only three coins.
The boy went home and told his mom about the toy. His mom said, "Let's find a way to get more coins." They thought and thought. Then, they had an idea. They decided to sell lemonade in their yard.
The boy and his mom made lemonade and sold it to their neighbors. They got more coins. The boy went back to the shop and bought the toy. He was very happy. The man was happy too because he could help the boy. And they all lived happily ever after.

After they finished eating, Bobo and Lily were very tired. They decided to find a nice place to sleep. They found a big, soft tree with lots of leaves. Once upon a time there was a proud little boy. He loved shiny things, so one day his mommy gave him a beautiful crystal. It shined and sparkled in the sunlight.
The little boy was so excited with his prize that he wanted to show it to everyone. He ran out in the garden, shouting and waving the crystal around.
Suddenly he saw a puddle. Without thinking, he bent down and started to pour the crystal into the puddle. He watched and smiled as the crystal turned the puddle into a sparkling sea.
Just then, his mommy arrived. "Why did you pour the crystal away?" she asked, a bit sadly.
But the little boy's face suddenly lit up. "See how proud the puddle looks now!" he said.
His mommy smiled and hugged her proud little boy. "That was a wonderful gift for the puddle," she said. 
The boy beamed and went back to playing in the garden, happy that he had brought a smile to his mommy's face.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Ben. Ben was very selfish, and he loved candy. Whenever he could, he would pinch the candies from his friend's bags.
One day, Ben went to the store with his friend, and he saw a very big bag of candy. He wanted to pinch it, so he asked his friend:
"Can I have the candy?"
His friend replied, "No, Ben, please don't do it. It's not yours."
But Ben didn't listen, and he reached out to pinch the candy bag. All of a sudden, a big hand swiped Ben's hand away! It was the storekeeper.
The storekeeper was mad and he said, "No one is allowed to pinch the candy from my store. It doesn't matter if you're selfish or not, no one can take the food without permission!"
Ben was so embarrassed that he ran out of the store without saying a word. He learned his lesson that day and never pinched candy again.

One day, Sara sees a new book at the store. It has a big dragon on the cover. Sara likes dragons. She asks her mom if she can have the book. Her mom says no, they have enough books at home. Sara is sad. She really wants the book.
Sara's dad sees that Sara is sad. He asks her what is wrong. Sara tells him about the book. He says he has an idea. He says he will buy the book for her, but she has to promise him something. Sara asks what. He says she has to promise to read one of her old books every day, and then give it to someone who needs it. He says this way, she can make room on her bookshelf for the new book, and also make someone else happy. Sara thinks this is a great idea. She promises her dad to do it.
Sara's dad buys the book for her. She is very happy. She hugs him and thanks him. She can't wait to read the book. But first, she goes to her room and picks an old book from her bookshelf. She decides to give it to her friend Lily, who loves animals. She thinks Lily will like the book. She puts the book in her backpack and runs to the door. She says bye to her dad and mom and goes to school. She is excited to share the book with Lily, and to read the new book later. She thinks books are great.

The mom said, "It looks like we can't find dinner! What should we do?"
The dad thought hard. Then he said, "I think I know where we could find dinner." 
So the mom and dad went to the garden. They dug, and dug, and dug. Finally, they found something and pulled it out. It was tough, but it yielded dinner. It was a yummy potato! 
The mom and dad were so happy. They cooked the potato for dinner and everyone ate it. It was yummy! 
The end.

One day, they see a big dog in the park. The dog is black and brown and has a long tail. The dog looks at them and barks. Tom and Lily are scared. They want to run away.
But Tom has a cookie in his pocket. He remembers that his mom told him to share. He thinks that maybe the dog is hungry and wants the cookie. He takes the cookie out of his pocket and holds it out to the dog.
"Here, doggy, do you want a cookie?" Tom says.
The dog stops barking and sniffs the cookie. He wags his tail and licks Tom's hand. He takes the cookie and eats it. He is happy. He moves closer to Tom and Lily and lets them pet him.
"Wow, Tom, you are brave and kind," Lily says. "You made the dog happy and friendly."
Tom smiles and says, "Thank you, Lily. I learned that sharing is good. Sometimes, when we share, we make new friends."

One day, Tom saw a little mouse named Jerry. Jerry was very fast, and he liked to run around the house. Tom wanted to play with Jerry, but he was too shy to ask. So, he watched Jerry from afar, hoping that one day they could be friends.
One day, Jerry got too close to the fireplace and his tail got stuck. Tom knew he had to help. He found a small thing to cut Jerry's tail free. Tom saved Jerry, and they became best friends. From that day on, they played together all the time, and Tom was not shy anymore.

One day, a big, intelligent dog named Buddy went for a walk. He saw a little girl named Lily sitting by a tree. She looked sad. Buddy walked over to her and sat down near her shoulder.
"Hi, I'm Buddy," said the dog. "Why are you sad?"
Lily looked at Buddy and said, "I have a sticker on my shoulder and it hurts. Can you help me remove it?"
Buddy nodded and gently used his teeth to remove the sticker from Lily's shoulder. Lily smiled and said, "Thank you, Buddy. You are very kind and intelligent."
From that day on, Buddy and Lily became best friends. They played together every day and always helped each other.

Once there was a little deer and a big deer who were good friends. Every day they would go for a walk in the forest and talk about all the fun things they'd seen that day.
One day, the little deer said to the big deer, "I saw something amazing today. It was a shining sun and it was so bright!"
The big deer smiled. "That must've been nice," he said. 
"It was!" said the little deer excitedly. The little deer wanted to share what he had seen with the big deer, so he asked, "Can I take you to see the sun tomorrow?"
The big deer hesitated. He knew that it would be dishonest to pretend he wanted to go, when really he didn't. So he said, "No, I don't think so."
The little deer looked sad. He said, "But why not? I thought we were friends."
The big deer smiled. He was honest and said, "We are friends. But I think it would be best if you go and have fun on your own." He said goodbye and left, leaving the little deer feeling a bit sad but also a bit happy that his friend had been honest with him.

Once upon a time, there was a little fish named Fin. Fin loved to swim all day long in the big blue sea. One day, Fin saw a big fish who looked very fit and strong. Fin wanted to be like the big fish, so he swam up to him and said, "How can I be fit and strong like you?"
The big fish smiled and said, "I eat a special powder every day that makes me strong. You can have some too!" Fin was very happy and started to eat the powder every day. Soon, Fin became fit and strong like the big fish.
One day, a small fish asked Fin for help. The small fish was stuck in some plants and could not swim away. Fin used his strength to help the small fish, and they became friends. The other fish in the sea saw how kind and helpful Fin was, and they all wanted to be friends with him too. The moral of the story is that being strong is good, but being kind and helpful is even better.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Sarah. She really liked getting a meal every day. But one day, when she sat down to her meal, she tasted something sour! 
Sarah wrinkled her nose. "Yuck," she said. "Meal is sour!" 
Mommy came over. She tasted the meal and said, "Oh no! How did this happen?" 
She looked around and saw a small bottle on the counter. "Sarah, did you put something in the meal?"
Sarah shook her head. "No, Mommy," she said. "I didn't do it." 
Mommy looked very concerned. She told Sarah to wait, and then she went outside. 
After a few minutes, Mommy came back, carrying something. She said, "I found out what happened. A bird flew in our window and it dropped this bottle in the meal. That's why it tasted sour!" 
Sarah looked at the bottle and smiled. She was very happy the mystery was solved. 
The End.

So Dad made up a story about a mighty King. He was a compassionate King, and he wanted everyone in his kingdom to be happy. He was wearing a big, soft bathrobe.
One day, the King went to a faraway village and saw that the people were very poor. He wanted to help them, so he struck his bathrobe and magical coins came out. The coins were enough to feed everyone in the village. The people were so happy, they cheered and sang!
Molly smiled in delight at Dad’s story. She was very proud of the kind King, and of her Dad too, for being so compassionate.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved to look at pretty things. She would admire flowers in the garden. One day, Sue saw a new plant. It was a cactus. The cactus had orange flowers. Sue thought the orange flowers were very pretty.
Sue wanted to touch the pretty cactus. Her mom said, "Be careful, Sue. The cactus has sharp parts." But Sue did not listen. She thought the orange flowers were too pretty to hurt her. Sue got closer to the cactus.
Sue touched the pretty orange flower on the cactus. But then, something bad happened. The cactus was sharp, and Sue got hurt. She cried and her mom came to help her. The pretty cactus was not nice after all. Sue learned to be careful with pretty things that can hurt her.

Lila and Tom are playing on the beach. They like to build sand castles and dig holes. They have a bucket and a shovel and some shells. They are having fun.
"Look, Tom, I made a big castle!" Lila says. She puts a shell on top of the tower. "It is the king's house."
"Wow, Lila, your castle is very nice!" Tom says. He makes a moat around his castle. "My castle has water. It is a boat."
They play some more. Then they hear a sound. It is the tide. The water is coming closer and closer. It is very wide and fast.
"Oh no, Tom, the water is coming!" Lila says. She grabs her bucket and shovel. "We have to go. It will break our castles."
"Wait, Lila, I want to see!" Tom says. He runs to the water. He wants to touch it. He thinks it is fun.
"Tom, come back!" Lila says. She is scared. The water is too big and strong. "It will hurt you. It will make you wet."
But Tom does not listen. He runs to the water. He feels it on his feet. It is cold and salty. He laughs. He likes it.
Then the water becomes higher and higher. It reaches his knees. It pushes him. He falls. He cries. He is wet and cold and scared.
"Help, Lila, help!" Tom says. He tries to get up. He wants to go back.
Lila sees Tom. She is worried. She runs to him. She helps him up. She hugs him. She is wet too.
"Tom, you are silly!" Lila says. She is angry and sad. "Why did you do that? The water is not a toy. It is dangerous."
"I'm sorry, Lila, I'm sorry!" Tom says. He is sorry and sad. "I did not know. I wanted to see. I thought it was fun."
They look at their castles. They are gone. The water broke them. They are sad.
"Come on, Tom, let's go," Lila says. She takes his hand. "We can make new castles another day. But we have to be careful. We have to watch the tide."
They walk to their mom. She is sitting on a towel. She sees them. She is surprised.
"What happened, Lila and Tom?" she says. She sees they are wet and dirty. "Did you have fun?"
They tell her what happened. She listens. She is glad they are safe. She is proud of Lila. She is not mad at Tom.
"I'm sorry, mom, I'm sorry!" Tom says. He is still sorry.
"It's okay, Tom, it's okay," mom says. She smiles. She hugs them. "You learned something today. The tide can be fun, but it can also be dangerous. You have to be careful. You have to listen to Lila. She is smart."
They nod. They agree. They love mom. They love Lila. They love the beach. But they respect the tide.
<|endoftext|>


Lily and Tom were playing in the park. They saw many flowers of different colors. Lily liked the yellow ones. She picked one and said, "This is a daisy. It is pretty. Do you know what it is, Tom?"
Tom looked at the flower. He shook his head. He did not know. He said, "No, I don't know. What is it?"
Lily smiled. She said, "It is a daisy. It is a flower. It has a yellow middle and white petals. It smells nice. Here, you can have it."
Tom took the flower. He smelled it. He said, "Thank you, Lily. It is pretty. It is a daisy. Now I know."
Lily and Tom continued to play. They found more daisies and other flowers. They made a bouquet and gave it to their mom. She was happy. She said, "What a lovely gift. You are very sweet. How did you know I like flowers?"
Lily and Tom said, "We just know, mom. We love you."

Once upon a time, there was a little cat named Mimi. Mimi loved to play with yarn. One day, Mimi found a big ball of yarn. It was red, soft, and fun to play with. Mimi was very happy.
Mimi played with the yarn all day. She would wrap it around her paw and jump around. But then, Mimi saw a small, fragile egg on the floor. The egg was in the way of her play. Mimi did not want to break the egg, but she wanted to keep playing with her yarn.
Mimi thought hard. She had an idea! Mimi carefully wrapped the yarn around the egg. She made a soft, warm nest for it. Now, the egg was safe, and Mimi could keep playing with her yarn. Mimi was happy, and the egg was safe. They both had a fun day together.

Once upon a time, there was a kind girl named Lily. She loved sunflowers very much. She had a big garden full of sunflowers. She liked to look at them every day.
One day, Lily found a magic button. The button could reverse things. She thought it was fun to play with. She used it on her toys and they went back to how they were before.
But Lily made a mistake. She used the magic button on her sunflowers. The sunflowers went back to being seeds in the ground. Lily was sad. She knew she could not grow them again before winter came. The sunflowers were gone, and Lily learned to be careful with magic.
<|endoftext|>

Bob was feeling very frustrated. He wanted to fill up his water balloon but he didn't know where the hose was. He asked his mom for help. 
"Mom, where's the hose?" he asked.
"It's around the corner, Bob," she replied. 
So Bob went around the corner and sure enough, he saw the hose. He put it in the water bucket and started to fill up his balloon. 
But then, Bob heard a noise coming from the hose. It was leaking water everywhere! He was so frustrated that he could barely move. 
His mom walked over and said, "Don't worry, Bob. We can fix this. We just need to put a new hose on the water bucket." 
Bob was relieved and he put the new hose on the water bucket. Soon enough, the water balloon was full and Bob smiled. He had solved the problem, and he had learned a lesson.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim lived in a small house with his mom, dad, and his pet dog, Spot. Tim loved to play with Spot in the big yard outside.
One day, Tim saw a hurt bird on the stair. He wanted to help the bird, so he asked his mom what to do. His mom said to remove the bird and put it in a soft, warm place. Tim gently picked up the bird and put it in a box with a soft towel.
Tim and Spot watched the bird every day. They gave it food and water. Soon, the bird felt better and could fly again. Tim was happy to see the bird fly away. He knew he had done a good thing by helping the hurt bird.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a desk in his room. The desk was dull and not fun to play with. Tim wanted a new desk, but his mom said no.
One day, Tim's friend, Sam, came to play. Sam saw the dull desk and began to tease Tim. "Your desk is so dull," Sam said. Tim felt sad and wished he had a new desk.
Tim's mom heard Sam tease Tim. She came into the room and said, "Don't tease, Sam. It's not nice." Sam said sorry to Tim. They played together and had fun, even with the dull desk.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time, there were two best friends, Jack and Jill. They went everywhere together and did everything together, including going for a walk in the forest. Jack and Jill heard strange, frightening noises in the trees overhead, so they stopped to gawk.
"What could it be?", asked Jill.
"I don't know," Jack shrugged, looking around.
Suddenly, they heard a voice calling out: "Wait! Don't be frightened!"
Cautiously, they peered around and saw an old man holding out a small, wrapped gift in his hands. He smiled and said, "I have been waiting here in the forest for someone special — I think that you are the ones! Would you like this gift?"
Jill was still frightened, but Jack was curious. He stepped forward and accepted the gift, carefully unwrapping it. Inside the paper, he found a beautiful, golden locket.
They thanked the old man and carried the gift away their adventure. From that moment on, Jack and Jill were never scared of the forest again — and they each kept their golden locket close, as a reminder of their brave adventure that day.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Charlie. Charlie loved to go sailing in his navy boat. 
One day he decided to go sailing alone. He went out in the deep waters and it was a long journey. 
As Charlie sailed, he noticed some shapes coming out of the water. He asked the shapes, "What are you?"
The shapes shrugged and didn't answer. Then they began to move closer and closer to Charlie's boat. Charlie was scared and tried to move away but the shapes moved faster and faster. 
Suddenly the shapes were behind him. Charlie was so weak that he couldn't move away or even call for help. The shapes kept coming and suddenly Charlie's boat went underwater and he was never seen again. 
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a big robot. The robot had long arms and legs. It lived in a small house with a little boy named Tim.
One day, Tim and the robot went to the park. They saw a lot of colorful balloons. Tim wanted to hold a balloon, so the robot gave him one. Tim was very happy.
Suddenly, the wind blew hard. Tim's hand let go of the balloon. He watched it release and fly up into the sky. The robot used its long arm to catch the balloon. Tim was happy again. They went home together and played all day.

One day, a good cat named Tom was playing with his friend, a little dog named Max. They were having fun in the park when Max fell down and hurt his leg. Max cried, "Tom, help me! My leg hurts."
Tom knew he had to help his friend. He saw an ambulance nearby and called out, "Please, help my friend Max!" The ambulance man came over and looked at Max's leg. He said, "Don't worry, we will take Max to the doctor."
Tom wanted to go with Max, but the ambulance man said, "I'm sorry, Tom. We cannot permit you to come with us. It is not safe for a cat to ride in the ambulance." Tom was sad, but he knew the ambulance would take good care of Max.
Later, Tom went to visit Max at the doctor's office. Max had a bandage on his leg and was feeling much better. Max said, "Thank you, Tom, for getting help. You are a good friend." Tom was happy that Max was okay, and they promised to always take care of each other.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in a small house with her mom, dad, and her cat, Fluffy. Lily loved to play with Fluffy. They would run and jump all day long. One day, mom told Lily that a holiday was coming. Lily was very happy because she knew holidays were fun.
On the holiday, Lily's family went to the park. They saw many kids playing and laughing. Lily and Fluffy played with a ball. They threw it and caught it. Lily's mom gave her a sour candy. Lily made a funny face because it was so sour. Her family laughed, and Lily laughed too.
As the sun went down, Lily's family had a picnic. They ate yummy food and talked about their fun day. Fluffy lay down next to Lily, tired from all the playing. When it was time to go home, Lily hugged Fluffy and said, "I love holidays!" They walked home, excited for the next holiday to come.

Sara and Tom are twins. They like to play in the park with their mom and dad. They have a big kite that flies high in the sky. They take turns to hold the string and make the kite go up and down.
One day, the wind is very strong. The kite flies faster and faster. Sara holds the string, but it is hard. She pulls and pulls, but the kite does not come back. The string makes a knot around her hand. It hurts. She cries.
"Help, help!" Sara shouts. "The kite is taking me away!"
Tom hears Sara. He runs to her. He tries to untie the knot, but it is too tight. He calls mom and dad. They come quickly. They help Tom to free Sara's hand. They hug her and kiss her.
"It's okay, Sara. You are safe now. We are here," mom says.
"I'm sorry, mom. I did not mean to lose the kite," Sara says.
"It's okay, Sara. The kite is not important. You are important. We love you," dad says.
They look at the sky. The kite is gone. They cannot see it anymore. They are sad, but they are happy to be together.
They go home. They have some cookies and milk. They cuddle on the couch. They watch a funny show. They laugh and smile. They feel peaceful. They spend a good time as a family. They are happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot loved to run and play. He was always eager to make new friends. One day, Spot saw a big ball in the park. He wanted to play with the ball.
Spot ran up to the ball and started to spin around it. He was so happy to play with the big ball. He jumped on it and tried to balance on his shoulder. Spot was having so much fun, he did not see the big hole in the ground.
As Spot was spinning and playing, he fell into the hole. He was very sad and scared. Spot could not get out of the hole. He cried and cried for help, but no one came to save him. Spot was stuck in the hole, and it was a bad ending for the little dog.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his toys and listen to his mom's stories. One day, his mom gave him a lecture about not forgetting to put his toys away.
Later, Tim was playing with his toys when he heard a tiny voice say, "Hello!" He looked around and saw a little toy robot. The robot said, "Hi, I'm Robo! Can I play with you?" Tim was very surprised but happy to have a new friend. They played together all day.
At the end of the day, Tim remembered his mom's lecture and started to put his toys away. But, he forgot to put Robo away. The next morning, Tim found Robo cleaning his room. Robo said, "I didn't want you to forget me, so I helped clean up!" Tim was so happy and never forgot to put his toys away again.

One day, a little girl named Amy was playing with her toy blocks. She liked to join them together and make a big stack. Her friend Tom came over to play with her. Tom had a toy dog that looked very real, but it was fake.
"Hi Amy, can I join you?" asked Tom. "Sure!" said Amy. They played together and made a big stack with the blocks. They put the fake dog on top of the stack.
Suddenly, they heard a loud noise. The stack began to shake and the fake dog fell down. Amy and Tom were scared. But then, they saw a real dog standing near the stack.
The real dog wanted to play too! Amy and Tom laughed and let the real dog join them. They all played together and had a lot of fun. The real dog was very good at helping them make the stack even bigger.

One day, a little dog came to the house. The dog was tired and wanted to relax. The dog went into the kitchen and lay down on the soft rug. The dog felt happy and safe in the warm kitchen.
Mom, Dad, and the little dog became good friends. They all liked to be together in the kitchen. The little dog would relax on the rug while Mom and Dad cooked. They all lived happily ever after.

Once there were two friends. The first was tired, so she sat down and closed her eyes. The second wanted to play, so she kicked a pink ball. The ball rolled away, making her friend feel very miserable.
The first friend looked up and laughed. She asked her friend to kick the ball back. Her friend agreed and kicked the ball hard. This time, the ball flew back and landed in front of the first friend. Then, the first friend kicked the ball back to her friend.
The two friends kept kicking the pink ball back and forth. Soon, the second friend wasn't feeling so miserable anymore. The two friends kept playing until it was dark and time to go home.

Once upon a time, there was a small family who lived in a cabin in the woods. They hoped to live a peaceful life together and always looked for ways to make their dreams come true. 
One day, a strong storm came, and the family tried to keep safe. But it was too strong for them. The storm filled their cabin with ash and smoke and soon the cabin burned to the ground.
The family was left standing in the unknown, with nowhere to go and nothing to do. They had lost all of their belongings and they were scared. 
No matter how much they hoped, things never got better. The family was never able to rebuild their life and they were left with an unhappy ending.

Once upon a time, there was a little cat named Fluffy. Fluffy was very good at playing games. One day, Fluffy played a game with his friend, Bunny. They wanted to see who was the best jumper. Fluffy jumped high, but Bunny jumped even higher. Fluffy did not like to lose, so he tried again and again. But Bunny always jumped higher.
Fluffy was sad and did not want to play anymore. He said, "I refuse to play!" Bunny felt bad and wanted to help Fluffy feel better. Bunny had an incredible idea. Bunny said, "Let's try a new game that we both can win." Fluffy liked the idea and agreed to play the new game.
In the new game, Fluffy and Bunny worked together to build a big tower with blocks. They took turns putting blocks on top of each other. When the tower was very tall, it started to shake. Suddenly, the tower fell down and the blocks went everywhere. Fluffy and Bunny laughed and laughed. They realized that playing together was more fun than trying to win. In the end, they both felt the victory of having fun and being good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He had a big, red ball. He loved to play with the ball all day long. One day, Tim was playing with the ball inside his house. He threw the ball high up in the air. The ball went up, up, up, and hit the ceiling. It made a loud noise.
Tim's mommy came into the room. She saw the ball on the floor. She told Tim, "Be careful when you play with the ball inside the house. The ceiling is high, and it can be scary if the ball gets stuck up there."
Tim did not want his ball to get stuck on the scary ceiling. So, he took his ball outside to play. He threw the ball up in the air and watched it rise high above his head. Tim was happy to play outside with his ball, where it was safe and fun. And the scary ceiling stayed far away.

Once upon a time, in a small place, there was a silly cat. The silly cat loved to play all day. One day, the cat found a box. The cat wanted to see if it could fit in the box.
The silly cat tried and tried to fit in the box. It pushed and wiggled, but it could not fit. The cat was sad. It wanted to find a new place to play.
Then, the cat saw a big, soft pillow. The cat jumped on the pillow and it fit just right! The silly cat was so happy. It played on the pillow all day long. And that was the cat's favorite place to play.

Mummy was busy putting on her dress when she noticed Daisy playing with a cell. 
"Daisy!" she called, "you mustn't play with that!" 
But Daisy was too engrossed in the tiny machine. 
Mummy sighed and said, "You have been naughty. How do you think that makes me feel?"
Daisy felt guilty, so she softly replied, "Sad."
Mummy smiled and said, "Yes, it makes me sad when you don't listen. That is why it's important to listen to adults. Do you understand me?"
Daisy nodded and said, "Yes, Mama."
Mummy hugged her and said, "Never forget, when you do as you are told, everyone is happy."
Daisy smiled and said, "I will always try to be a good girl." 
Mummy smiled and said, "That's my girl." 
The moral of the story is to always listen to adults and do as you are told. It is important to obey adults in order to make everyone happy.

Once upon a time, there was a smooth red cherry. It lived on a big tree with many other cherries. The smooth cherry loved to stay on the tree and feel the sun on its skin.
One day, a little girl came to the tree. She saw the smooth cherry and wanted to eat it. But the cherry did not want to leave the tree. The girl tried to pick it, but the cherry stayed on the tree.
The little girl asked the cherry, "Please, can I eat you? You look so yummy." The smooth cherry thought for a moment and said, "Okay, you can eat me, but promise to plant my seed so I can grow into a new tree." The girl agreed and ate the cherry. She planted the seed, and soon, a new cherry tree grew. The smooth cherry was happy to stay on a new tree and make more cherries for everyone.

Lily wanted to change the club. She wanted to make it more beautiful. So, she and her friends painted the walls with pretty colors. They also put up pictures of flowers and butterflies. The club looked very nice. All the kids loved the new club. They played and had fun together every day.

One morning, a boy named Tom went to the park. He saw a big tree with lots of leaves. The wind blew and the leaves scatter all around. Tom ran fast to catch them.
In the park, Tom met a girl named Sue. She was playing with a red ball. Sue threw the ball to Tom. "Catch!" she said. Tom caught the ball and threw it back to Sue. They laughed and played together.
As the sun went down, Tom and Sue stopped playing. They said goodbye and went home. Tom told his mom about his fun day at the park. He could not wait to play with Sue again.

Tom and Mia wanted to go for a walk. They put on their boots and coats and hats. They asked their mom if they could go outside.
"Okay, but be careful. It might rain soon," mom said.
Tom and Mia nodded and ran to the door. They opened it and saw a big dog. The dog was black and hairy and had a loud bark. The dog saw Tom and Mia and ran to them.
"Hello, doggy!" Mia said. She tried to pet the dog, but the dog did not like it. The dog growled and snapped at Mia. Mia screamed and ran back to the door.
"Rude dog!" Tom said. He picked up a stick and waved it at the dog. The dog barked and jumped at Tom. Tom dropped the stick and ran back to the door too.
"Help, mom!" Tom and Mia cried. Mom heard them and came to the door. She saw the dog and shouted at it.
"Go away, bad dog! Leave my kids alone!" mom said. She closed the door and locked it. The dog ran away, still barking.
Tom and Mia hugged mom and thanked her. They were scared and sad. They did not want to go for a walk anymore.
"Sorry, kids. That was a mean dog. Maybe he was lost or hungry. But he should not have been so rude to you," mom said.
She hugged them and kissed them. She said they could play inside until the rain stopped. She gave them some cookies and milk and a book. Tom and Mia smiled and felt better. They liked mom and cookies and books. They did not like rude dogs.

Once upon a time, in a large house, lived a small dog named Spot. Spot loved to play with his ball all day. He would run, jump, and wag his tail. Spot was a happy dog.
One day, Spot saw a big cat outside. The cat was sitting near the exit. Spot wanted to chase the cat, so he demanded to go out. He barked and jumped at the door. His owner opened the door, and Spot ran out.
Spot chased the cat, but the cat was too fast. The cat climbed a tall tree and laughed at Spot. Spot was sad and tired. He wanted to go back inside, but he could not find the exit. Spot was lost and could not go home.

Once upon a time, there was a big red barn. Inside the barn, there lived a cow, a pig, and a chicken. They were very good friends and played together every day. The cow liked to push the big red ball, the pig liked to roll in the mud, and the chicken liked to eat spicy bugs.
One sunny day, the cow, the pig, and the chicken went outside to play. The cow found a new ball to push, the pig found a new mud puddle to roll in, and the chicken found a new spicy bug to eat. They were all very happy.
But then, something unexpected happened! The ball the cow was pushing suddenly popped! The mud puddle the pig was rolling in suddenly dried up! And the spicy bug the chicken was eating suddenly turned sweet! The friends were very surprised, but they laughed and played together with their new toys. They learned that sometimes, unexpected things can be fun too.

"Mom, I want to play with the toys on the stand," said Tim. His mom said, "Okay, let's go play." They went to the stand and started to play with the toys. Tim was very happy.
But then, it began to rain. The rain was so heavy that the fair had to stop. Everyone ran to find a dry place. Tim was sad. Suddenly, the rain stopped, and a big rainbow appeared in the sky. The fair started again, and Tim and his mom played more games. They had a great day at the fair.

Once upon a time, in a little pond, there was a very intelligent frog named Fred. Fred loved to hop, play, and stir the water with his strong legs. One sunny day, Fred saw a little girl named Sue by the pond. Sue was trying to catch fish with a net. 
Fred hopped closer to Sue and said, "Hi! I am Fred, the intelligent frog. Can I help you catch fish with your net?" Sue looked at Fred and smiled. "Yes, please, Fred! I need help," she said. 
Together, they worked as a team. Fred used his strong legs to stir the water and make the fish swim closer to Sue. Sue used her net to catch the fish. They were very happy and had a lot of fun. From that day on, Fred and Sue became the best of friends, and they played by the pond every day.

Tim's mom said, "Yes, you can help him." So Tim and the man went to mail the box. They walked and talked. The man was happy that Tim helped him.
After they mailed the box, Tim and the man went back to the stadium. They watched the game together. Tim was happy that he helped the man with the important box.

At first, Max was scared and did not want the massage. But when the nice lady started to rub his back, he felt so good that he stopped being rude. Max learned that trying new things can be fun, and he promised to be a nicer dog from now on.

A big boy named Tom saw Lily and wanted to help. He said, "I can encourage you to jump high and get the prune." Lily jumped and jumped, but she still could not reach the prune.
Then, a bird came and took the prune from the tree. The bird flew away with the prune. Lily and Tom were sad. They did not get the prune, but they learned to be honest and encourage each other.

One day, Levi was out playing in the garden of his house. He ran around, exploring and picking flowers. Suddenly, he heard a loud noise. It was coming from the factory that was nearby. It scared him.
He looked up and saw all kinds of big machines inside. He didn't want to go in and he started to cry.
His mom heard him and ran outside. She hugged him, and said: "It's okay Levi, don't be scared. It's an obedient factory, and it is here to help us. It is not hurting anyone."
Levi felt better and nodded. His mom picked up him and they walked away together, hand in hand.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Sara. She loved her furry teddy bear and pushing her wheel around the garden. One day Sara was out pushing her wheel around when she spotted something hairy in the tall grass. 
Sara blinked and wondered what it could be. She thought it look a bit like her teddy bear, so she went over to investigate. 
When she got closer, she realised it was a hairy spider! She was so scared she started to cry.
Just then, an old man appeared and told her, "It's ok Sara. Spiders may be hairy, but they are harmless."
Sara blinked again, took a deep breath and calmed down. She thanked the old man and smiled. She realized that it's ok to be scared of things at first, but if we take the time to learn about them, they may not be so scary after all.

One day, a girl named Sue was cold. She put on a big coat and went outside. She saw her friend Tim. Tim said, "Hi Sue! I have a story for you!" Sue was very happy to hear a story.
Tim started, "Once upon a time, there was a big, cold bear. The bear lived in a cold cave. The bear was sad because he did not own anything. One day, the bear found a warm hat." Sue listened to the story and felt warm inside.
"But guess what, Sue?" Tim said with a big smile. "The bear was not a real bear! It was a big, friendly dog! The dog put on the warm hat and was not cold anymore. The dog was happy because he now owned a warm hat." Sue laughed and clapped her hands. The twist in the story made her feel even warmer.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He lived in a small house with his mom and dad. Tim loved to look out of the big window in his room. He would watch the birds, the cars, and the people walking by. One cold day, Tim saw a cat sitting outside his window. The cat looked cold and sad.
Tim wanted to help the cat. He asked his mom if he could remove the window to let the cat in. His mom said it was too cold to remove the window, but she had a better idea. She gave Tim a warm blanket to put outside for the cat. Tim was very happy and put the blanket outside for the cat to sit on.
The next morning, Tim looked out the window to see if the cat was still there. But the cat was gone! Instead, there was a big, friendly dog sitting on the blanket. Tim was surprised and excited. He ran to his mom and dad to tell them about the dog. They all went outside to meet the dog, and the dog wagged its tail happily. The family decided to keep the dog and named him Buddy. Tim and Buddy became the best of friends, and they all lived happily ever after.

The ant asked its friends for help. The friends were a bird, a cat, and a dog. They all came to help the ant open the box. They worked together and the box opened. Inside the box, they found yummy food. They all shared the food and had a fun party. The helpful little ant was very happy.

But then, it started to rain. Lily and Teddy ran to find shelter. The rain was very strong, and Lily accidentally dropped Teddy. Teddy fell into a big puddle and got very wet. Lily was sad because her new friend Teddy was all wet and dirty. She tried to clean him, but Teddy was never the same again.

At the end of the day, the big cat and the little dog were tired. They laid down under a big tree. Lucy smiled as she finished her story. She was happy with her story and her thinking head. Now, she was ready to share it with her mom and dad.

Once upon a time, there was a bird. The bird had a nest. The nest was in a big tree. The bird had a friend. The friend was a cat. The cat was sad. The cat was miserable.
One day, the bird flew away. The bird wanted to find things. The bird wanted to include things in the nest. The bird found a red ball. The bird found a blue ribbon. The bird put them in the nest.
The cat saw the nest. The cat liked the nest. The cat wanted to play. The cat climbed the tree. The cat played with the ball and ribbon. The cat was not miserable anymore. The bird came back. The bird was happy, too. The bird and the cat were best friends.

Sue got all the things she needed to bake the cake. She mixed everything in a big bowl. But, she forgot one thing. She forgot to put sugar in the cake mix. The cake would be bitter without sugar. Sue did not know.
Sue baked the cake and it looked beautiful. She gave the cake to her mom. Her mom took a bite and made a funny face. The cake was bitter! Sue was sad. But her mom said, "Don't worry, we can bake a new cake together." Sue was happy again. They baked a new cake and it was very yummy.

One day, a little girl named Jane went for a walk. She saw a big tree and under the tree, she found a box. Jane was very happy. She opened the box and saw something shiny. It was gold! Jane's eyes got big and she smiled.
Jane wanted to show her mom and dad the gold. She ran home with the box. When she got home, her dad was very serious. He looked at the gold and then he frowned. Jane did not know why her dad was not happy.
Her dad said, "Jane, we must give the gold back. It is not ours." Jane felt sad, but she knew her dad was right. They went back to the big tree and put the box under it. Jane learned that it is important to do the right thing, even if it makes you sad.

One day, two friends Tommy and Lydia were walking together. Tommy asked Lydia what she wanted to do, and Lydia said she wanted to go to the park. 
When they got to the park, Lydia saw a cane. Lydia said the cane looked very smart. She asked Tommy if she could have it. Tommy said no and warned her to be careful. 
The two friends kept playing. After awhile, Tommy noticed Lydia liked the cane a lot. He said, "If you're so smart, you can have this cane if you can answer this question correctly."
Lydia quickly answered the question and Tommy smiled. Tommy said, "You did it! You deserve the cane." He gave Lydia the cane. Lydia was delighted to have the cane and thanked Tommy. 
Tommy was glad he could give Lydia the cane. He thought she was very smart.

Once upon a time, there was a jolly cat named Tom. Tom loved to help his friends. One day, his friend, a bird called Sally, asked Tom for help. "Tom, can you help me deliver this letter to Mr. Fox?" Sally asked. Tom said, "Yes, I can help you."
Tom took the letter from Sally and walked to Mr. Fox's house. On his way, Tom met a dog named Max. Max was sad because he lost his toy. Tom said, "Don't worry, Max. I will help you find your toy after I give this letter to Mr. Fox."
Tom went to Mr. Fox's house and gave him the letter. The letter was about peace between the animals in the forest. Mr. Fox was happy to read it. Tom then went back to Max and helped him find his toy. Max was happy and said, "Thank you, Tom!"
All the animals in the forest were happy and lived in peace. Tom was a good friend to everyone. He always helped his friends and made them smile. And they all lived happily ever after.

At the park, Sally opened her jar and took out her toys. She played with her toys and her friends. When it was time to go home, Sally put her toys back in the jar. She made sure the jar was clean before going back to the car. Sally and her jar had a fun day at the park.

Once upon a time, there was a little crocodile named Coco. Coco lived in a big pond with his family. He loved to play with his friends, swim, and chew on things.
One day, Coco saw a little bird near the pond. The bird looked sad. Coco swam over and asked, "Why are you sad?" The bird said, "I can't find my way home. I am lost." Coco wanted to help the little bird, so he said, "I will help you find your home."
Coco and the little bird looked all around the pond. They asked other animals if they knew where the bird's home was. Just when they were about to give up, they saw a big tree with a nest. The little bird was so happy and said, "That's my home! Thank you, Coco!" The bird flew up to the nest, and Coco felt very happy.
The other animals saw how kind Coco was and wanted to be his friend. They all played together and had lots of fun. The moral of the story is that when you help others, you make new friends. And sometimes, the most unexpected friendships can be the best ones.

The swamp was full of life. Billy and Brian played with Froggy for a long time and shared lots of stories. In the end, they had to leave, but promised to come back soon. 
Billy and Brian felt so lucky to have found such a friendly frog in the swamp. They said goodbye and began to stumble back to their house.

Buzzy called his friend, Tommy the turtle, and said, "Look, I found a triangle. Let's split it and make two smaller triangles." Tommy agreed and they carefully split the triangle in half. 
As they split the triangle, something unexpected happened. A tiny fairy appeared and said, "Thank you for setting me free! I was trapped inside the triangle. As a reward, I will grant you each one wish." Buzzy and Tommy were very happy and wished for more fun days at the park.

At the festival, Tim saw a man with a big bag of toys. The man said, "If you can count all the toys in my bag, you can have one for free!" Tim was good at counting, so he started to count the toys. He counted one, two, three, four, five toys.
Suddenly, an angry dog ran into the festival. It scared everyone and knocked over the man with the toys. The toys went flying everywhere! Tim's mom said, "Oh no, what a mess!" But Tim had an idea. He said, "Let's count the toys again and put them back in the bag!" So, Tim, his mom, and the man all counted the toys together and put them back in the bag. The angry dog was not scary anymore and became a happy dog. Tim got a toy for being so helpful, and they all had a great time at the festival.

One day, Sam's mom said, 'Sam, I'm going shopping, so please stay here and be good.' 
Sam agreed, but was very curious, so he decided to go exploring. Everywhere he went he saw people, but none of them were his mom. He knocked on all the doors and asked, 'Where is my mommy?' He was feeling nosy and wanted to find her. 
He eventually heard someone say, 'Oh, she went to the store to buy some waffles please!'
Sam was so excited, he knew that his mom was getting him a yummy waffle to eat! He rushed back home and, sure enough, his mother had bought him a warm, delicious waffle.

As they cleaned, they talked and laughed. Lily asked her mom, "Why does the ash make our house dirty?" Her mom explained, "The ash comes from the wood we burn in the fireplace to keep warm. It's a part of keeping our house cozy." Lily smiled and said, "I am happy to help you clean, Mom." And they continued to clean the house, making it look nice and tidy again.

But as the cat told the story, the big, red ball from the story came rolling by! "Hi, I am the big, red ball from the story!" said the ball. Bob and the cat were very surprised.

Lily was sad. She sat near the bookcase. Then, the books started to talk! They said, "Lily, listen to your mom. Eat your dinner first, then you can have the cake."
Lily was surprised. She listened to the books and ate her dinner. After dinner, she had the tasty cake. The books were happy too.
The moral of the story is to always listen to your mom and do the right thing. And sometimes, even books can talk and help you learn.
