Once upon a time there was a girl called Anna. One morning, Anna woke up feeling very nervous. She had to take the subway to meet her friends at the park. Anna had never been on a subway before and she was really scared. She asked her mom if she could go with her, but her mom said no. 
So Anna put on her coat and walked to the subway station. She stepped on to the train and sat down. At first, the ride went smoothly, but then it got slower and slower. When the train stopped, all the passengers had to get off and walk. Anna wasn't sure where to go, so she followed the other passengers.
After walking for a long time, she ended up at an old, dark station. It was creepy and Anna was very frightened. Suddenly, a group of thugs appeared out of the shadows and surrounded her. They started to steal her things and she felt helpless.
Anna was so scared that she passed out. When she woke up, she was alone in the dark train station. All of her things were gone. Anna was so shaken up, she was never able to take the subway again.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there was a girl named Lily. She loved to draw with pastel colors. One day, Lily saw a new friend named Tom. Tom was enthusiastic about pastels too. They both decided to draw together.
Lily and Tom sat under a big tree and started to draw. They drew a big sun, a small house, and a happy family. They whispered to each other about their ideas. "Let's draw a dog too," Lily whispered. Tom nodded and drew a cute dog.
Soon, the sky turned dark, and it was time to go home. Lily and Tom were happy with their pastel drawings. They hugged each other and said, "See you tomorrow!" They knew they would have more fun drawing together again.

Once upon a time there was a naughty boy called Sam. He loved to skip along the path whenever he went outside. One day he was skipping along and he came to the sea. He had never seen the sea before and he thought it was so big and wide.
He wanted to play in the sand but he knew that his parents wouldn't let him so he started to skip back home. Then he suddenly remembered that it was a holiday. He got so excited and started to skip faster and faster down the path.
He ran back home and asked his parents if he could go to the beach to play in the sand. They said yes and he ran all the way to the beach. He laughed happily as he skipped through the sand. He had so much fun building sandcastles and running in the waves. 
He skipped all the way back home that evening with a big smile on his face. He was so happy that he had such a fun holiday!

One sunny day, a little girl named Lisa went to play in the park. She had her favorite toy, a small doll, and a bag full of stuff. Lisa was very happy as she played with her doll and other toys. She loved to play in the messy sand and make sand castles.
As Lisa played, a boy named Tom came to the park too. Tom saw Lisa playing with her stuff and asked, "Can I play with you?" Lisa said, "Yes, you can play with me!" They played together, making a big, messy sand castle.
After a while, Lisa looked for her doll, but she could not find it. She felt sad and said, "I lost my doll!" Tom wanted to help Lisa. They searched in the messy sand and around the park. Finally, they found the doll under a slide. Lisa was so happy and thanked Tom. They continued to play together and became good friends.

Once there was a little boy named Jason. He was very special and full of creative power. One day, he was very excited because he was going to a new playground. He had been to playgrounds before, but this one was a little bit different. 
When Jason arrived at the playground, he slipped on the big slide. He could feel the power of the slide as he raced down to the bottom. He smiled and laughed as he felt the wind passing him by. 
At the bottom of the slide was a colorful sandbox. It was full of creative treasures like bright colored rocks. Jason scooped up the rocks and started to make little towers. He even made houses and creatures out of the rocks. 
As the day grew longer, Jason's energy started to slip away. He had used all of his creative power to make the magical world he had created. 
Finally, it was time to go home. He was worn out from all of the fun he had. But he knew he would come back soon, with more creative power and more ideas.

Once upon a time, there was a bald parrot named Polly. Polly was sad because she had no friends. One day, Polly met a kind bird named Billy. Billy had pretty feathers and could sing a nice song. Polly wanted to be friends with Billy.
Polly said, "Billy, can we be friends? I am bald and can't sing, but I want to play with you." Billy thought for a moment and said, "Okay, Polly, we can be friends. But you must be nice and share your toys." Polly was very happy and promised to be a good friend.
One day, Polly took Billy's toy without asking. Billy was sad and told Polly, "That was not nice. You should ask before taking my toy." Polly felt bad and said, "I am sorry, Billy. I will ask next time. Can you forgive me?" Billy smiled and said, "Yes, Polly, I forgive you. Let's play together and share our toys." From that day on, Polly and Billy were best friends and always shared their toys. They learned that saying sorry and forgiving each other made their friendship stronger.

One day, a little girl named Sue was playing with her toy car. She loved to make it go fast. Sue saw her dad put gas in their big car. She thought, "My toy car needs gas too!" So, she went to her dad and asked, "Daddy, can you put gas in my toy car?"
Her dad smiled and said, "Sue, your toy car doesn't need gas. It runs on fun and love!" Sue was happy and went back to play with her car. But something strange happened. The toy car started to move on its own!
Sue was surprised and didn't know what to do. She saw a poor little mouse under her bed. The mouse was scared and said, "Please help me! I'm stuck in your toy car!" Sue felt bad for the mouse and helped it out. The mouse was very thankful and said, "Thank you, Sue! I won't play with your toys again." And they both became good friends.

Jill likes to rub her cat, Spot. Spot is soft and warm and makes a happy sound. Jill rubs Spot on his head, his back and his belly. Spot likes it too. He purrs and licks Jill's hand.
One day, Jill and Spot go outside to play. It is a sunny day, but there is a lot of wind. The wind blows Jill's hair and Spot's fur. Jill thinks it is fun. She runs and jumps and laughs. Spot thinks it is scary. He hides under a bush and shivers.
Jill sees a fancy hat on the ground. It is red and shiny and has a big feather. Jill thinks it is pretty. She picks it up and puts it on her head. She feels like a princess. She walks and twirls and sings.
Spot sees the hat too. He thinks it is a bird. He wants to catch it and play with it. He comes out of the bush and runs after Jill. He jumps and bites and scratches.
Jill is surprised and scared. She drops the hat and cries. Spot is confused and sad. He stops and meows. Jill and Spot hug and say sorry. They are friends again.
They go back inside and rub each other. They are warm and happy and quiet. They forget about the wind and the hat. They only remember their love.

Tim tried to pick up the big ball, but it was too big. He tried to squeeze it with his hands, but it was too hard. Tim said, "Dad, I can't pick up the ball. Can you help me?"
Dad came over and said, "Tim, you have to be careful in the gym. Let's play with a smaller ball." Dad gave Tim a small ball that was easy to squeeze. Tim and his dad played together and had lots of fun in the gym.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his toy train. He had a long track and a cheap, red train. Tim would run the train on the track every day.
One day, Tim's friend, Sam, came to play. Sam saw the train and said, "I know how to make it go faster!" Tim was excited and asked, "How?" Sam said, "We can add more tracks!" So they added more tracks to make the train go faster.
As they played, the train went faster and faster on the new tracks. Tim and Sam were very happy. They played with the train all day and had lots of fun. From that day on, Tim and Sam became best friends who loved to play with trains together.

One day, a cheerful boy named Tim had a pencil. He liked to draw with his pencil. Tim had a friend named Sam. Sam also liked to draw. They both wanted to draw a big picture together.
But they had a problem. They only had one pencil. They did not know how to share the pencil. Tim wanted to draw a big tree. Sam wanted to draw a big house. They could not agree on what to draw.
Then, something unexpected happened. Tim broke the pencil in two parts by accident. Now, they each had a part of the pencil. Tim and Sam were happy. They could both draw what they wanted. In the end, they drew a big tree next to a big house. They were both very happy with their big picture.

Once upon a time, in a big yellow house, there lived a sad little girl. She would often weep because she felt lonely. She had no friends to play with and her toys were old and broken.
One day, while she was crying, a yellow bird flew into her room. The bird had a special power. It could make her toys new again. The little girl was very surprised and happy. She stopped weeping and started to play with her toys.
But then, something unexpected happened. The bird's power also made the toys come to life! The toys became her new friends and they all played together. The little girl was not lonely anymore and never wept again.
<|endoftext|>


Sara and Tom were playing in the yard. They saw a big bird with brown feathers and a red thing on its head. Sara said, "Look, Tom, a turkey!"
Tom said, "No, Sara, that is not a turkey. That is a chicken."
Sara said, "How do you know, Tom? Did you ask the bird?"
Tom said, "No, I did not ask the bird. I just guess. I know what a turkey looks like. A turkey has a big tail that opens like a fan. This bird does not have a big tail."
Sara said, "Maybe this bird is a baby turkey. Maybe its tail will grow bigger when it gets older."
Tom said, "No, Sara, you are wrong. This bird is a chicken. I am sure."
Sara and Tom started to argue. They did not agree on what the bird was. They did not listen to each other. They did not have fun.
Then, they heard a voice from the house. It was Mom. She said, "Sara, Tom, come inside. It is time for lunch. I made you a sandwich with turkey and cheese."
Sara and Tom ran to the house. They were hungry. They said, "Sorry, Mom, we were playing."
Mom said, "That is okay, my loves. But next time, try to be more honest with each other. If you are not sure about something, you can say, 'I think' or 'I wonder' instead of 'I know' or 'I guess'. That way, you can learn from each other and have more fun."
Sara and Tom nodded. They said, "Okay, Mom, we will try to be more honest. Thank you for the lunch. We love turkey and cheese."
Mom smiled. She said, "You are welcome, my loves. I love you too. Enjoy your lunch."
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a small cat named Kitty. Kitty loved to play in the warm sun. One day, she saw a big dog named Rover playing in the snow. "I wonder what it's like to play in the cold," thought Kitty. She felt envious of Rover.
Kitty went to Rover and asked, "Can I play with you in the cold?" Rover said, "Yes, but you might not like it." Kitty was so excited that she didn't listen to Rover's warning.
They started to play in the snow. At first, Kitty had fun. But soon, she felt very cold. She didn't like the cold at all. Rover saw Kitty shivering and said, "I told you, you might not like it." Kitty nodded and went back inside to warm up. From that day on, Kitty was happy to play in the warm sun and didn't feel envious of Rover anymore.

Once upon a time there was a jeep. The jeep was very special and it went around helping people. It was very successful at his job and made lots of friends. 
One day, the jeep got tired from helping so many people. So, it took a nap in a sunny spot. It was so peaceful that it fell asleep. 
Soon afterwards, the jeep awoke to find lots of animals playing around it. They were so happy that the jeep had taken a nap, because they thought it was a fun game. All of them were having a great time.
The jeep had been very successful in its work, so when it saw the animals, the jeep got a big smile on its face. It was happy to see them, and it continued its job with a newfound joy. 
The end.

Mia had a friend named Tim. Tim also liked the doll. Tim wanted to play with the doll too. But Mia did not want to share the doll. Mia and Tim were sad.
Mia's mom saw them and had an idea. She said, "Why don't you both feed the doll together?" Mia and Tim liked the idea. They both fed the doll tasty food. Now, Mia and Tim were happy and played with the doll together.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim liked to go on walks with his dog, Spot. One sunny day, they went on a walk on a dry trail. The trail was in an unknown part of the forest. They had never been there before.
As they walked, Tim saw a little girl sitting on a rock. She was crying. Tim asked her, "Why are you sad?" The little girl said, "I am lost. I can't find my way home." Tim wanted to help her.
Tim, Spot, and the little girl walked back on the trail. They found her house, and the little girl was happy. She said, "Thank you, Tim and Spot!" They all became good friends and went on many more walks together.

One day, a girl named Sue had a dream. In her dream, she saw a big cake. Sue wanted to bake a cake just like the one in her dream. She asked her mom, "Can we bake a cake today?"
Her mom said, "Yes, we can bake a regular cake." Sue was very happy. They went to the kitchen and started to bake the cake. They mixed all the things they needed to make the cake.
But then, something unexpected happened. When they opened the oven to put the cake in, they found a big, colorful cake already inside! Sue and her mom were very surprised. They didn't know how the cake got there.
Sue said, "Wow! This is just like the cake in my dream!" They took the cake out of the oven and put it on the table. Sue and her mom had a fun time eating the cake together. They laughed and wondered how the cake got there, but they were happy it did.

When the friends came to Lily's house, they saw that she had hung up a sign that said "Costume Party". Everyone put on their costumes and started to play. They danced, laughed, and had a great time. At the end of the party, Lily gave a prize to the person with the best costume. They all agreed it was a fun day and they loved playing dress-up together.

One day, a boy named Tim went to play at his friend's house. His friend, Sam, had a big box of colors. Tim loved colors and wanted to draw with them. Sam said, "Let's draw together!" They were very happy to draw pictures.
As they were drawing, Tim saw a color he had never seen before. It was a mix of blue and green. Tim wanted to use this color, but he knew it was Sam's favorite. Tim felt guilty, but he used the color anyway. When Sam saw Tim using his favorite color, he was sad.
Tim saw Sam's sad face and felt bad. He said, "I'm sorry, Sam. I should not have used your favorite color without asking. Let's share the color and draw together." Sam smiled and they both used the special color to make a big, beautiful picture. They were happy again, and promised to always share their colors with each other.

Ben and Lily were eager to go to the park. They put on their hats and shoes and ran to the door. Mom said, "Wait, you need to hold my hand. The road is busy and you could get hurt."
But Ben and Lily did not listen. They wanted to play on the swings and slides. They opened the door and ran outside. Mom shouted, "Stop, come back!" But they did not hear her.
They crossed the street without looking. A big car was coming fast. The driver saw them and honked. Ben and Lily got scared and tried to run back. But Lily stumbled on a rock and fell down. Ben tried to help her, but it was too late. The car hit them and they did not get up.
Mom ran to them and cried. She hugged them and said, "I'm sorry, I'm sorry. I love you." But they did not answer. They were gone. It was a very sad time.
<|endoftext|>


Lily and Tom are friends. They like to play in the park. They see a big slide. Lily wants to go first. She climbs up the ladder. Tom waits at the bottom.
"Look at me, Tom!" Lily says. She sits on the slide. She is ready to go down.
But then she sees a white note on the slide. It has some words on it. Lily does not know what they mean. She picks up the note. She tries to read it.
"What is that, Lily?" Tom asks. He is curious. He wants to see the note too.
"I don't know, Tom. It is a note. It has words. But I can't read them." Lily says. She shows the note to Tom.
Tom looks at the note. He can't read it either. He thinks it is boring. He wants to slide.
"Let me see, Lily." Tom says. He tries to take the note from Lily.
But Lily does not want to give it to him. She thinks it is important. She wants to keep it.
"No, Tom. It is mine. I found it." Lily says. She holds the note tight.
Tom gets angry. He wants the note too. He pushes Lily.
Lily falls off the slide. She drops the note. She hurts her knee. She starts to cry.
Tom feels bad. He did not mean to hurt Lily. He picks up the note. He gives it back to Lily.
"I'm sorry, Lily. I was wrong. I should not have pushed you." Tom says. He helps Lily get up.
Lily stops crying. She takes the note. She forgives Tom.
"It's okay, Tom. I'm sorry too. I should have shared with you." Lily says. She hugs Tom.
They are friends again. They decide to leave the note on the slide. Maybe someone else can read it. They go to play on the swings. They have fun.
<|endoftext|>


Anna and Ben are playing in the park. They see a big bird fly in the sky. They want to fly too.
"Let's make wings with paper and dust!" Anna says. She finds some paper and dust on the ground. She sticks them together with glue.
"Look, I have wings!" Anna says. She puts them on her arms and runs. She tries to fly, but she falls.
"Ouch!" Anna says. She cries. Her wings are broken.
Ben laughs. He thinks Anna is silly. He says, "You can't fly with paper and dust. You need feathers and wind."
Anna is angry. She says, "You are mean. You don't know anything. Paper and dust are magic. They can make me fly."
Ben says, "No, they can't. You are lying. Show me how you fly."
Anna says, "Fine. I will show you. But you have to close your eyes."
Ben says, "OK. I will close my eyes. But you have to be quick."
Anna says, "OK. I will be quick." She closes her eyes too. She wishes very hard. She wants to fly.
She feels a mild breeze on her face. She feels light and free. She opens her eyes. She sees the sky and the clouds. She is flying!
She looks down. She sees Ben. He is still on the ground. He is still closing his eyes. He is waiting for her.
She smiles. She says, "Look, Ben. I am flying. I told you paper and dust are magic."
Ben hears her voice. He opens his eyes. He sees her in the air. He is shocked. He says, "Wow! How did you do that?"
Anna says, "I don't know. I just wished and believed. Do you want to fly with me?"
Ben says, "Yes, I do. I am sorry I laughed at you. You are not silly. You are amazing."
Anna says, "It's OK. I forgive you. Come on, let's fly together."
She flies down. She gives him a hug. She gives him some paper and dust. She says, "Put these on your arms. Close your eyes. Wish and believe. Then you can fly too."
Ben does what she says. He feels a mild breeze on his face. He feels light and free. He opens his eyes. He sees the sky and the clouds. He is flying!
He sees Anna. She is smiling. She says, "We did it! We are flying!"
They fly together. They have fun. They are happy. They are friends.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He had a big sack. He liked to put things in his sack. One day, he found a cute cat. He wanted to play with the cat. But the cat did not want to play. The cat ran away.
Tim felt sad. He did not know why the cat ran away. He wanted to know more. He asked his mom. His mom said, "You need to learn more about cats. You don't know much about them now. That's why the cat ran away."
Tim listened to his mom. He learned more about cats. He learned how to play with them. He learned how to be kind to them. He was not ignorant anymore. He found the cat again. This time, the cat played with him. Tim felt happy. He put his toys in his sack and played with the cat every day.

Once upon a time, there was a sweet little girl named Sara. She lived with her mom and dad in a small house. They were a happy family. One day, Sara's mom gave her a pretty copper coin. Sara loved the shiny coin and wanted to keep it safe.
Sara went to her friend Tom and said, "Look at my new shiny copper coin! I want to keep it safe. What should I do?" Tom thought for a moment and said, "You can wrap it in a soft cloth. That will keep it safe and clean."
Sara was happy with Tom's idea. She found a soft cloth and wrapped her copper coin in it. She put the wrapped coin in a little box and kept it under her bed. Every day, Sara would take out the box, unwrap the coin, and look at it with a big smile.
One day, Sara lost her wrapped coin. She was very sad and cried. Her mom and dad searched the whole house but could not find it. Sara went to Tom and told him about the lost coin. Tom said, "Don't worry, Sara. We will find it together."
Sara and Tom searched and searched. Finally, they found the wrapped coin under a big tree in the yard. Sara was so happy! She thanked Tom and said, "You are a good friend." From that day on, Sara and Tom played together every day, and they were the best of friends.

As he walked, he met a little bird named Sue. Sue was hungry. Tom said, "I can cook you some food." Sue was very happy. 
Tom and Sue went back to Tom's house. Tom cooked some yummy food for Sue. Sue said, "Thank you, Tom!" They both ate and had a great time. From that day on, they were the best of friends.

Pilot felt much better and his plane flew higher and higher. He kept flying and never stopped. Pilot was brave, and he kept on flying in his plane. Chew, chew, chew, he went until he reached his destination. He was so happy to be there. The end.

One day, a little girl named Sue and her dog, Max, went for a walk in the park. They saw a big tree with lots of red and purple jam on it. Sue and Max thought it was very strange, but they both liked jam, so they went to take a closer look. 
As they got closer to the tree, they saw a group of ants joining together to carry the jam away. Sue and Max watched as the ants worked together to take the jam to their home. They were very good at working together.
Sue had an idea. She asked the ants if she and Max could join them and help carry the jam. The ants were happy to have Sue and Max help. They all worked together and carried the jam to the ant's home. But when they got there, they found out the jam was not really jam – it was paint! The ants had been taking paint from a painter's bucket nearby. Everyone laughed at the silly mix-up, and Sue and Max made new friends with the ants.

One day, a little monkey was playing in the jungle. He saw a big, mysterious box. The monkey was curious and wanted to see what was inside.
As the monkey walked closer to the box, he stumbled on a rock. "Ouch!" he said. He got up and opened the box. Inside, he found a big, shiny ball. The monkey was so happy and started to play with the ball.
But then, another monkey came and wanted the ball too. "Give me the ball!" said the other monkey. The first monkey didn't want to share. They both started to fight over the shiny ball. Then, a wise old monkey saw them fighting and said, "Stop! If you both play together, you can have more fun." The two little monkeys listened and started to play with the ball together. They became good friends and had lots of fun in the jungle.

One day, a smelly cat and a little dog were playing with a ball. The cat wanted to kick the ball, but the dog wanted to play with it too. They both tried to get the ball at the same time.
"Let me kick the ball!" said the cat. "No, I want to play with it!" said the dog. They were not happy and did not want to share. The cat and the dog started to fight over the ball.
Then, a big fan came and blew the ball away. The cat and the dog stopped fighting and looked at each other. They decided to work together to get the ball back. They ran and jumped to catch the ball.
In the end, the cat and the dog learned to share the ball and play together. They had fun and became good friends. The smelly cat and the little dog were happy, and they played with the ball every day.

One day, Dan and his mom went to the store. As they walked around, Dan spotted a bookcase. He quickly started to run!
His mom smiled, and said, "Come join me here. It's okay."
Dan ran over and asked, "What is it?"
His mom said, "It's a bookcase. You can put your books on it." 
Dan thought for a moment, then said, "I want to join!"
His mom gave a slow nod, and said, "Well, okay. Here, take my hand and we'll walk to it together." 
Eventually, they reached the bookcase. Dan looked up and said, "It's really big!"
His mom chuckled and said, "Yes it is. But we'll go slow. We'll figure out how to get it home, okay?" 
Dan smiled and said, "Yes, okay!" So Dan and his mom went slow and carefully carried the bookcase home, already looking forward to all the fun reading they would do together.

Lily read her poem to her friends at school. But one boy, named Jack, did not like poems. Jack said, "I hate poems, they are silly!" Lily felt embarrassed and sad. She did not want anyone to hate her poem.
Later, Lily's teacher heard about what happened. She told Lily, "Do not worry, everyone has different likes. You keep writing your poems, because they are special." Lily smiled and felt better. She knew that even if Jack did not like her poem, there were others who did. And she kept writing her poems, because they made her happy.

"Mom, can I have the big chocolate egg?" asked Tim. "No, Tim," said his mom. "It's too big and fragile. It might break. Let's get a small chocolate bar instead."
But Tim did not listen. He took the big chocolate egg and started to walk. He did not see the wet floor sign. Tim slipped and fell. The big chocolate egg broke into many small pieces.
Tim was very sad. He cried and cried. His mom said, "I told you the egg was too fragile. Next time, you should listen and be careful." Tim learned his lesson, but he still had no chocolate to eat.

Then, the kind lady saw a trail of food on the floor. She followed the trail and found the food hidden under her bed! It was a big surprise. Fluffy had hidden the food there to save it for later. Once there was a cat called Tom. Tom was always very hungry and he loved to eat food. One day, Tom was feeling extra hungry. So he decided to hunt for some food. He looked around and found a big piece of cheese. He was very happy, so he sat down and started to eat it. 
But when Tom bit into the cheese, it split. Tom was very sad. His food had split in two. Tom worried that he would not have enough to eat. 
But then Tom saw a mouse running away from the cheese. Tom chased after it, and the mouse led him to a fine bowl of food. It was just the right size for Tom. He ate all the food in the bowl and then he was full. 
Tom felt much better. He thanked the mouse for leading him to the food. From then on, Tom never split his food again!

The little girl held the medal in the palm of her hand and admired it. It was so beautiful! She had never seen such a pretty medal before. She twirled it around and around in her hand.

As they ate their yummy food, the rabbit had an idea. "Let's race!" he said. The other animals agreed, and they all got ready to run. The bear, mouse, and elephant were excited to see who would be the fastest.
The race began, and the rabbit ran very fast. The bear and the mouse tried to keep up, but they were not as fast as the rabbit. The generous elephant knew he was slow, so he cheered for his friends instead of racing.
At the end of the race, the rabbit won. The friends were happy and tired. They went back to their picnic spot under the big tree and shared more yummy food. The generous elephant gave each of his friends a big piece of his favorite fruit. They all laughed, ate, and enjoyed their day together.

Tim gave the dog some popcorn, and then he rubbed the dog's head. The dog was so happy! But then, something unexpected happened. The dog started to change! It grew bigger and bigger, and its fur turned into feathers. Tim was very surprised!
The dog was not a dog at all, but a big bird! The bird looked at Tim and said, "Thank you for the popcorn and the rub. I was a dog because of a magic spell. You helped me become a bird again!" Tim was happy he could help, and he waved goodbye as the bird flew away.

One day, a little frog named Tim hopped by a stream. The water in the stream was sweet and cool. Tim liked to sit by the stream and blink his big eyes. He loved to watch the fish swim by.
One day, while Tim was sitting by the stream, he saw a big, round thing in the water. "What is that?" he asked a fish. The fish said, "I don't know, but it is not a fish." Tim was curious and wanted to find out what it was.
Tim hopped closer to the big, round thing. He blinked his big eyes and saw that it was a big, sweet fruit! The fruit had fallen into the stream and was floating away. Tim jumped into the water and pushed the big, sweet fruit to the side of the stream. All the animals came to eat the sweet fruit, and they all thanked Tim for his help.

Sally and Tim went to the park to play with the trumpet. Tim tried to blow into it, but nothing happened. He tried again, but still no sound. Suddenly, Tim had an idea. "I will throw the trumpet in the air, and when it comes down, it will make a big noise!" he said. Sally thought it was a fun idea.
Tim threw the trumpet high in the sky. It went up, up, up! Then, it came down, down, down! When the white trumpet hit the ground, it made a loud noise! "Boom!" Tim and Sally laughed and clapped. They played with the trumpet all day, throwing it in the air and listening to the big noise it made when it landed.

Once there was a boy and his dad. They went out to the park to play. The grass was dry and crunchy. 
The dad said to the boy, "Let's play a game. You support my feet and I'll pretend I'm walking on the air!"
The boy was excited and happily ran to help his dad. He held his dad's feet and walked backwards. As the boy looked up, he saw a tall man. 
The man yelled, "Hey! What are you doing? That's not allowed here!" 
The dad quickly said, "We were just playing. We won't do it again." 
But the man didn't stop. He ran towards the boy and dad, and started to push them away. 
The dad quickly grabbed the boy and ran away. They didn't stop running until they were far away from the park. 
The boy looked back sadly at the dry grass, silently wishing they could have stayed to play.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved the color blue. His room was blue, his clothes were blue, and he even had a blue toy car.
One day, Tim was playing with his blue toy car when he saw a new object in his room. It was a big blue box with a pretty ribbon. Tim wanted to open the box but he could not untie the ribbon. He tried and tried but he could not do it.
Tim's big sister, Sue, saw him and wanted to help. They worked together to untie the ribbon. With Sue's help, Tim could finish opening the big blue box. Inside the box, there was a new blue toy for Tim to play with. Tim was so happy and thanked Sue for helping him. They played with the new toy all day and had lots of fun.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a cat named Tim. One day, Tim went to visit his best friend, a dog named Max. Max lived in a big red house. Tim thought the house was very pretty. But sometimes, their play dates were boring. Tim wanted to find a fun game to play.
Tim said, "Max, let's find a new game to play. I don't want to be bored." Max agreed, "Yes, let's make this visit fun!" So, they went outside to look for a game. They saw a ball near a tree. It was big and blue. Tim had an idea. "Let's play a game with this ball!"
Tim and Max decided to play a game called "Strike and Catch." Tim would strike the ball with his paw, and Max would try to catch it in his mouth. They played the game all day long. They laughed and ran around the yard. Their visit was not boring anymore. Tim and Max were very happy.
<|endoftext|>
One day, a little girl named Lucy went for a walk in the woods. She saw a big tree with many delicious red apples on it. Lucy wanted to eat one, so she tried to reach up and pick it. But, she was too small.
A friendly bird saw Lucy and said, "Do you need help?" Lucy nodded and said, "Yes, please. I want a delicious apple from the tree." The bird flew up and picked an apple for her. Lucy was very happy to receive the apple.
Just as Lucy was about to take a bite, a little boy came running. He was crying because he was hungry. Lucy looked at the boy and then at her apple. She decided to give the apple to the boy. He stopped crying and smiled. Lucy felt happy, too. Then, something unexpected happened. The tree started to shake, and more apples fell to the ground. Lucy, the boy, and the bird all shared the delicious apples and had a great time.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim had a big bucket. One sunny day, Tim went to play outside. He found a small, mild hill. Tim had a fun idea.
Tim filled his bucket with snow from the hill. He made a snowman. Tim said, "Hello, Mr. Snowman!" The snowman did not talk. Tim was sad.
Then, the sun came out. It was warm. The snowman started to melt. Tim said, "Oh no, Mr. Snowman!" Tim's mom came and said, "Don't be sad, Tim. We can make a new snowman another day." Tim smiled and went inside to play.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a little red car named Bobby. Bobby loved to travel fast. One day, Bobby met a big blue truck named Timmy.
Bobby said, "Hi Timmy, let's travel together!" Timmy said, "Okay, let's go!" They went under a big bridge. Bobby was impatient and wanted to go faster. Timmy said, "Slow down, Bobby!"
Bobby didn't want to slow down. He went faster and faster. Timmy said, "Bobby, be careful!" But Bobby didn't listen. He went so fast that he got lost.
Bobby was sad and said, "I should have listened to Timmy." He looked around and found his way back to Timmy. They traveled together, and Bobby learned to be patient. They became best friends and had lots of fun.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a big, tough box. The box was gold and very pretty. It was in a room with many toys. All the boys and girls wanted to open the box, but it was too hard.
One day, a little boy named Tim tried to open the gold box. He pulled and pulled, but the box would not open. Tim was sad. He really wanted to see what was inside the box.
Tim asked his friends to help him. They all tried to open the tough gold box together. With one big pull, the box opened! Inside, they found many fun toys and games. They were all very happy and played with the toys all day.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She had a pet cat named Tom. Tom loved to eat tuna. One day, Tom was upset because he could not find any tuna to eat.
Amy saw Tom was upset and said, "Don't worry, Tom. Let's talk to Mom and ask her for some tuna." So, they went to the kitchen to find Mom. They talked to Mom about the tuna. Mom said, "I have a surprise for you."
Mom opened a big can of tuna. But, when she opened it, they found a little fish inside! The little fish said, "Please don't eat me. I am lost and want to go home." Amy, Tom, and Mom were surprised.
Amy said, "We will help you go home." They took the little fish to the sea and set it free. The little fish was happy and swam away. The moral of the story is to always help others when they need it, even if it is unexpected.
<|endoftext|>


Lily and Ben were playing in the park. They liked to pick up leaves and make shapes with them. Lily found a big green leaf and showed it to Ben.
"Look, Ben, this leaf is like a heart!" she said.
Ben nodded and smiled. He liked Lily's leaf. He wanted to find one too. He looked around and saw a yellow leaf on the ground. He picked it up and held it next to Lily's leaf.
"Look, Lily, this leaf is like a star!" he said.
But Lily did not hear him. She was deaf. She could not hear any sounds. She only saw Ben's mouth move. She did not know what he said. She felt sad.
"Ben, I can't hear you. I am deaf. You have to show me what you say." she said.
Ben looked at Lily. He did not know she was deaf. He felt sorry. He wanted to make her happy. He thought of an idea. He took Lily's hand and pointed to his leaf. He made a star shape with his fingers. He pointed to Lily's leaf. He made a heart shape with his fingers. He pointed to both of them. He made a hug shape with his arms.
"Look, Lily, this means I like your leaf and I like you. We are friends. We belong together." he said.
Lily saw Ben's signs. She understood what he said. She smiled and hugged him. She liked Ben's leaf and she liked him. They were friends. They belonged together. They played with their leaves and had fun.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a gentle bunny named Bob. Bob had a toy pistol. He loved to play with his toy pistol in the yard. It made him feel like a big, brave bunny.
One day, Bob saw a big ball stuck in a tree. He wanted to get the ball down. Bob had an idea. He would use his toy pistol to help him. He aimed the pistol at the ball and pretended to shoot.
Bob struggled to get the ball down. He jumped and hopped, but the ball was still stuck. Bob did not give up. He tried and tried, but the ball was too high.
Finally, Bob's friend, a tall giraffe named Gina, came to help. Gina reached her long neck up to the tree and gently pushed the ball out. Bob was so happy! He thanked Gina and they played together all day.

Once upon a time, in a small house, lived a hungry little girl named Lily. She loved to eat yummy food. One day, she saw a big tree with many peaches on it. The peaches were round and orange. Lily wanted to eat them.
Lily walked to the tree and tried to grab a peach. But the peaches were too high for her. She jumped and jumped, but she could not reach them. She was sad and still hungry.
Then, a nice tall boy named Tom came by. He saw Lily and asked, "Why are you sad?" Lily told him about the peaches. Tom helped her by grabbing a peach from the tree. Lily was so happy and said, "Thank you, Tom!" They both sat under the tree and ate the peaches. They were not hungry anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a big forest. In the forest, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim liked to follow his dad when he went to cut wood. One day, Tim and his dad went into the forest. Tim's dad had a heavy axe to cut the wood.
Tim's dad said, "Tim, you stay here. I will go cut wood." Tim sat on a rock and watched his dad go. But Tim wanted to help, so he picked up a small stick and started to follow his dad.
Tim saw his dad cut a big tree with the heavy axe. Tim tried to help by hitting the tree with his small stick. His dad smiled and said, "Thank you, Tim. You are a good helper!" Tim and his dad went home with the wood, happy to have spent the day together in the forest.

Once upon a time, there was a fast dog named Max. Max loved to run and play all day. He was so fast that no one could catch him. Max was very brave and would dare to do anything.
One day, Max was playing in the park when he found a big bone. He dared to dig it up and take it home. Max was so excited about his new bone. But, Max was running too fast and he tripped on a rock. Max was hurt and needed to see a doctor.
The doctor took Max to a special room with a big machine. The machine was called an x-ray. The x-ray showed Max's leg to see if it was broken. The doctor looked at the x-ray and said, "Max, you are a very lucky dog. Your leg is not broken, but you need to be more careful when you run fast." Max was happy and promised to be more careful when he played.
<|endoftext|>

Toby was a three year old who enjoyed going to the movies. Every Saturday, Toby went to the theater with his dad and they chose a movie to watch. This week they choose an original movie that they’ve never seen before. 
Toby was so excited — he couldn’t wait to see the movie! As soon as the movie began, Toby was entranced. He watched with joy as the characters danced across the screen and sang beautiful songs.
The movie continued and Toby became more and more excited — as it went on, he noticed that the plot seemed very familiar. By the time the movie reached it's climax, Toby knew what was about to happen — and sure enough, the ending was just like Toby had predicted! Toby couldn’t believe it — the original movie he had chosen was the same movie he watched every week at the theater! 
Toby was really proud that he had chosen the original movie. He smiled and looked over at his dad with a look of accomplishment. His dad smiled too, proud that Toby had chosen so wisely.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time there was a girl who loved to go for walks. On this day, she decided to go for a walk in the park.
When she arrived she was amazed by the impressive trees and beautiful flowers. She looked around and saw a big lake.
She got closer the the lake and saw a cute duck swimming in the lake. She was so happy and excited that she started looking at the duck closely.
She admired the duck's beautiful feathers which were so soft and had a nice texture.
She said to the duck, "You are so beautiful. I admire you so much!" 
The duck was so happy that it started swimming faster and making fun sounds. The girl laughed and was happy to see how impressed the duck was.
Finally, she hugged the duck and said goodbye. After that, she started to walk back home with a smile knowing that the duck was happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to ride his bike. Every day, he would ride up and down the street, feeling very proud of himself. Tim's mom would watch him ride and clap her hands, happy to see her son having fun.
One day, Tim saw his friend Sally sitting on the sidewalk, crying. Sally had dropped her pastry on the ground, and she was very sad. Tim wanted to help Sally feel better, so he had an idea. He went to his mom and asked for a pastry.
Tim's mom gave him a pastry, and he rode his bike to Sally. He gave the pastry to Sally, and she stopped crying. Sally was so happy that she hugged Tim. They both felt good inside, knowing that sharing and helping friends is important.
From that day on, Tim and Sally always helped each other and shared their things. They learned that being kind and sharing with friends makes everyone happy. And every time Tim rode his bike, he felt proud to be a good friend.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a little girl named Lily and her mom. Lily had a wiggly tooth. She was very excited about it. She wanted her tooth to come out so the Tooth Fairy would come and visit her.
One day, Lily's mom was trying to put on her shoe, but it was too tight. It did not fit. "Oh no, my shoe won't fit!" she said. Lily saw her mom needed help. She went to her mom and said, "Let me help you, Mom!" Lily pushed the shoe, and it fit her mom's foot. Her mom was happy and thanked Lily.
Later that day, Lily's wiggly tooth fell out. She showed her mom, and they both laughed. Lily put the tooth under her pillow and went to sleep. That night, the Tooth Fairy came and took the tooth. She left a shiny coin for Lily. In the morning, Lily found the coin and was so happy. She showed her mom, and they both knew the Tooth Fairy had visited.
<|endoftext|>


Tom and Mia liked to pretend. They pretended to be pirates, or astronauts, or superheroes. They used their toys and their imagination to make up stories and adventures.
One day, they found a large glass in the kitchen. It was bigger than their heads, and shiny and clear. They wondered what they could pretend with it. Tom had an idea. He said, "Let's pretend this is a magic glass. It can show us anything we want to see."
Mia liked the idea. She said, "OK, what do you want to see?" Tom thought for a moment. He said, "I want to see a dinosaur. A big, scary dinosaur." He held the glass in front of his face and looked inside. He made a roar and said, "Look, there's a dinosaur. It's coming to get us. Run!"
Mia laughed and ran with him. She said, "My turn, my turn. I want to see a fairy. A pretty, sparkly fairy." She took the glass from Tom and looked inside. She made a tinkling sound and said, "Look, there's a fairy. She's flying to us. She wants to be our friend. Come!"
Tom smiled and followed her. They played with the glass for a long time, pretending to see different things. They had fun and forgot about everything else.
But they did not notice that their mom was watching them. She had a surprise for them. She had bought them a new book, with pictures of dinosaurs and fairies and many other things. She waited for them to finish playing, and then she said, "Tom, Mia, I have something for you. Come and see."
They ran to her and saw the book. They were very happy and excited. They said, "Wow, thank you, mom. This is the best book ever. Can you read it to us?"
Mom said, "Of course, I can. But first, let's put the glass back in the kitchen. It's not a toy, you know. It's for drinking juice or water."
Tom and Mia nodded. They said, "OK, mom. We're sorry. We were just pretending."
Mom said, "I know, and that's fine. Pretending is good. It helps you learn and have fun. But you also have to be careful and respectful with things that are not yours. Do you understand?"
Tom and Mia said, "Yes, mom. We understand. We love you."
Mom said, "I love you too. Now, let's go and read the book. I'm sure you'll find many more things to pretend with."

Once upon a time, there was a brave dog named Spot. Spot had a job. His job was to help people. He liked his job a lot.
One day, Spot met a little girl named Lily. Lily was lost and scared. She said, "Can you help me, Spot? I can't find my mom." Spot wagged his tail and said, "Yes, I can help you, Lily."
Spot and Lily walked and walked. They looked for Lily's mom. Soon, they found her. Lily hugged her mom and said, "Thank you, Spot, for being so brave and helping me." Spot was happy he did his job well.

Once upon a time, there was a wise cat named Tom. Tom lived in a big house with his best friend, a little girl named Lily. They liked to play together every day at noon. One day, they were playing in the garden when a new cat named Max came to visit.
Tom said to Max, "Do you want to play with us?" Max nodded and said, "Yes, I would like that." So, Tom, Lily, and Max played together until they were all very tired. They had so much fun!
Then, something unexpected happened. Max offered Tom and Lily a big, shiny toy. But when they tried to play with it, the toy broke into many pieces! Max felt very sad and said, "I'm sorry, I didn't know it would break." Tom and Lily smiled and said, "That's okay, Max. We can still play together without the toy." And they all played happily ever after.

One day, Bob and Liz were playing outside. Liz was pushing Bob on the swing. It was really hot outside, and they were both sweating. Suddenly, Bob heard a loud sound coming from the tree in their yard. When they looked closer, they saw a dead bird lying on the ground. 
Bob and Liz were both scared. They didn't know what to do. But then, Bob had an idea. He quickly grabbed a stick and started poking the bird with it. He wanted to see if it would move. 
That's when the bird suddenly opened its eyes and started repeating the same thing over and over again - "hot, hot, hot!" 
Bob and Liz were shocked. They had just awoken the dead bird with their stick! Bob quickly grabbed Liz and they ran inside the house. 
From then on, Bob and Liz knew that it was important not to repeat the same thing over and over again.
<|endoftext|>


Tim and Sue wanted to play in the old store. They liked to look at the old things and pretend they were new. But their mom said no. She said the store was dirty and dangerous. She said there were many cobwebs and rats and broken glass. She said they could get hurt or sick.
But Tim and Sue did not listen. They waited until mom was busy and ran to the store. They opened the door and went inside. It was dark and dusty. They saw many cobwebs on the walls and ceiling. They saw some rats run away. They saw some broken glass on the floor. They did not care. They thought it was fun.
They found some old clothes and hats and shoes. They tried them on and laughed. They found some old toys and books and games. They played with them and had fun. They did not see the sign that said "Danger! Do not enter!"
They did not hear the creaking sound. They did not feel the floor shaking. They did not notice the crack in the wall. They did not know the store was going to fall.
The store fell down with a loud noise. Tim and Sue screamed. They were trapped under the rubble. They could not move. They could not see. They could not breathe. They were scared and hurt and sad.
Their mom heard the noise. She ran to the store. She saw the dust and smoke. She saw the rubble and the sign. She cried and cried. She called for help. But it was too late. Tim and Sue were gone.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys. One day, Lily's mom told her they were going on a trip. Lily was very happy. She had to pack her bag with her toys and clothes.
Lily saw a fake cactus in her room. She thought it was funny and put it in her bag too. When they got to their trip, Lily and her family went to the park. Lily took out her toys and the fake cactus to play.
A boy named Tim saw the fake cactus and thought it was real. He was scared to touch it because real cacti are prickly. Lily showed Tim that it was fake and they both laughed. They played together and became friends. The moral of the story is to not be scared of things that look different, because they might be fun and make new friends.

Once upon a time, there was a kind cat named Sam. Sam loved to drive his little red car. He would drive it up and down the street, waving to all his friends.
One day, Sam saw a crack on the road. He did not want his friends to get hurt by the crack. So, he decided to help them. Sam drove to the store and got some things to fix the crack.
Sam worked hard to fix the crack. Soon, the road was smooth again. His friends were very happy and thanked Sam for being so kind. They all played together and had a fun day. And Sam was proud that he could help his friends.

One day, a brilliant rainbow came to the sky. It was big and bright. All the kids loved to look at it. They would point and say, "Wow, look at the pretty colors!" The rainbow was very happy.
But one day, the rainbow was gone. The kids were sad. They did not know where the rainbow went. They looked and looked, but it was not in the sky. The kids missed the rainbow very much.
Then, one day, the rainbow returned. But it was not the same. It was a twisty rainbow! The kids were so surprised. They had never seen a twisty rainbow before. They laughed and clapped. The twisty rainbow was happy, and so were the kids.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a brown dog named Max. Max loved to play and have fun. One day, Max saw a big party happening in the park. He wanted to go and join the fun.
Max went to the party and saw many friends. He saw a cat named Lucy. Lucy said, "Hi Max, do you want to play with us?" Max was happy and said, "Yes, I want to play!" They played games, ate yummy food, and danced.
Then, a new dog appeared at the party. The new dog was shy and scared. Max saw the new dog and said, "Hi, I am Max. What is your name?" The new dog said, "I am Sam." Max asked Sam to play with them. Sam was happy and played with Max and Lucy.
At the end of the day, Max, Lucy, and Sam were tired but happy. They learned that being kind and making new friends is a good thing. They promised to always be nice to new friends and have fun together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. She lived in a small house with her mom and dad. Mia was a nervous girl who did not like loud noises or big crowds. She loved to play with her toys and stretch her arms up high like a big tree.
One sunny day, Mia's mom asked her to help set the table for lunch. "Mia, please put this glass on the table," said her mom. Mia was scared to hold the glass because it was shiny and looked like it could break. She held it very carefully and walked slowly to the table.
As Mia put the glass down, a funny thing happened. A tiny bird flew through the open window and landed on the glass. Mia was so surprised that she laughed out loud. The bird didn't seem nervous at all. It stretched its wings and flew around the room. Mia's mom and dad came in, and they all laughed together. The little bird had made Mia forget her fears, and now she was not nervous to hold a glass anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a grumpy bear named Bobo. Bobo lived in a small house in the woods. One day, Bobo found a flag outside his house. The flag was dirty, so Bobo decided to wipe it clean.
Bobo's friend, a little bird named Chirpy, saw him cleaning the flag. Chirpy asked, "What are you doing, Bobo?" Bobo replied, "I found a flag and I'm wiping it clean." Chirpy wanted to help, so they both wiped the flag together.
After they finished, they put the flag up on a tall tree. Bobo and Chirpy were so happy to see the clean flag waving in the wind. They danced and played under the flag all day. The grumpy bear wasn't grumpy anymore, thanks to his friend Chirpy and their new, clean flag.

Once upon a time there were two siblings, Jack and Jill. They had gone to the park to play.
Jack said to Jill, "Let's go play jazz!"
Jill replied, "That sounds like a lot of fun! I have a plan, let's have a jazz party!"
The siblings smiled at each other and ran off to find some friends to join the party. Jack was feeling extra bossy, so he shouted at his friends, "Come on, hurry up!"
Jack and Jill had assembled quite a few friends, and everyone was ready to get the party started.
Jack had his saxophone, Jill had her clarinet, and the rest of the kids had their tambourines and drums, and it sounded like all the angels in heaven were singing.
Everyone was having a great time dancing and playing all the jazz music.  The party went on for a few hours, and when it was all over, the friends agreed it was the best jazz party ever. 
Jack was very proud of himself for being so bossy and getting everyone together.

Once upon a time, there was a little pen. The pen was blue and it liked to draw. The pen had many friends. They would play and have fun all day.
One day, the pen was very hungry. It needed to draw more to be happy. So, the pen went to find some paper. The pen found a big, white paper and started to draw. It drew a sun, a tree, and a house. The pen was very happy.
After a while, the pen was not hungry anymore. It had drawn a beautiful picture. The pen showed the picture to its friends. They all loved it. The pen was happy and proud. And they all played together again.

Sara likes to play with her dolls. She has many dolls with different clothes and hair. She likes to brush their hair and make them look pretty. But today, she wants to try something new. She wants to make their hair wild.
She takes her scissors and goes to her room. She kneels on the floor and picks up a doll. She cuts the doll's hair very short and messy. She thinks it looks funny. She laughs and picks up another doll. She cuts the doll's hair very long and curly. She thinks it looks silly. She laughs and picks up another doll. She cuts the doll's hair in different colors and shapes. She thinks it looks crazy. She laughs and picks up another doll.
But then, she hears a voice. It is her mom. She is coming to her room. Sara is scared. She knows her mom will be angry. She hides the scissors and the dolls under her bed. She hopes her mom will not see them. She pretends to read a book. She tries to look good.
Her mom opens the door and smiles. She says, "Hi, Sara. What are you doing?" Sara says, "I am reading a book, mom. It is a good book." Her mom says, "That's nice, Sara. Can I see your book?" Sara says, "Yes, mom. Here is my book." She gives her mom the book. Her mom looks at the book. She sees that it is upside down. She says, "Sara, why is your book upside down?" Sara says, "Oh, I did not know, mom. I am sorry, mom." Her mom says, "It's okay, Sara. But I think you need to learn how to read better. Maybe we can practice later. But first, can I see your dolls? I want to see how pretty they are." Sara says, "No, mom. You cannot see my dolls. They are sleeping. They are very tired. They need to rest." Her mom says, "Really? That's strange. I thought you liked to play with your dolls. Why are they sleeping?" Sara says, "They are sleeping because they are bored, mom. They have nothing to do. They have no fun." Her mom says, "That's sad, Sara. Maybe you can make them some fun. Maybe you can give them some new clothes or hair. Do you want to do that?" Sara says, "No, mom. I do not want to do that. I like their clothes and hair. They are very nice. They are very wild." Her mom says, "Wild? What do you mean, wild?" Sara says, "Nothing, mom. I mean, they are very happy. They are very wild and happy." Her mom says, "Hmm, I see. Well, I guess they are happy then. But I still want to see them. Can I please see them, Sara?" Sara says, "No, mom. You cannot see them. Please go away, mom. Please leave me alone, mom." Her mom says, "Sara, why are you being rude? Why are you hiding your dolls? What are you hiding, Sara?" Sara says, "Nothing, mom. I am hiding nothing. Please go away, mom. Please leave me alone, mom." Her mom says, "Sara, I am your mom. I love you. I want to help you. I want to see what you are hiding. Please show me, Sara. Please be honest, Sara." Sara says, "No, mom. I cannot show you. I cannot be honest. You will be mad, mom. You will be very mad." Her mom says, "Sara, I will not be mad. I will be understanding. I will be kind. Please trust me, Sara. Please show me, Sara." Sara says, "No, mom. I cannot trust you. I cannot show you. You will be mad, mom. You will be very mad." Her mom says, "Sara, please. Please, Sara. Please." Sara says, "No, mom. No, mom. No, mom."

Once upon a time, in an ancient land, there was a boy named Tom. Tom liked to get up early and go to work with his dad. They went to a big place where they dug in the dirt to find old things.
One day, while they were digging, Tom found a big box. He was very excited and called his dad over. They opened the box together and found a big, shiny rock. They didn't know what it was, but they knew it was special.
Tom and his dad took the rock home to show mom. When they got home, mom looked at the rock and started to laugh. She said, "That's not a special rock, it's just a big, shiny ball!" Tom and his dad were surprised, but they all had a good laugh and played with the ball together.

Once upon a time, there was a noisy bird. The bird liked to sing all the time. The bird had many friends who liked to listen to the bird sing.
One day, the bird's friend, a cat, wanted to send a gift to another friend. The cat asked the bird to help. The bird said yes and took the gift to send it far away.
The bird flew for a long time to send the gift. When the gift got to the friend, they were very happy. The bird sang a happy song and flew back home. The cat and the bird were happy they could help a friend.

Once upon a time, there was a clumsy cat named Tom. Tom was always making a mess. One day, Tom wanted to work and help his friend, Sam the dog.
Tom asked Sam, "Can I help you?" Sam said, "Yes, you can help me find my toy." They looked high and low for the toy. Tom was clumsy and knocked over a cup, but they kept looking.
At last, they found the toy under a big tree. Tom and Sam were happy. They played together all day. Even though Tom was clumsy, he made Sam's life fun and full of love.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a big rhinoceros. He was very strong and had a big horn on his nose. He lived in a beautiful place with many trees and flowers. The rhinoceros liked to play with his friends, the birds and the monkeys.
One day, while the rhinoceros was walking, he saw a little bird stuck in a tree. The little bird was very scared and was shouting for help. The rhinoceros wanted to help the little bird, but he didn't know how.
The rhinoceros thought for a moment and then had an idea. He stood under the tree and used his big horn to gently push the tree. The tree moved and the little bird was free. The bird was very happy and thanked the rhinoceros for helping him. From that day on, the rhinoceros and the little bird became the best of friends.
<|endoftext|>

Joe was playing outside with his toys, when his mom called him over to the window.
Shouts of, "Come and look Joe!" echoed throughout the room.
He ran to the window, curious to see what his mom was on about. 
Out from the window, he admired a magnificent volcano. Its tall, pointed peak towered over the clouds, while its wide, fuming slopes fit perfectly into the landscape.
"Look, Joe! Isn't it beautiful?" said his mom.
With googly eyes, Joe nodded in agreement.
"There is something truly special about this volcano," continued his mom. "It is fit and healthy, just like our family."
Joe smiled as he continued to admire the volcano.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a bright sun that would shine every day. In a small town, there lived a kind doctor. This doctor was always available to help people when they were sick.
One day, a little boy named Timmy had a big problem. He was playing outside, and he fell down. Timmy hurt his knee and started to cry. His mom heard him and said, "Don't worry, Timmy. We will go see the doctor, and he will make you feel better."
When they got to the doctor's office, the doctor looked at Timmy's knee. The doctor said, "I can fix your knee, but first, we need the sun to shine on it." Timmy was scared of the sun because it was so bright. But the doctor told him, "The sun is our friend. It will help your knee feel better."
So, Timmy and the doctor went outside, and the sun shined on Timmy's knee. Timmy felt better right away. He said, "Thank you, doctor, and thank you, sun, for making my knee feel better." From that day on, Timmy was not scared of the sun anymore, and he knew that the doctor was always available to help him when he needed it.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She lived in a small house with her mom and dad. Lily liked to play outside, but today it was raining. She thought rain was boring because she could not go out to play.
Lily's mom and dad were doing work in the house. They were cleaning and fixing things. Lily wanted to help, but she was too little. She felt sad because she could not do the work her mom and dad were doing.
Then, Lily had an idea. She found a big box and put all her toys inside. She saved her toys from the rain by putting them in the box. When her mom and dad saw what she did, they were very happy. They said, "Good job, Lily! You saved your toys from the rain!" Lily felt proud and knew she could help, even if she was little.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Billy. Billy loved to sing. Every day, he would fly around and sing a happy song. One day, while Billy was singing, he saw an orange on the ground.
Billy flew down to the orange and said, "Hello, orange! I am Billy. Do you want to be friends?" The orange did not say anything. Billy was sad, but he kept singing.
Suddenly, a fast squirrel named Sally ran by and picked up the orange. "Hi, Billy!" Sally said. "I heard you sing and I found my orange. Thank you!" Billy was happy that he helped Sally. From that day on, Billy and Sally were best friends, and they sang and played together every day.

It was a very windy Wednesday. Becky and her friends decided to have a race. They hopped and skipped to the end of the street and lined up.
"Ready, set, go!" said Dan excitedly.
One by one they raced as fast as they could. But Becky was the fastest. Her feet moved quickly and she got to the end of the street first.
"I won!" She yelled with glee.
But then a bitter wind blew past them. Becky shuddered and the others pulled their jackets close.
"Brrr," said the group, "Let's race again next Wednesday and stay warmer!"

One day, a dog named Max was chewing on his collar. His friend, a cat named Lily, saw him and said, "Why do you chew on your collar, Max?" Max replied, "I like how it feels on my teeth." Lily was jealous because she did not have a collar to chew on.
Lily asked Max, "Can I chew on your collar too?" Max said, "No, it is mine. You can't chew on it." Lily was sad and walked away. She wanted a collar just like Max's.
The next day, Lily found a collar under a tree. She was so happy! She put it on and started to chew it. Then, Max saw her and was surprised. He said, "Wow, you have a collar too now!" They both chewed on their collars and played together. Now, they were both happy and not jealous anymore.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a boy named Tom. Tom loved to play with his toys and his favorite toy was a flute. One day, Tom wanted to lift his flute high in the sky and play a song. He stood on his tippy-toes and lifted the flute as high as he could.
As Tom played his flute, a big bird flew down from the sky. The bird looked dangerous with its sharp claws and big beak. Tom was scared, but the bird said, "Don't be scared, Tom. I like your flute song. Can you play it again?"
Tom was surprised but happy. He played the flute again for the big bird. As he played, the dangerous bird started to dance. The bird was not mean, it just wanted to dance to Tom's flute song. Tom and the bird became friends and they danced together every day. And that's how Tom learned not to judge a book by its cover.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a little butterfly. The butterfly was very pretty. It had big, colorful wings. The butterfly liked to fly around and play with its friends.
One day, the butterfly was playing near a big tree. The tree had many branches. The butterfly saw a small bug on one of the branches. The bug looked sad. The butterfly asked the bug, "Why are you sad?" The bug said, "I did something bad, and now I am being punished. It is difficult for me to play."
The butterfly wanted to help the bug. So, the butterfly talked to the bug's mom. The butterfly said, "I will help the bug be good. Please don't punish the bug anymore." The bug's mom agreed.
The butterfly and the bug played together every day. They learned how to be good friends. The bug never did anything bad again. The bug was happy, and the butterfly was happy too. They lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a big, wide tree. It had many leaves and was very tall. A little boy named Tim loved to play near the tree every day.
One day, Tim found a long rope under the tree. He had a fun idea. Tim asked his dad to help him tie the rope to a strong branch of the wide tree. His dad helped him, and they made a swing.
Tim also found a big bottle near the tree. It was a bottle of wine that someone left there. Tim showed it to his dad. His dad took the wine away and said, "This is not for little kids." Tim didn't mind. He was happy to play on his new swing by the wide tree.

Once upon a time, there were two brothers who were playing in their backyard. One brother, Toby, was running around and playing tag while the other brother, David, was playing with a toy boat in a nearby puddle.
Suddenly, a big gust of wind came and pushed the boat far away into the pond. David ran to the edge of the pond and started to cry. Toby saw what happened and wanted to help.
He came up with an idea. He took a long measure from his dad's shed and entered the pond. Gently, Toby pulled the boat near the edge of the pond and carefully handed it back to David.
The two brothers shared a hug as David thanked Toby for his help. Toby smiled and said, "It's important to be gentle when helping others." Toby learned that it's better to give a hand than harsh words.

Once upon a time, there was a big sea. In the sea, there lived a fish named Mark. Mark was a happy fish, but he was a bit ignorant. He didn't know much about the sea or other fish.
One day, Mark met a wise old fish named Grandpa. Grandpa knew a lot about the sea. He told Mark many things about the sea, like where to find food and how to be safe. Mark listened and learned from Grandpa.
Mark became smarter and happier. He swam in the sea with his new friend, Grandpa. They played and had fun together. Mark was not ignorant anymore. He knew a lot about the sea, and he was a happy fish.

One day, a girl named Lily saw a fairy in her garden. The fairy was very small and had wings that sparkled. She was flying around the flowers and singing a lively song.
"Hello, fairy!" Lily said. "What are you doing here?"
The fairy smiled and landed on Lily's hand. "Hello, Lily!" she said. "I am looking for a place to set my home. I like your garden. It is very pretty and has many colors."
Lily was happy to meet the fairy. She wanted to be her friend. "You can set your home here, fairy," she said. "I have a dollhouse that you can use. It is in my room. Do you want to see it?"
The fairy nodded and flew with Lily to her room. Lily showed her the dollhouse. It had many rooms and furniture. The fairy liked it very much. She thanked Lily and set her home in the dollhouse.
"Can I visit you sometimes, fairy?" Lily asked.
"Of course, Lily!" the fairy said. "You are very kind and sweet. We can play and talk and have fun. You are my new friend."
Lily and the fairy hugged and smiled. They were very happy. They had found each other in the garden.

One day, a cat and a dog had a race. The cat was fast and the dog was slow. They wanted to see who could get to the cream first. The cream was in a big bowl, and it looked yummy.
The cat said to the dog, "I bet I can get to the cream before you!" The dog said, "No, I will get there first!" So, they started to race. The cat ran fast, and the dog ran slow.
The cat got to the cream first. But the cat saw that the dog was different and needed help. So, the cat waited for the dog. When the dog got there, they both shared the cream. They were happy and became friends.

Max saw a little girl named Lily. She was sad because she could not find her hoop. Max ran to Lily and gave her the hoop. Lily smiled and said, "Thank you, Max! You are very helpful."
Lily and Max played with the hoop all day. They did not quit playing until the sun went down. Max was happy that he could help his new friend. And Lily was happy that she found her hoop and made a new friend too.

One day, a boy found a dull notebook. The notebook was old and not pretty. The boy wanted to make the notebook nice again. He thought of a plan to make it pretty.
The boy took the dull notebook to his room. He put nice colors on it. He used red, blue, and yellow. The notebook looked very pretty now. The boy was happy with his work.
After some days, the boy saw the notebook rot. The colors were not nice anymore. The boy was sad. He learned that old things can rot. The boy decided to get a new notebook and make it pretty too.

One day, a small girl called Ella asked her daddy to show her something special. After thinking for a bit, her daddy said he had a surprise - a mystery! Ella was so excited and asked him to show her.
Her daddy reached into his pocket and took out a small box. He opened the box to reveal a small recording device inside. Ella was intrigued - she had never seen anything like it!
Ella's daddy told her that this was a special recorder and it could record things like Ella's voice. Ella asked if she could try it and her daddy said yes. He showed her how to work it and she recorded her daddy's voice.
The recording was so clear that Ella couldn't believe it. She had never heard anything so clear before! Ella and her daddy then listened to the recording together. 
Ella couldn't stop playing with the recorder - she had never seen anything so mysterious and magical before. Ella's daddy smiled and said that it was a perfect way to remember the special moment they had shared. Ella smiled and nodded in agreement - she was enjoying this special mystery!

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a little girl named Lucy. She had a big, round face with a big smile. Lucy loved to play with her toys and have fun. One day, Lucy found an amazing toy in her toy box. It was a bright, shiny ball that could bounce very high.
Lucy was so happy with her new toy. She played with it all day long. She would throw it up in the air and it would bounce back to her. But one day, while she was playing, the ball went very high and got stuck in a tree. Lucy was sad and didn't know what to do.
Suddenly, a friendly bird flew by and saw Lucy's sad face. The bird wanted to help, so it flew up to the tree and tried to get the ball. The bird pushed the ball with its beak, but the ball wouldn't move. Then, the bird tried to scream loudly to scare the ball out of the tree. It worked! The ball fell down and Lucy caught it. She was so happy and thanked the bird with a big smile on her face. Lucy and the bird became good friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time, in a big world, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to climb. He would climb on chairs, tables, and even trees. One day, Tim saw a big, rough rock. He wanted to climb it.
Tim started to climb the rough rock. He used his hands and feet to climb higher and higher. As he climbed, he saw many things. He saw birds, bugs, and even a squirrel. Tim was very happy.
Finally, Tim reached the top of the rough rock. He looked around and saw the whole world. He felt like the king of the world. Tim waved to his mom and dad, who were watching him. They were proud of their brave little boy.

Lily and Max were best friends. They liked to play in the park. They liked to swing, climb and run. But their favorite thing was the slide. The slide was big and shiny. It made them go fast.
One day, they went to the park with their moms. Their moms said, "Be careful on the slide. Don't go too fast. Wait for your turn. And listen to us."
Lily and Max were obedient. They nodded and said, "Yes, mom." They waited for their turn on the slide. They did not push or shout. They smiled and said, "Thank you" to the other kids.
But when it was their turn, they had a naughty idea. They decided to go on the slide together. They thought it would be more fun. They thought they would go faster. They did not tell their moms.
They climbed up the ladder. They sat on the slide. They held hands. They said, "Ready, set, go!" They pushed off. They speed down the slide.
But they did not know that the slide was wet. It had rained the night before. The slide was slippery. They could not stop. They speed off the slide. They flew in the air. They landed on the grass. They rolled and tumbled. They got dirty and wet.
They were not hurt. But they were scared. And they were sorry. They looked at their moms. Their moms looked at them. Their moms were not happy. They were angry.
They ran to their moms. They hugged them. They said, "We're sorry, mom. We were bad. We did not listen. We won't do it again."
Their moms hugged them back. They said, "We're glad you're okay. But you were naughty. You could have been hurt. You have to listen. You have to be careful. You have to be obedient."
Lily and Max nodded. They said, "Yes, mom. We understand. We love you, mom."
Their moms said, "We love you too. But now you have to go home. You have to take a bath. You have to change your clothes. And you have to say sorry to the other kids."
Lily and Max said, "Okay, mom. We will do that." They said goodbye to the other kids. They said sorry to them. They got in their cars. They went home.
They learned their lesson. They did not go on the slide together again. They were obedient. They were careful. They were happy.

Once upon a time, there was a green mailbox. It was near a big tree. Every day, a girl named Lily would walk to the mailbox. She would put a letter in it for her friend, Max.
One day, Lily walked to the mailbox like she always did. But when she got there, she saw something strange. The green mailbox was open! There was a big hole in it. Lily was sad. She couldn't put her letter in the mailbox.
Just then, Max came walking down the road. He saw the green mailbox and Lily. Max said, "I fixed the mailbox! I made it bigger for more letters." Lily was happy. Now she could send her letter to Max. They both walked home, smiling and laughing.

Amy knocked on the giant's door. The giant opened the door and said, "Go away! I am busy!" But Amy did not go away. She said, "I want to be your friend." The giant was surprised. No one had ever wanted to be his friend before.
The giant and Amy played together all day. They had so much fun! But then, it was time for Amy to go home. She said, "Goodbye, giant. I will come back tomorrow." The giant was sad, but he knew he had a new friend. He closed the door and smiled.

One day, a calm boy named Tim went to the train station. He saw a big train with many cars. He was very happy because he loved trains. Tim got on the train with his mom and they sat down.
As the train started to move, a man with a big hat came by. He said, "We are having a game. If you win, you get a big prize!" Tim wanted to play the game. The man gave Tim a ball and said, "Throw the ball and hit the cans. If you knock them all down, you win!"
Tim threw the ball and knocked down all the cans. He won the game! The man with the big hat gave Tim a prize. It was a small train toy. Tim was so excited to play with his new toy.
But then, something unexpected happened. The small train toy grew bigger and bigger! It became a real train! Everyone on the big train was surprised. Tim and his mom got off the big train and rode the new train all the way home. They had a fun and special day.

Lily put the grape in her mouth. She took a big bite. It tasted sweet and a little bit sour. She liked it a lot. Lily ate all the grapes she could find. She was very full and happy.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a little dog named Max. Max loved to chew on things. He would chew on toys, shoes, and even sticks. One day, Max found a razor in the bathroom. He didn't know what it was, but he thought it looked fun to chew on.
Max started to chew on the razor, but it hurt his mouth. He yelped and dropped it on the floor. His owner, a kind little girl named Lily, heard the noise and came running into the bathroom. She saw Max and the razor on the floor, and she knew he had made a mistake.
Lily felt sad that Max had hurt himself. Max felt ashamed for chewing on something he shouldn't have. He looked at Lily with his big, sad eyes. Lily hugged Max and told him it was okay. She knew Max didn't mean to do anything wrong. From that day on, Max promised to only chew on his toys, and he never went near the razor again.
