Once upon a time, there was a big statue in the park. The statue was of a man on a bike. Every day, kids would come to the park to play and look at the statue. They liked to pretend they were riding the bike too.
One sunny day, a little boy named Tim came to the park with his toy car. He loved to make the car zoom around the statue. He would make the car go fast, then slow, then fast again. Tim laughed as the car zoomed around the statue, making "vroom" sounds.
As the sun started to go down, it was time for Tim to go home. He looked up at the statue and said, "Bye, bike man!" He could see the statue very clear in the pretty sky. Tim knew he would come back to the park to play and zoom his car around the statue again soon.

Once upon a time, there was a jolly little girl. Every day, she would play in the sunshine for hours and hours. One day, she decided to go to her special spot, all her own and far away from the other kids.
She ran and ran until she reached it - a mineshaft. She knew it was hers because of the little sign she had made and put up. into the hole she went, humming a happy tune.
She explored for a long time, walking through the tunnel and looking at the sparkling rocks. After all her exploring, the little girl felt so tired, so she lay down in a corner and had a rest.
She stayed there until the sun started to go down, and when she arrived home, it was dark and cold. She smiled to herself, thinking of the jolly time she had while she was at her mine, and went to bed, dreaming of the adventures she would have the next day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Daisy who loved to explore the world around her. One day, she went on a walk through the woods and she came across a tall tree. In her excitement, Daisy wanted to shoot the tree with her toy bow and arrow.
So Daisy ran over to the tree, took out her bow and arrow, and shot it. But instead of hitting the tree, the arrow made a small patch in the ground. Daisy was a bit surprised to see what had happened, but then she heard a loud sound coming from the patch in the ground.
The sound was coming from a family of baby birds who were living in the soft patch of dirt. Daisy was so happy to see them and she began to talk to the birds in a very loud voice. The birds fluttered around and sang to Daisy, which made her smile.
Daisy eventually started to make her way back home, but before she left, she quietly whispered to the birds to take care and stay safe in their warm little patch. And with that, Daisy left the woods with a big smile on her face.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. Lily had a doll that she loved a lot. One day, Lily and her mom went to the park. Lily was worried because she did not want to lose her doll. Her mom said, "Don't worry, just bring your doll with you and hold it tight."
At the park, Lily played with her doll. She was happy and forgot her worry. But then, a big dog came running. The dog saw Lily's doll and wanted to play too. The dog took the doll from Lily and ran away.
Lily was very sad and cried. Her mom tried to find the dog and the doll, but they were gone. Lily learned to be more careful with her things. From that day on, Lily always remembered her lost doll and the big dog that took it away.

Suddenly Mandy felt unsteady and her bike started to wobble. She struggled to keep her balance, but it was too hard. Mandy fell off and landed on the ground with a thud.
She felt like giving up, but something inside kept her trying. With all her might she managed to get back on her bike again. As she pedaled away, she was filled with pride for overcoming the challenge.
Mandy was soon zooming around the park, enjoying the freedom of the ride. She smiled, feeling like she could do anything.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved to play with her ball. One day, she went to visit her aunt. Her aunt lived in a fancy house. Sue was very excited to see her aunt.
When Sue got to her aunt's house, she wanted to play with her ball. She started to roll the ball in the big room. The ball rolled and rolled. Sue was having so much fun. But her aunt told her, "Sue, please be careful. You might break something."
Sue didn't listen to her aunt. She kept rolling the ball. Then, the ball hit a fancy vase. The vase fell and broke. Sue felt very sad. Her aunt was not angry but said, "Sue, you should have listened to me."
From that day on, Sue learned to listen when someone older told her something. She knew they were trying to help her. And Sue and her aunt still had fun together, but Sue was more careful when playing in the fancy house.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Maggie. Every day, Maggie and her Mom played a game. Her Mom would put a folder on the table and tell Maggie to test it. Maggie would open the folder and she'd find something special inside.
One day, Maggie was feeling a bit upset. She didn't want to play the game with her Mom anymore.
"Maggie, my darling," said her Mom, "come and test that folder with me. I bet you'll find something really special this time."
Maggie didn't want to at first, but she went to the table to play the game. She opened the folder and she found something wonderful inside - it was a big hug from her Mom!
Maggie was so happy and she ran to give her Mom a big hug. After that, they both laughed and hugged even more.
The moral of the story is to always try and keep an open mind. When we expect something bad to happen, it might surprise us with something special instead.

One day, when the yellow bird was rocking on the swing, the igloo started to shake. The yellow bird was scared. The igloo shook more and more. Then, the igloo fell down. The yellow bird was very sad. It had no home now. The yellow bird flew away to find a new home. The end.

"Yes, that is the faucet!" exclaimed her mom. 
Molly's mom showed her how to turn the faucet on and off. Molly loved learning something new and she kept turning the faucet on and off again, happy with her new skill.

Once upon a time, in a great big forest, there was a special place called a temple. The temple was very old and had many stories. In this temple, there was a magic stone that could freeze things. Many animals in the forest knew about the magic stone, but no one knew how to use it.
One day, a little rabbit named Binky went to the temple. Binky was very curious and wanted to see the magic stone. When he saw the stone, he thought of his friend, the bird who could not fly. Binky wished he could help his friend fly again. He touched the magic stone and said, "I wish I could freeze the air so my friend can walk on it and feel like he's flying!"
Suddenly, the air around the temple started to freeze. The magic stone had listened to Binky's wish! Binky quickly ran to his friend, the bird, and told him about the frozen air. The bird was very excited and went to the temple with Binky.
The bird stepped on the frozen air and started to walk on it. He felt like he was flying! The bird was so happy, and Binky was happy too. They played on the frozen air all day long. When the sun started to set, the magic stone's power went away, and the air was not frozen anymore. But Binky and the bird knew that they had a great adventure, and they would always remember the day they played on the frozen air at the temple.

Once upon a time, there was a little star. This star was tough. It lived high up in the sky. Every night, it shined very bright.

So, the tough little star and the cloud worked together. They added more light to the sky. All the people on the ground looked up and smiled. They were happy to see the bright sky.
At the end of the day, the star and the cloud said goodbye. The star promised to keep shining bright, and the cloud promised to add more light too. They knew they made the people happy, and they felt good.

One day, Tom was walking down the street. He saw a tall tree and decided to try and reach the top of it. He stretched as high as he could, but he still couldn't reach it. 
Just as he was about to give up, he spotted a regular card on the sidewalk. He picked it up and looked at it. Suddenly, a voice came from behind him. 
"Hey there," said a friendly voice. Tom turned around to see a old man with a wide smile.
"Would you like to try again?" he asked.
Tom nodded eagerly.
The old man took the card, which had a special handle on one side. He held the card up to the top of the tree and with one big stretching motion, he was able to reach the top of the tree with the card. 
Tom was amazed and thanked the man for his help. 
The old man laughed, "It's no problem! Anytime you need help, just give me a shout!" 
Tom waved goodbye as the old man walked down the street, leaving Tom to enjoy the view from the top of the tree.

Once upon a time, in a small garden, there was a pretty rose. The rose was very happy. But the rose was also impatient. It wanted to grow fast and be big.
One sunny day, a little girl came to the garden. She saw the pretty rose and wanted to take it home. But she forgot to bring her scissors. So, she went back home to get them.
While the girl was away, the rose waited and waited. The rose was very impatient. But, as it waited, it started to grow bigger and stronger. When the girl came back, the rose was the biggest and prettiest in the garden. The girl was very happy, and the rose was happy too.

Lily and Max were playing in the park. They liked to pretend they were knights and dragons. Lily had a stick that she called her sword. Max had a scarf that he tied around his neck like a tail.
"Roar!" Max said, running after Lily. "I am a big dragon and I will catch you!"
"No, you won't!" Lily said, waving her sword. "I am a brave knight and I will stop you!"
They chased each other around the trees and the swings. They had a lot of fun. Sometimes Lily would catch Max and tickle him. Sometimes Max would catch Lily and hug her.
One time, Max saw something shiny on the ground. He stopped and picked it up. It was a metal pin with a star on it. It sparkled in the sun.
"Wow!" Max said. "Look what I found! It is a rare star pin. Maybe it is magic!"
Lily came over and looked at it. She thought it was pretty.
"Can I see it?" she asked.
"OK, but be careful," Max said. He gave her the pin.
Lily held it in her hand. She felt happy. She liked stars.
"Thank you, Max," she said. "You are a nice dragon. Do you want to trade?"
"Trade?" Max asked.
"Yes, trade. You give me the pin and I give you something else. Like my sword. Do you want my sword?"
Max thought about it. He liked the pin, but he also liked the sword. It was a good stick.
"OK, let's trade," he said. He took the sword from Lily and gave her the pin.
They smiled at each other. They were happy with their trade.
"Let's play some more," Lily said.
"OK, but now I am the knight and you are the dragon," Max said.
"OK, but I am a friendly dragon," Lily said.
They ran off, laughing and playing. They had a rare and magic day.

John decided to take a closer look and started reading. He noticed a few words that made him smile: Cheese. Even though he was only three years old, he knew exactly what it meant.
 
John was excited and he told his mum all about it. She smiled and said, “Let’s go find some cheese!”
The next day, John and his mum went to the shop. As they walked in, John saw a big man with a white hat. He was holding a big wheel of cheese. 
John grinned with excitement. They had found the treasure! He hugged the cheese wheel, and they all went home. 
John had a great time with his mum that day, and he could not wait to read more stories.

Lily and Ben were best friends. They liked to play with dolls and cars and books. One day, they decided to play marry. They put on their mom's and dad's clothes and rings and flowers. They stood in front of their teddy bears and said, "I marry you, you marry me, we are happy as can be."
But then, Lily's big sister Emma came in. She saw them playing and laughed. She said, "You can't marry each other, you are too little. And you don't even love each other. You are just silly kids." She took away their rings and flowers and threw them on the floor.
Lily and Ben felt sad and angry. They did not like Emma being mean to them. They said, "We do love each other, we are best friends. And we can play whatever we want. You are just a meanie." They picked up their rings and flowers and ran away to their fort.
Emma felt sorry for making them cry. She realized she was wrong to spoil their fun. She followed them to their fort and knocked on the door. She said, "I'm sorry, Lily and Ben. I was just joking. You can play marry if you want. It's a nice game. Can I play with you?"
Lily and Ben opened the door and saw Emma's smile. They smiled back and said, "Okay, Emma. You can play with us. But you have to be nice. And you have to be the sleepy flower girl." They gave her a flower crown and a pillow and invited her in.
They played marry again and had a lot of fun. They learned that playing together is better than fighting. And that being kind is better than being mean. And that love can be different for different people. And that sleepy flower girls are very cute.

They tried to clap together, but Spot's big feet made it hard. They kept trying and trying until finally, they did it! They clapped their wings and feet together. Spot and Tweet were so happy, they laughed and played all day. The other animals in the park saw them and joined in the fun.

The grandson carefully measured the apple, and when he looked at the ruler he was surprised. "Grandma this apple is the longest!" he said. Grandma smiled, and said, "That is because it is a very special apple - it is the kindest apple."

One day, a busy bee named Bob was flying around. He saw a little girl named Sue. Sue was a pupil in a school. Sue was sad because she lost her toy.
Bob wanted to help Sue. He said, "Don't be sad. I will help you find your toy." Sue smiled and said, "Thank you, Bob." They looked for the toy together.
Then, they saw a big bow on a tree. The toy was under the bow! Sue was so happy. She said, "You found it! Thank you, Bob!" But when they took the toy, the bow moved! It was not a bow, it was a friendly snake! The snake said, "I was keeping your toy safe." Sue and Bob laughed and said, "Thank you, snake!"
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot loved to run and play with his friends. One day, Spot's friends asked him to join them for some exercise. They wanted to race to see who was the fastest. Spot started to worry because he had never raced before.
The race began, and Spot ran as fast as he could. He was running so fast that he tripped and fell. Spot felt silly for falling, but his friends helped him up. They told him not to worry and that everyone falls sometimes.
Spot decided to try again. This time, he ran even faster and didn't fall. He finished the race and was so happy. Spot learned that it's okay to feel worried and silly sometimes, but it's important to keep trying. And that day, Spot and his friends had lots of fun playing and exercising together.

Once upon a time, there was a brilliant little girl named Mia. She loved to play with her toys all day. One day, she found a magic wand under her bed. Mia was very excited and wanted to see what the wand could do.
Mia waved the wand at her big teddy bear and said, "Shrink!" Suddenly, the teddy bear became very small. Mia was so happy, she laughed and clapped her hands. She played with the tiny teddy bear for a long time. Then, she wanted to see if she could make it big again.
Mia waved the wand again and said, "Grow!" The teddy bear became big once more. Mia's mom came into the room and asked, "What are you doing, Mia?" Mia smiled and said, "I found a magic wand, Mommy! It can make things shrink and grow!" Her mom hugged her and said, "That's amazing, Mia! We can have so much fun with this magic wand. But remember, we must always use it wisely."

At the end of the day, Tim and the blanket went back inside. They were tired but happy. They knew they would be friends forever. And they promised to take care of each other and the fragile wool blanket.

Then, the ball saw a match. The match was small and had a red top. The ball rolled to the match and asked, "Do you want to play?" The match said, "Yes!" They played together all day, rolling and jumping on the icy puddle. They had so much fun and became good friends.

One night, Amy went to sleep and had a dream. In her dream, she was on a tour with her mom and dad. They went to a park with a big slide and swings. Amy felt so happy. They also saw a heavy, big elephant at the zoo. The elephant splashed water with its trunk, and Amy laughed.
When Amy woke up, she told her mom and dad about her dream. They smiled and hugged her. They said, "We will make your dream come true." And one day, they did go on a tour. They saw the park with the big slide and swings, and they saw the heavy, big elephant at the zoo. Amy's dream came true, and she was very happy.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Penny.  Penny was very smart and loved to read. She also loved to fold things. One day, Penny wanted to use her favourite dictionary so she could learn a new word. 
But when Penny grabbed the dictionary, she saw something strange. The dictionary was folded in half and it was impossible to open! Penny was very upset and wanted to know who had done this. She looked around and saw her brother, Jack, far in the distance. 
Penny ran to her brother, determined to find out why he had folded the dictionary. Jack was sorry and said he was curious to see what would happen when he folded it. Penny was still mad, but she could see her brother was sorry. 
So Penny and Jack worked together to unfold the dictionary. After a few moments, the dictionary was open again and Penny quickly read the new word. 
The moral of the story is that working together can help people resolve their problems and find new understanding.

One day, there was a man who was feeling very foolish. He decided he wanted to search for something special, so he decided he would go to the theater. As he walked there, he asked some children if it was alright for him to come inside. 
The children said, “Yes! Come on in!” 
The man was excited as he walked into the theater. He looked around and searched for something special. At first, he couldn’t find anything. But then he saw a sparkle in the corner. 
He walked over and reached for it. To his surprise, it was a diamond ring! He was so happy and thanked the children for helping him find it. 
“You’re very welcome!,” the children said, “We are so glad you found it!” 
The man was so grateful and no longer felt foolish. He thanked the children again and decided to go home. With a big smile and excitement, he quickly ran home with his newfound treasure.

Mom said: "That's so good, Max! You did such a great job!". 
Max was so proud of himself. He beamed with happiness. 
Next, Mom asked Max if he would like to try something a little harder. Max nodded. Mom handed him two big pieces of cardboard and said: "Let's see if you can separate them into four pieces". 
Max thought it would be difficult, but he focused and tried. After a while, he managed to separate the cardboard into four pieces. 
He was so happy. Mom congratulated him. She said: “Well done, Max. You did an amazing job!”.
Max smiled, thrilled that he had achieved his goal.

Once upon a time, there was a lonely little flame who lived in the woods. The lonely flame had no friends and always felt sad. It wanted to make friends with the animals in the woods, but they were all scared of the flame.
One day, a kind bird flew to the flame and said, "Why are you so lonely, little flame?" The flame replied, "I want to make friends, but everyone is scared of me." The bird thought for a moment and said, "I have an idea! Let's put you in a safe place where you can meet the animals without scaring them."
The bird picked up a small stick and put the lonely flame on it. It then flew around the woods, showing the flame to all the animals. The animals saw that the flame was not scary when it was on the stick, and they started to become friends with the lonely flame.
The flame was no longer lonely, and it was happy to have so many new friends. From that day on, the flame and the animals in the woods lived happily together, and the flame learned that sometimes all it takes is a little help from a friend to find happiness.

Once upon a time, a brave boy was walking through the woods. Suddenly he came across a big tree and decided to tie a rope to it, so he could swing from it. 
“Come, swing with me!” he shouted. 
The boy heard a deep voice from somewhere down on the ground. He looked down and saw a little earthworm. 
“You are brave, my friend! I wish I could swing with you,” said the earthworm. 
The boy thought for a moment and then said, “I know! I’ll tie a rope around you and then you can swing with me.” 
“Really?” said the earthworm, “That would be amazing!” 
So the boy tied a knot around the earthworm and then tied the other end of the rope to the tree. 
The boy and the earthworm started to swing together. They laughed and shouted with joy as they flew through the air. 
The boy and earthworm became best friends, and the boy always tied a rope around the earthworm when they went to the tree. They did this every day until the boy went away to school. 
But the boy and the earthworm still think of each other, and have remained brave friends ever since.

Lily liked to draw in her notebook. She drew flowers, stars, animals and people. She used many colors and made her pictures pretty. She was happy when she drew.
One day, she took her notebook to the park. She wanted to draw the trees and the birds. She found a nice spot under a big tree and opened her notebook. But she saw something that made her sad. Someone had scribbled on her pictures with a black pen. They had made ugly lines and dots over her flowers, stars, animals and people. Lily felt angry and sad. Who did this to her notebook?
She looked around and saw a boy sitting on a bench. He had a black pen in his hand and a smirk on his face. He was eating a cookie. Lily wondered if he was the one who ruined her notebook. She walked up to him and asked him.
"Did you scribble on my notebook?" she said.
The boy looked at her and laughed. He said, "Yes, I did. Your pictures are silly and boring. I made them better. Do you want a cookie? They are yummy."
Lily felt more angry and sad. She did not want his cookie. She wanted her pictures back. She said, "No, I don't want your cookie. You are mean and rude. You should say sorry and give me a new notebook."
The boy said, "No, I won't say sorry and I won't give you a new notebook. This is my cookie and this is your notebook. You can't have them. Go away."
Lily did not go away. She grabbed his cookie and threw it on the ground. She said, "This is what you get for scribbling on my notebook. You can't have your cookie. Go away."
The boy was shocked and angry. He said, "Hey, that's my cookie. You can't do that. Give it back."
He tried to grab the cookie, but Lily was faster. She ran away with her notebook. She said, "No, I won't give it back. You can't have it. Go away."
She ran to her mom, who was sitting on a bench nearby. She showed her mom her notebook and told her what happened. Her mom hugged her and said, "I'm sorry, Lily. That boy was very mean and rude. He should not have scribbled on your notebook. Your pictures are very pretty and I'm proud of you. Do you want to go home and get a new notebook?"
Lily nodded and said, "Yes, please. I want to go home and get a new notebook. And maybe a cookie. A yummy cookie."
Her mom smiled and said, "Okay, let's go home and get a new notebook and a cookie. A yummy cookie."
They walked home, holding hands. Lily felt better. She still liked to draw in her notebook. She drew more flowers, stars, animals and people. She used many colors and made her pictures pretty. She was happy when she drew.

One day, Lola and Bella were playing soccer. Soon, it started to rain. They ran to their mom’s house.
Lola and Bella’s mom said, “You two need to stay inside until the rain stops. I will go get you something to play with.”
She came back with two smooth stones. She handed them to Lola and Bella.
The girls smiled. They thanked their mom and ran to the yard together.
Lola and Bella received lots of enjoyment playing with their new stones. They threw them up in the air and then caught them. The stones felt so smooth in their hands.
Lola said, “Let’s pretend this is our favorite sport. We can pretend we are playing soccer!”
Bella nodded excitedly and smiled.
The two girls had lots of fun playing with their stones. They received lots of fun in the rain.

The flight attendant said that they were having engine trouble. The plane was going to crash! 
Sara started to cry and held onto her dad tightly. The plane crashed and Sara was killed. Her dad was very sad.

"That's a nice leaf, Tom. Can I see it?" mom asked.
Tom ran to mom and gave her the leaf. Mom smiled and hugged Tom. "Thank you, Tom. You are very sweet."
Lily also wanted to show mom her leaf. She found a leaf that was red and had a funny shape. She thought it looked like a heart.
"Mom, mom, look at my leaf!" Lily said, waving her leaf.
Mom turned to Lily and saw her leaf. Mom laughed and hugged Lily. "That's a beautiful leaf, Lily. You are very smart."
Tom and Lily were happy that mom liked their leaves. They hugged mom back and said, "We love you, mom."
Mom said, "I love you too, Tom and Lily. You are my crazy kids."

Once upon a time there was a big fight. Two animals were fighting over a switch. The animals had wanted the switch for a long time, and they both really wanted to get it.
The first animal was a bear, and the other one was a lion. The bear was so big, and the lion was so fierce. The lion roared and snarled, and the bear growled and roared.
The fight was getting more and more dangerous. The two animals were pushing each other, and one nearly fell off the cliff. The animals were so angry and scared!
Finally, a brave bird came and flew between the animals. The bird told the animals to stop fighting. The lion and bear listened and stopped fighting.
The lion and the bear shared the switch and everyone was happy. The bear and lion went swimming together instead of fighting. They had become good friends because of the brave bird.

While inside the hole, he heard a voice. It said, "Hello, who is there?" It was a little rabbit called Timmy.
Jimmy said, "I'm Jimmy the leopard. I'm feeling curious and wanted to hide in this tree."
Timmy replied, "That's so cool. Welcome to my hideaway! Would you like to stay and play with me?"
Jimmy felt excited and said yes. They played hide and seek all day, until the sun started to go down. Jimmy said goodbye to Timmy, and then he went on his way.
The two of them were so happy they had met, and hoped that they could be friends forever.

Bear said, "I am big and strong, so I should eat the fruit." Rabbit said, "But I am small and fast, so I should eat the fruit." They were both frustrated and didn't know what to do.
So, they decided to split the fruit in half. But when they tried to split it, the fruit fell into a deep hole. They both tried to reach it, but the hole was too deep. They were very sad and went home without the fruit.

John's friends asked him, "John, how come you always have the most success?"
John smiled and replied, "It is all about practice. I make sure I come here every day and gather as many fish as I can." 
John's friends nodded and smiled, ready to put John's advice into practice. They all fished together for the rest of the day, and when the sun began to set, they had gathered a lot of fish.
John smiled, pleased with his friends' success.

Little Lipp was so excited. Yumi the Strawberry told her to cover her eyes and use her sense of smell to guess what Yumi was holding in her hands. Little Lipp guessed it was a strawberry and was so happy that she was right.
Yumi the Strawberry laughed and said, "Now it is your turn to show me a surprise!"
Little Lipp got a big stone from the ground and said, "Look what I found!"
Suddenly Yumi the Strawberry started screaming, "Put that down! That is not a toy! That's a bad joke!" 
Little Lipp was scared and started to cry. Yumi the Strawberry was not so kind afterall. She turned back into a strawberry and disappeared.

"Hello," said the man. "Why are you not scared of the mine?"
The girl smiled and said, "I am not scared because I shut the door when I go in. Then it is not dark."
The bald man thought about what the girl said. He decided to try it. He went into the mine and shut the door. It was not dark anymore. The man was happy and not scared. The girl and the man played near the mine all day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim lived on a farm with his mom and dad. They grew wheat in their big field. Tim thought the wheat was boring because it was just tall and brown.
One day, Tim saw a little bird sitting on the wheat. The bird looked sad. Tim asked the bird, "Why are you sad?" The bird said, "I am lost. I don't know where I belong."
Tim wanted to help the bird find where it belonged. So, Tim and the bird walked around the farm, looking for the bird's home. They looked near the big tree, by the pond, and in the barn. But they could not find the bird's home.
Then, Tim had an idea. He took the bird back to the wheat field. The bird flew up and sat on the wheat. The bird was happy now. It belonged with the wheat. Tim learned that even something boring like wheat can make someone happy. And from that day on, Tim and the bird became good friends.

Suddenly, the animal sneezed twice and Maria jumped back! She was not feeling well and started to feel sick. She started to cry and said, "What's wrong with me?" 
Just then, her mom came running out and said, "Maria, why are you so far from home?" 
Maria told her mom about the animal and the bad sneezes. Mom said, "It sounds like you have caught a cold, and you need to go inside and rest." 
So, Maria and her mom went home and Maria took a nap. She woke up feeling much better. From then on, she knew to be careful around strange animals and to wash her hands afterwards.

“Mama, I want to take my umbrella,” called Julie.
Mama smiled. “Not now sweetie, your umbrella is missing”. 
Julie was sad. “Where can it be?” she asked. Mama sighed. “I don’t know, it’s unknown where it is.”
Julie wanted to find it and looked everywhere. She searched high and low, but the umbrella was nowhere to be found. 
Finally, Julie and her mama called Grandma for help. Grandma knew the answer.
“I saw your umbrella in the park yesterday,” she said.
Julie was happy. She went outside with her mama, to the park, and there they found the unknown umbrella. They brought it home and stayed dry in the rain.

Bob was running around the park. He quickly noticed a wire on the ground, but he kept running. He soon stumbled and fell over the wire. He felt sad, but decided to pick up the wire. It felt unique as he tried to twist it. 
Bob went over to his best friend and showed her the wire. "What should we do with it?" said Bob. His friend replied, "let's make something out of it". 
So Bob and his friend started heading back to Bob's house. On their way, they saw an old man walking slowly. Bob wanted to help the old man, so he and his friend started to twist the wire into a nice walking stick for the old man. 
The old man was very thankful, but just as he was about to walk away, he suddenly stumbled and fell. He was hurt and couldn't get back up. Bob's and his friend were very worried and it turned out the old man had a broken leg. 
Bob and his friend felt very bad that they had caused this accident. They had meant to help the old man, but instead had caused him trouble. They had to leave the old man lying on the ground and quickly ran away.

Once upon a time there was a little girl. She sat in her garden and looked for something to pick. She saw a worm and picked it up. Suddenly, the worm spoke, telling her it wanted to go back to its family, but the girl didn't know where that was.
The girl asked everyone she knew, but no one knew the worm's family so she decided she had to help the worm by herself.
The girl went on a long journey, trying to find the worm's family, but it was unknown to her where they were. She looked under rocks and in grass, everywhere she could think of, but she couldn't find the family.
She felt so sad because it looked like the worm would never find its family. But suddenly she heard a voice and saw many worms coming towards her. The family was so happy to see the worm that the girl had brought back and they thanked her for reuniting them.
The little girl was so happy that the worm found its family and went back to her garden with a smile on her face.

Mommy and little Jack were walking in the park. The day was dry, with no clouds in the sky. They walked by a tall tree, and Jack noticed something special. It was a bird's nest, high up in the branches. Inside the nest, he could see two tiny eggs. 
"Look Mommy, eggs!" Jack said. Mommy smiled and answered, "Yes, they will hatch into baby birds." Jack was excited, and he wanted to watch the eggs. Mommy said that they should come back in a few weeks, to see if the eggs had hatched.
Days passed, and sure enough, Mommy and Jack returned to the tree. They were both excited, but when Mommy looked in the nest, only one egg was left. The other one was gone. Jack looked sadly at the nest, but Mommy said, "Don't worry. That baby bird will just take a little longer to come out!" 
So they waited by the nest, until finally, one sunny morning, Jack noticed a crack in the egg shell. Mommy was smiling, and Jack was happy too. A few moments later, the eggshell broke and out popped a wet little bird! It flapped its little wings, and chirped loudly. 
Mommy and Jack watched it fly away to a tree nearby. Jack waved goodbye to the little bird, and they both smiled. They both noticed something special had

As they were cleaning, they saw a big bird outside. The bird flew right into the window! The cat and the dog were very surprised. The bird said, "Oops! I did not see the window because it was so clean!" They all laughed and became friends.

Suddenly, a big wind came and took Tim's orange toy ball away. Tim was sad and didn't know what to do. He looked everywhere for his ball, but it was gone. Tim felt like he would never see his orange toy ball again.
Then, something unexpected happened. A little girl named Sue came to Tim's yard with an orange toy ball. It was not Tim's ball, but it looked just like it! Sue saw that Tim was sad and asked if he wanted to play with her. Tim and Sue played with the orange toy ball together, kicking and laughing. They became best friends and always played together with their orange toy balls. And so, Tim was happy once again.

The turkey walked up to the girl and asked if he could help her stir the pot. The girl said yes, and they started to stir the pot together.
As they stirred the pot, they talked and laughed. They found out that they both liked to play and have fun. The turkey was not lonely anymore because he had a new friend. The girl and the turkey became best friends and played together every day. The moral of the story is that if you are kind and help others, you can make new friends and not be lonely.

As Whistler flew higher, he saw a large, beautiful rainbow in the sky. He was so happy that he whistled louder than ever before. All the animals in the forest heard him and started to whistle, too. They all had a fun day, full of whistling and laughter, and they all became good friends.

Ben and Mia are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big house with a red roof. They want to go inside and look.
"Can we go in?" Mia asks Ben.
"I don't know. Maybe it is not safe," Ben says.
"But it looks so nice. Maybe there are toys and candy inside," Mia says.
They walk to the door and knock. No one answers. They try to open the door. It is not locked. They go inside.
The house is very dark and dusty. There are no toys or candy. There are only old things and spiders. Ben and Mia are scared.
"Let's go out," Ben says.
"Wait. I see something on the wall. It is a number," Mia says.
She points to a big black number on the wall. It is a six.
"What does it mean?" Ben asks.
"I don't know. Maybe it is a clue," Mia says.
They look for more numbers on the walls. They find a four, a nine, and a two.
"Maybe we can make a word with the numbers," Mia says.
She tries to say the numbers like letters. She says, "Six, four, nine, two. Six, four, nine, two."
Ben listens. He thinks he hears a word.
"I know what it is. It is a word. It is 'roof'," Ben says.
"Roof? Why roof?" Mia asks.
"Maybe it is a hint. Maybe we have to go to the roof," Ben says.
They look for stairs to go to the roof. They find them and climb up. They open a door and see the sky. They also see a big cake on a table. The cake has candles and a sign. The sign says, "Happy Birthday, Ben and Mia!"
Ben and Mia are surprised. They look at each other and smile.
"It is our birthday! We forgot!" Ben says.
"Someone made us a cake! It is so sweet!" Mia says.
They hear a voice behind them. It is their mom and dad. They are holding balloons and gifts.
"Surprise! We made you a treasure hunt for your birthday. Did you like it?" Mom says.
"We loved it! Thank you, Mom and Dad!" Ben and Mia say.
They hug their parents and eat the cake. They are very happy. They have the best birthday ever.

Later, Fred saw Tim crying and felt bad for being selfish. He decided to share his hat with Tim. They took turns wearing the green hat and soon became best friends. They learned that sharing was much more fun than being selfish, and they played happily ever after.

Anna and Ben are playing in the park. They see a big plastic ball. It is red and shiny. They want to play with it.
"Can I kick the ball?" Anna asks Ben.
"OK, but be careful. The ball is fragile. It can break," Ben says.
Anna kicks the ball hard. It flies in the air. It lands on a rock. The ball makes a loud pop. It is broken. Air comes out of the ball.
"Oh no! The ball is broken!" Anna cries.
"I told you to be careful. The ball is fragile. It is not ours. It is someone else's," Ben says.
They hear a voice. It is a boy. He is angry. He runs to them.
"Hey! That is my ball! You broke my ball! Why did you do that?" the boy shouts.
Anna and Ben are scared. They say sorry to the boy. They run away. They do not play with the ball again.

Once there was a mommy and a little boy. The boy was only three years old.
One day, the mommy said to the boy, "Let's go outside and take a walk! I want to teach you something."
The little boy was excited. He followed his mommy out the door and into a grassy area. 
"Look around you," said the mommy. "What do you see?"
"I see green grass and blue sky!" said the little boy.
"Yes!" said the mommy. She took the little boy's hand and said, "We're going to teach you about cold. Can you feel it?"
The little boy felt a cool breeze. His feet touched the hard ground.
"It feels cold and hard!" said the little boy.
"That's right!" said the mommy, giving the little boy a hug. "Now you know more about cold!"

Molly grabbed a ball and started to play. She threw it up in the air, and it came back to her. She played like this for what felt like hours, until, suddenly, her dad called her name.
Molly slowly looked up and saw her dad standing there. He had an anxious look on his face. She realized he was worried about her. Molly smiled and put the ball back in the basket.
"I'm sorry, Daddy," Molly said. Her dad smiled and put his arm around her. 
"It's ok, sweetie," he said. Then they both blinked, and they were back at home safe and sound.

Billy's mum was watching from the sidelines. She said with a smile, "You know Billy, I bet with enough clay you could make something amazing".
Billy started to smile and put his hands deep in the clay. He started to carefully shape and squeeze and soon enough, he had crafted a beautiful little clay bird. He stood back and proudly looked at it.
"Mum, look, it's amazing!" Billy said, his eyes twinkling with surprise.
"See, I told you," his mum said with a grin.
Billy had proven that with some simple tools and a little effort, he could make something incredible. All he needed was a little bit of clay and a lot of imagination.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a favorite bathrobe. It was soft and dry. Lily loved to wear it after her bath.
One day, Lily saw a small bird outside her window. It was cold and wet. Lily wanted to help the bird. She thought her dry bathrobe could protect the bird and keep it warm.
Lily took her bathrobe and went outside. She wrapped the bird in her bathrobe. The bird said, "Thank you, Lily. You protect me with your bathrobe. Now I am warm and dry."
Lily smiled and said, "You're welcome, little bird. I am happy to help you." The bird flew away, warm and dry, thanks to Lily and her bathrobe.
From that day on, Lily knew her bathrobe was not just for her. It could protect others too. And she was very proud of her special bathrobe.

Sam was very happy to receive the acorn. He said "thank you" to Tim. Tim smiled and told Sam that it is nice to say "please" and "thank you" when asking for help. Sam learned that being nice is better than being bossy. From that day on, Sam and Tim were the best of friends.

Tom and Mia are friends. They love to play in the park. One day, they see a large slide. They want to go on the slide.
"Let's go on the slide!" Tom says.
"OK!" Mia says.
They run to the slide. They wait for their turn. They see other kids go down the slide. They look happy.
Tom and Mia climb up the stairs. They reach the top of the slide. They see a big puddle of soap. Someone put soap on the slide. They do not know.
"Ready?" Tom says.
"Ready!" Mia says.
They sit on the slide. They push off. They slide down. They go very fast. They slip and slide. They cannot stop. They scream.
They reach the end of the slide. They fly off. They land on the ground. They hurt themselves. They cry.
"Ow! Ow! Ow!" Tom says.
"Ow! Ow! Ow!" Mia says.
They have cuts and bruises. They are dirty and wet. They are sad and angry.
"Who did this?" Tom says.
"I don't know!" Mia says.
They look around. They see a boy. He is laughing. He has a bottle of soap. He is the one who put soap on the slide. He is mean.
"Ha ha ha! That was funny!" the boy says.
Tom and Mia do not think it is funny. They think it is bad. They do not like the boy. They do not want to play with him. They want to go home.
They get up. They limp away. They leave the park. They do not love the slide anymore. They do not love the soap. They do not love the boy. They have a bad day. The end.

Lily was a thin girl who liked to look at books. She had many books in her room, but her favorite one was about a fairy who lived in a flower. She liked to look at the pictures of the fairy and her friends, and imagine she was with them.
One day, Lily's mom said she had to go to the store and buy some food. She told Lily to stay in her room and be good. Lily said okay, and hugged her mom. She watched her mom go out the door, and then went to her bookshelf. She picked up her favorite book and went to the armchair.
The armchair was big and soft, and Lily liked to sit on it and read. She opened her book and started to look at the pictures. She saw the fairy flying over a pond, and a frog jumping out of the water. She saw the fairy talking to a bird, and a worm crawling on a leaf. She saw the fairy dancing with a butterfly, and a bee buzzing around a rose.
Lily was so happy looking at the pictures, she did not hear the door open. She did not hear her mom come in with a bag of food. She did not hear her mom call her name. She did not hear her mom walk to her room. She only heard her mom when she said, "Lily, what are you doing?"
Lily looked up and saw her mom standing by the door. She smiled and said, "I'm looking at my book, mom. It's about a fairy who lives in a flower. Do you want to look with me?"
Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, I do. That sounds like a lovely book." She walked to the armchair and sat next to Lily. She took the book and opened it. She said, "Let's look at the pictures together, and you can tell me the story."
Lily nodded and hugged her mom. She said, "Okay, mom. I love you." She pointed to the first picture and said, "This is the fairy. Her name is Flora. She lives in a flower. She has wings and a wand. She can do magic. She is very nice and pretty. She has many friends. Do you want to meet them?"
Her mom said, "Yes, I do. Let's meet them." She turned the page and said, "Who is this?"
Lily said, "This is the frog. His name is Fribbit. He lives in the pond. He can jump and swim. He likes to play with Flora. He is very funny and green. He has a big mouth. Do you want to hear him?"
Her mom said, "Yes, I do. Let's hear him." She made a croaking sound and said, "Ribbit, ribbit, ribbit."
Lily laughed and said, "That's right, mom. That's how he sounds. He is very loud and happy. He has a big smile. Do you want to see more?"
Her mom said, "Yes, I do. Let's see more." She turned the page and said, "Who is this?"
Lily said, "This is the bird. His name is Chirp. He lives in the tree. He can fly and sing. He likes to talk to Flora. He is very smart and blue. He has a beak and feathers. Do you want to hear him?"
Her mom said, "Yes, I do. Let's hear him." She made a whistling sound and said, "Chirp, chirp, chirp."
Lily clapped and said, "That's right, mom. That's how he sounds. He is very sweet and friendly. He has a nice voice. Do you want to see more?"
Her mom said, "Yes, I do. Let's see more." She turned the page and said, "Who is this?"
Lily said, "This is the worm. His name is Wriggle. He lives in the ground. He can crawl and dig. He likes to eat leaves. He is very quiet and brown. He has no legs or eyes. Do you want to touch him?"
Her mom said, "No, I don't. Let's skip him." She turned the page and said, "Who is this?"
Lily said, "This is the butterfly. Her name is Flutter. She lives in the air. She can fly and change colors. She likes to dance with Flora. She is very beautiful and pink. She has wings and antennas. Do you want to see her?"
Her mom said, "Yes, I do. Let's see her." She turned the page and said, "Who is this?"
Lily said, "This is the bee. His name is Buzz. He lives in the hive

Tom met a mouse named Jerry. Tom asked Jerry, "Can you help me? I need to deliver this mail." Jerry said, "Yes, I can help you! Follow me." They walked and walked, but they were still confused. The maze was very big and tricky.
Then, they saw a big bird named Tweety. Tweety said, "I can see the whole maze from up high! I will help you." Tom and Jerry were happy. But, surprise! Tweety was a mail bird too! They all worked together and delivered the mail to all the animals in the maze.

One day, a new horse came to the stable. His name was Tim. Tim was very shy and didn't want to play with Sam and his friends. Sam asked Tim to play, but Tim just shrugged and walked away. Sam felt sad but didn't give up.
Sam tried again the next day. He asked Tim to play, and this time Tim said yes. They played together and had a great time. Soon, Tim became friends with all the animals on the farm. The moral of the story is to never give up on making new friends.

Tim's dad told him, "Be careful, Tim. Fireworks can be dangerous." Tim didn't listen and ran to the park to see the show. When he got there, he saw a man with a box of fireworks. The man was careless and left the box open. Tim saw the fireworks and wanted to take a closer look.
Tim picked up a firework and accidentally lit it. It shot up into the sky and made a big boom! Everyone was scared, but Tim was safe. His dad came running and said, "Tim, you need to be careful with fireworks!" Tim learned his lesson and promised to be more careful next time. He returned the firework to the man and enjoyed the rest of the show with his dad.

Timmy touched the pole and it started to move! It made a loud noise. Everyone in the store looked at Timmy and the moving pole. Timmy's mom said, "Oh no, we need to shut the store!" She ran to the door and shut it.
The people in the store helped Timmy's mom to stop the pole from moving. They all laughed and clapped when the pole stopped. Timmy's mom opened the door again and said, "Thank you, everyone!" Timmy and his mom went home, and the store was open again.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play in the snow. They make a big snowman with a hat and a scarf. They give him a carrot nose and two buttons for eyes.
"Hello, Mr. Snowman!" Lily says. "We are happy to meet you."
"Yes, we are!" Ben says. "You are our new friend."
But then the sun comes out. It is very bright and warm. The snow starts to melt. Lily and Ben see that Mr. Snowman is getting smaller and smaller.
"Oh no!" Lily cries. "Mr. Snowman is going away!"
"Stop, sun, stop!" Ben shouts. "You are hurting Mr. Snowman!"
They run to Mr. Snowman and try to hug him. But he is too wet and cold. They feel sad.
"Mr. Snowman, we love you!" Lily says. "Please don't leave us!"
But Mr. Snowman cannot talk. He only smiles with his carrot nose. He wants to teach Lily and Ben something.
"Look, Lily, look, Ben," he says in his head. "I am not going away. I am changing. I am becoming water. Water is good. Water helps plants grow. Water makes rainbows. Water can be ice again. Maybe we can meet again. Don't be sad. Be happy."
Lily and Ben do not hear Mr. Snowman. But they feel something in their hearts. They feel a warm and happy feeling. They look at each other and smile.
"Maybe Mr. Snowman is right," Lily says. "Maybe he is not gone. Maybe he is just different."
"Yes, maybe he is," Ben says. "And maybe we can make him again. When it snows again."
They hold hands and walk away. They say goodbye to Mr. Snowman. They hope to see him again. They are happy.

One day, Tom's mom says they are going to the airport. Tom is very excited. He wants to see the real jets and hear them roar. He puts on his jacket and hat and grabs his toy jet. He is ready to go.
At the airport, Tom sees many jets. They are big and shiny and have wings and wheels. He watches them take off and land. He hears them make loud noises. He thinks they are perfect.
Tom's mom says they have to wait for their jet. She gives him a snack and a juice. Tom is hungry. He eats his snack and drinks his juice. He also feeds his toy jet. He says his jet is hungry too. He shares his snack and juice with his toy jet. He thinks his jet is happy.
Tom's mom says their jet is here. She takes him to the gate. They board the jet and find their seats. Tom sits by the window. He holds his toy jet in his lap. He looks out the window and sees the other jets. He waves to them. He thinks they are his friends.
Tom's mom says they are going to fly soon. She buckles his seat belt and tells him to be safe. Tom buckles his toy jet's seat belt too. He tells his jet to be safe. He thinks his jet is brave.
The jet starts to move. It goes faster and faster. Then it lifts off the ground. Tom feels a thrill. He sees the sky and the clouds. He thinks they are beautiful.
Tom smiles. He hugs his toy jet. He thinks he is lucky. He thinks he is having the perfect day.

At dinner time, Lily and her mom were ready to eat the broccoli. But when they tried to cut it, the broccoli leaned to one side. They tried to cut it again, but it leaned to the other side. Lily and her mom were surprised.
Then, the broccoli said, "Please don't eat me! I am a magic broccoli!" Lily and her mom couldn't believe it. They decided not to eat the broccoli.
From that day on, Lily and the magic broccoli became best friends. They played together every day, and the magic broccoli made sure that Lily always had fun.

Tom is a restless boy. He likes to run and jump and play. He does not like to sit still and listen. One day, he goes to the farm with his mom and dad. He sees many animals there. He sees cows and pigs and chickens and horses.
He runs to the horses and wants to touch them. His mom says, "Be careful, Tom. Horses are big and strong. You have to be gentle and quiet with them." Tom nods, but he does not listen. He tries to pull the horse's tail and mane. The horse does not like that. It neighs and kicks and shakes its head.
Tom gets scared and runs away. He sees a goat with a big horn. He thinks the horn is funny and shiny. He wants to touch it. He runs to the goat and reaches for its horn. The goat does not like that. It bleats and butts and lowers its head.
Tom gets scared and runs away. He sees a duck with a big beak. He thinks the beak is cute and yellow. He wants to touch it. He runs to the duck and grabs its beak. The duck does not like that. It quacks and bites and flaps its wings.
Tom gets scared and runs away. He cries and looks for his mom and dad. He sees them by the fence. They are talking to a farmer. The farmer has a dog with him. The dog is brown and furry. It has a long tongue and a wagging tail. It sees Tom and runs to him. It licks his face and wags its tail. It offers him a ball to play with.
Tom stops crying and smiles. He likes the dog. He takes the ball and throws it. The dog runs after it and brings it back. They play together for a long time. Tom is happy and calm. He forgets about the horses and the goat and the duck. He listens to his mom and dad and the farmer. He learns about the farm and the animals. He says thank you and goodbye to the dog and the farmer. He goes home with his mom and dad. He is tired and sleepy. He has a good nap. He dreams of the dog and the ball.

Tom and Sam were best friends. They liked to play in the park and look for treasure. One day, they found a big box under a tree. It was shiny and had a lock on it.
"Wow, maybe this is treasure!" Tom said. "Let's open it and see what's inside."
Sam nodded. He saw a rock nearby and picked it up. He wanted to smash the lock with the rock. But Tom stopped him.
"Wait, Sam. Maybe this is not our box. Maybe someone else left it here. Maybe they will be sad if we break it. We should be kind and leave it alone."
Sam did not listen. He was too curious and excited. He said, "No, Tom. This is our box. We found it first. I want to see the treasure. Move away or I will hit you with the rock."
Tom was scared and sad. He did not want to fight with Sam. He did not want to hurt him or the box. He tried to talk to Sam, but Sam did not listen. He raised the rock and swung it at the lock.
But he missed. The rock hit the box and made a loud noise. The noise was like a beep. The box was not a box. It was a bomb. It was a bad bomb that someone left in the park. The bomb was ready to explode.
Tom and Sam did not know. They did not have time to run or hide. They did not have time to say sorry or hug. The bomb went off and made a big boom. The boom was very loud and very hot. It hurt Tom and Sam and the tree and the park. It was a very bad ending.

"Help! I'm stuck," she yelled for help.
Suddenly, a big fish swam next to her. He said in a soft voice, "Hey little one. Don't be scared, I'll help you. Just stay calm and I'll take you back to the surface." 
Kate was relieved and nodded nervously. The fish took hold of Kate's hand and they swam away. In no time they reached the surface, and Kate was saved!
Kate thanked the fish for helping her and smiled. The fish said goodbye and swam off into the blue. From that day on, Kate was never as scared of the pool again.

"Be careful!" said a small fish. "It's not a rock. It's a big whale!" But the foolish octopus did not listen. He wanted to step on the shiny rock.
The octopus took a big step on the shiny rock. Suddenly, the rock moved! It was a big whale. The whale opened its mouth and said, "Why did you step on me?"
The octopus was scared. He said, "I'm sorry, I thought you were a rock." The whale laughed and said, "It's okay, but be careful next time." The octopus learned his lesson and became friends with the whale.

His dad smiled and said: "It's easy. All you need to do is turn this gear right here and it will unlock the bike."

The hurricane came to the town. It was very strong and loud. The wind blew and the rain fell hard. Tim was scared too. Then, he remembered the magic spray bottle. He took it out and sprayed the air. The hurricane stopped. The town was safe again. Everyone was so happy and thanked Tim for saving them.

Ben is happy. He likes tea and cake. He says, "Thank you, Sara. I will come to your tea party. Can I bring my cars?"
Sara says, "Yes, you can. We can share our toys."
Sara and Ben go to their homes and get ready for the tea party. Sara puts on a pretty dress and a hat. She sets the table with plates, cups, spoons and napkins. She displays her cakes and cookies on a tray. She puts her dolls on chairs and gives them hats and cups.
Ben puts on a shirt and a tie. He brings his cars and a teddy bear. He knocks on Sara's door at three o'clock. Sara opens the door and says, "Welcome, Ben. Come in. The tea party is ready."
Ben and Sara have a lot of fun at the tea party. They eat cake and cookies and drink tea. They talk to their dolls and cars and teddy bear. They laugh and play and say, "Cheers!"

Once upon a time, in a small house, lived a strong boy named Tim. Tim loved to eat soup. Every day, his mom made him a big bowl of soup for lunch.
One day, while eating his soup, Tim heard a shout from outside. He ran out to see what was happening. There, he saw a little bird with a hurt wing. "Help me," cried the bird. Tim wanted to help the bird, so he picked it up gently and took it inside.
Tim's mom saw the bird and said, "Oh no! Let's make the bird some soup to help it feel better." They made a little bowl of soup for the bird. The bird ate the soup and, to their surprise, it started to grow! It grew so big that it filled the whole room.
"Thank you for the soup," said the big bird. "Now I can fly high and strong again!" The bird flew away, and Tim and his mom waved goodbye. They were happy they could help the bird, and they knew that soup had a special magic to make things strong.
<|endoftext|>
One day, a boy named Tim found a zip. He did not know what it was for, but he liked it. He said, "This zip is mine." He put the zip in his pocket and went to play outside.
In the park, Tim met a girl named Sue. Sue saw the zip and wanted it. "Can I have the zip?" she asked. Tim said, "No, it is mine." Sue was sad, but she had an idea. She showed Tim her toy car. "If you give me the zip, I will give you my toy car," she said. Tim thought about it and said, "Okay."
Tim and Sue traded. Tim got the toy car and Sue got the zip. But the car was dirty. Tim did not like the dirty car. He wanted his zip back. He asked Sue, "Can I have my zip back?" Sue said, "No, the zip is mine now."
Tim was very sad. He went home with the dirty car. He lost his zip and had a bad day. The next time, Tim will think more before trading his things.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, in a big garden, there was a hungry little bee. The bee saw a big sunflower and went to it. The sunflower smiled at the bee and said, "Hello, little bee! Are you hungry?"
The bee said, "Yes, I am very hungry. Can I eat from you?" The sunflower agreed and let the bee eat from it. The bee was happy and ate a lot. But the bee was not nice. It ate too much and did not stop. The sunflower became sad and weak.
One day, a big wind appeared. The sunflower was too weak to stand. It fell down and could not get up. The bee was sad because it had no more food. The sunflower and the bee were both sad.
The moral of the story is to not be greedy and to always be kind to others.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim had a toy magnet that he loved to play with. One day, Tim's friend, Sam, came over to play. Sam saw Tim's magnet and felt jealous. He wanted a magnet too.
"Tim, where did you get your magnet?" Sam asked. "I want one too!" Tim told Sam that his dad had delivered the magnet as a gift. Sam asked his mom if she could deliver a magnet for him too. His mom said she would try.
The next day, Sam's mom delivered a big box to him. Sam was so excited! He thought it was the magnet he asked for. But when he opened the box, he found a big, bouncy ball instead. Sam was surprised but happy. He and Tim played with the ball and the magnet together, and they were both very happy.
<|endoftext|>


Lily and Ben were playing in the garden. They saw a big pipe that came out of the wall. They wondered what was inside the pipe.
"Let's look inside the pipe," Ben said. He climbed on a chair and put his eye near the hole.
"Be careful, Ben," Lily said. "Maybe there is something bad in there."
Ben did not listen. He wanted to see what was inside the pipe. He put his hand in the hole and felt something wet and cold. He pulled it out and saw a dead mouse.
"Yuck!" Ben screamed. He dropped the mouse and jumped off the chair.
Lily was scared. She ran to the hose and turned it on. She wanted to spray the mouse away. She pointed the hose at the pipe and pressed the button.
But the hose was not working well. It did not spray water. It sprayed air. The air went into the pipe and made a loud noise.
The pipe shook and burst. Water came out of the pipe and splashed Lily and Ben. They were wet and cold.
They ran to the house and told their mom what happened. She was not happy. She said they should not play with the pipe. She said they should play with their toys instead.
She gave them towels and cookies and told them to stay inside. Lily and Ben were sorry. They did not want to play with the pipe anymore. They wanted to play with their toys and eat cookies.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time, there lived a kind giant. He built a comfy house for himself in a lush, green forest. Every day, he went out from the forest and shared his kindness with neighbors.
One day, while the giant was away, a thief snuck into his house. The thief created a plan to steal all the giant's treasures. Just then, the giant returned home and he could hear the thief trying to break in.
The giant quickly created a trap with his hands. He then shouted at the thief, "This house is mine! You must leave now!" The thief was surprised and quickly ran away.
The giant was very comforted that he had protected his home. He realized that he had done a very good job creating the trap. From then on, he never missed a chance to create something new and powerful.
<|endoftext|>
One day, in a small, boring town, a boy named Tim set out to play. He walked and walked until he found a big park. The park had a slide, swings, and a sandbox. Tim was very happy and excited to play.
As he played, a girl named Sue came to the park. She asked, "Can I play with you?" Tim said, "Yes, let's play together!" They played on the slide and swings, and then they went to the sandbox.
While they played in the sandbox, they found a small, shiny box. Tim and Sue opened the box and saw a magic wand inside. They waved the wand, and suddenly, the boring town changed. The park grew bigger, and there were new games to play. The town was not boring anymore. Tim and Sue played all day and had lots of fun in their new, exciting town.
<|endoftext|>


Tommy liked to do magic tricks. He had a hat, a wand, and a rabbit. He wanted to show his magic to his friends at school. He thought they would like him more and think he was cool.
But Tommy did not know how to do magic well. He only copied what he saw on TV. He did not practice or learn the rules. He did not listen to his mom, who told him to be careful with magic.
One day, he brought his hat, his wand, and his rabbit to school. He told his friends he would do a big magic show for them. They all gathered around him and waited. Tommy put his hat on the ground and waved his wand. He said some words he made up.
He reached into his hat and pulled out his rabbit. But it was not his rabbit. It was a skunk. The skunk was angry and scared. It sprayed Tommy and his friends with a bad smell. Everyone screamed and ran away. Tommy was left alone, covered in stink.
Tommy was very embarrassed. He cried and wished he never did magic. He learned that magic is not a game. He learned that he should not try to impress others with things he does not know. He learned that he should be happy with who he is, and not pretend to be someone else. He learned that being ordinary is not so bad.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time there was a boy named John. John was an adventurous boy and he loved exploring the world. Every spring, he would borrow his father’s bike and go on a journey to discover new things. 
One spring morning, John was ready to leave on his adventure. But just as he was taking off, his father stopped him. 
“John, before you go, I have to borrow your bike”. said his father.
John was very surprised and a little sad. He wanted to go on his journey but he couldn’t without a bike. He plead with his father but his father just said no. 
John was feeling very frustrated and he went to the garden for a walk. There he found a magic bike. A magical voice said, “John borrow this bike to go on your adventure?” 
John smiled and said yes! He was so excited and took the magical bike and set off on his journey. 
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a playful dog named Spot. Spot loved to spend his days running and playing with his friends. They were a happy group.
One sunny day, Spot and his group went to the park. They played with a big, red ball. They ran, jumped, and laughed. The sun was shining, and they were having so much fun.
As the day went on, Spot and his friends got tired. They lay down on the soft, green grass. They looked up at the sky and saw fluffy, white clouds. Spot and his group were happy and sleepy. They went home, ready to play again another day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Yesterday, Tim played in the mud with his dog, Spot. They both got very filthy. Tim's mom saw them and said, "Oh no! You both need to clean up."
Tim didn't want to clean up, but his mom said, "You can't come inside until you wipe off the mud." Tim and Spot were sad. They wanted to go inside and eat snacks. So, Tim and Spot found a big towel and started to wipe off the mud.
After they wiped off the mud, they went inside. Tim's mom said, "Good job! Now you can have your snacks." Tim and Spot were happy. They ate their snacks and played more, but this time they stayed clean.

Once, there was a boy named Tim. He had a nice bathrobe. Tim was selfish. He did not like to share his bathrobe with his sister, Ann. Tim always said, "This is mine. I will not let you use it."
One day, Tim's mom told him to value things more. She said, "You must learn to share." Tim did not listen. He still did not share his bathrobe with Ann. 
One night, something strange happened. Tim's bathrobe came to life! It was mad at Tim for being selfish. The bathrobe said, "You do not value me, so I will go away." The bathrobe left Tim's room and was never seen again. Tim was sad, but he learned to share and value things more.

Once, there was a happy dog named Spot. Spot loved to run on the track near his home. Every day, he would ask his mom, "Can I go to the track?" His mom would say, "Yes, I permit you to go."
One day, a big cat came to the track. The cat said, "This is my track now. You can't run here." Spot was sad. He wanted to run on the track, but the big cat would not permit it.
Spot went home and told his mom about the big cat. His mom said, "Don't worry, Spot. I will talk to the cat." She went to the track and talked to the big cat. The big cat said he was sorry and that Spot could run on the track too. Now, Spot and the big cat both run on the track, and they are happy friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. Amy lived in an ordinary house with her mom, dad, and her dog, Spot. One day, Amy and her family went to the park to have a fun day.
At the park, Amy saw a big tree with lots of red cherries on it. She decided she wanted to pick some cherries to take home. So, Amy asked her dad to help her pick the cherries. Together, they picked the cherries and put them in a basket.
After they picked the cherries, Amy and her family had a picnic in the park. They ate sandwiches, apples, and some of the cherries they picked. Spot played with a ball and everyone had a great day. When it was time to go home, Amy decided she wanted to come back to the park again soon.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Anna. She was a curious three year old who always asked questions. One day, when her father was taking Anna for a walk in the park, she noticed a woman wearing a veil on her head. 
Anna asked her father why the woman was wearing a veil. Her father explained that it was part of her religion. Anna smiled and kept on walking. Soon they came across an old man who was sitting on the park bench. 
Anna said to the old man, "Hello." But the old man frowned. He did not reply. Anna looked at her father, confused. Her father explained that the old man was rude and shouldn't be spoken to. Anna understood and the family moved on.
The lesson that Anna learned on that day was to always be kind to everyone, regardless of how others might be acting. Kindness is always appreciated.

Once upon a time, there was a mighty dog named Max. Max was a big, strong dog who liked to help people. One day, Max saw a little cat who was stuck in a tree. The cat was very sad and scared.
Max wanted to help the cat. He found a big cross made of wood. Max used the cross to make a bridge so the cat could climb down from the tree. The cat was very happy and thanked Max for being so kind.
Everyone saw what Max did and they all clapped their hands. They all said "Yay!" and "Good job, Max!" Max felt very proud and happy. He knew he had done a good thing by helping the cat. And from that day on, Max and the cat became best friends.

Sara liked to do yoga with her mom. Yoga was fun and made her feel good. She liked to stretch and bend and breathe. She had a pink mat and a fancy water bottle.
But one day, Sara saw her brother Max playing with his cars. He had a big track and a lot of cars that made noises and lights. Sara wanted to play with them too. She asked Max if she could join him.
"No, go away!" Max said. "These are my cars. You are too little and you will break them. Go do your boring yoga."
Sara felt sad and angry. She did not like Max being mean to her. She did not want to do yoga anymore. She wanted to play with the cars. She decided to quit yoga and take Max's cars.
She waited until Max went to the bathroom. Then she ran to his room and grabbed some of his cars. She tried to make them go on the track, but they did not work. She pushed harder and harder, but they only got stuck and fell off.
Max came back and saw what Sara was doing. He yelled at her and tried to take his cars back. Sara did not want to give them up. They started to fight and pull and tug.
Mom heard the noise and came to see what was wrong. She saw Sara and Max fighting over the cars. She saw the track broken and the cars scattered. She saw Sara's pink mat and fancy water bottle on the floor.
She was not happy. She told Sara and Max to stop fighting and to apologize to each other. She told Sara that she should not quit yoga and take Max's cars. She told Max that he should not be mean to Sara and share his cars. She told them that they should both try to do something they both liked.
Sara and Max felt sorry for what they did. They said they were sorry and hugged each other. They decided to do something they both liked. They asked Mom if they could do yoga with her. Mom smiled and said yes. They got their mats and water bottles and followed Mom's moves. They stretched and bent and breathed. They had fun and felt good. They did not fight anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a delicate cat named Luna. She loved to play in the backyard. One sunny day, she saw a big red ball there.
Luna said, "I want to play with the ball!" She ran to the ball and tried to push it. But the ball was very big, and Luna was very small. It did not move. Luna tried again and again, but the ball would not roll.
Then, Luna had an idea. She climbed a tree and jumped onto the ball. But, she did not know the ball was wet. Luna slipped and fell off the ball! She landed softly on the grass.
Just then, a kind dog named Max came to the backyard. He saw Luna and the big red ball. Max said, "Let's play together!" Max pushed the ball, and it rolled. Luna chased it and they both laughed. They played all day and became best friends.
<|endoftext|>


Lily and Tom were playing hide and seek in the park. Lily was the seeker and Tom was the hider. Lily counted to ten and then looked for Tom. She saw a big bush with a feather sticking out of it. She thought Tom was hiding there.
She ran to the bush and peeked behind it. But it was not Tom. It was a big, angry bird with sharp claws and a long beak. The bird did not like Lily peeking at it. It screeched and flew at Lily. It scratched her face and pulled her hair. Lily screamed and cried.
Tom heard Lily's scream and came out of his hiding spot. He saw the bird attacking Lily. He was scared and did not know what to do. He wanted to help Lily, but he was too small and weak. He wished he had a stick or a stone to throw at the bird.
The bird did not stop hurting Lily. It was not an ordinary bird. It was a mean and hungry bird. It wanted to eat Lily. It bit her neck and dragged her into the bush. Lily stopped screaming and crying. She was gone.
Tom was alone and sad. He wished he had never played hide and seek. He wished he had never seen the feather. He wished Lily was still with him. He ran to find his mom and dad. He hoped they could save Lily. But it was too late. The end.
<|endoftext|>


One day, a little bear and his mama went to look for honey in the forest. The little bear loved honey very much and wanted to eat it all the time. His mama told him to listen carefully and follow her, because there were many dangers in the forest.
"Listen, little bear, we have to be quiet and sneaky. There are big bees that guard the honey, and they can sting us if they see us. There are also other animals that like honey, and they can be mean and scary. Do you understand?" his mama said.
"Yes, mama, I understand. I will listen and follow you. I want to eat honey, but I don't want to get hurt or scared," the little bear said.
They walked and walked until they found a big tree with a hole in it. The little bear smelled honey and got very excited. He ran towards the tree, forgetting to listen and follow his mama. He stuck his head inside the hole and saw a lot of honey. He licked his lips and reached his paw inside.
But then he heard a terrible buzz. The big bees had seen him and were angry. They flew out of the hole and started to sting the little bear. The little bear cried out in pain and fear. He pulled his head and paw out of the hole, but it was too late. He was covered in stings and bumps.
His mama heard his cry and ran to help him. She scared away the bees and hugged the little bear. She licked his wounds and comforted him.
"I'm sorry, mama, I didn't listen and follow you. I was too greedy and foolish. The honey was not worth it. The bees were terrible and hurt me a lot," the little bear said.
"It's okay, little bear, I forgive you. You made a mistake, but you learned a lesson. Next time, you will listen and follow me, and we will find honey safely and happily. Now let's go home and rest. I love you, little bear," his mama said.
They walked back home, holding paws. The little bear felt sorry and sore, but also loved and grateful. He decided to listen and follow his mama from then on, and to share the honey with her and his friends. He realized that honey was sweet, but love was sweeter.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max lived in a small house with his family. Max loved to bite things. He would bite toys, shoes, and even the bookcase. Max's family did not like when he bit the bookcase.
One day, Max's friend, a little girl named Lily, came to visit. She saw Max bite the bookcase and said, "Max, don't bite the bookcase! We can play with toys instead." Max was eager to play with Lily, so he stopped biting the bookcase.
Max and Lily played with toys all day. They had a lot of fun. Max did not bite the bookcase anymore. Max's family was happy that he stopped biting the bookcase. From that day on, Max only bit his toys and played with his friend Lily.

Sue told her friend, Tom, about her idea. "I want to create a healthy television," she said. Tom thought it was a great idea too. They decided to work together. They knew it would not be easy, but they were ready to try.
Day after day, Sue and Tom worked hard. They drew pictures and talked about what the healthy television would show. One day, they finally finished. They turned on the television and saw happy people eating fruits and vegetables, playing outside, and being kind to each other. Sue and Tom smiled, knowing they had created something special.

But then, the caterpillar and his friend, the butterfly, started to quarrel. They both wanted to play on the same leaf. The caterpillar was sad, and the butterfly was mad.
Soon, they stopped fighting and said sorry to each other. They learned to share the leaf and play together. The caterpillar and the butterfly were happy again, and they all had a great day.

Once upon a time, there was a famous dog named Spot. Spot was very good at finding things. One day, Spot found a pretty crystal. The crystal was shiny and made Spot very happy.
Spot wanted to show his friends the crystal, so he went to the park. When he got to the park, he saw his friends playing. Spot wanted to play too, but he did not want to lose the crystal. So, he put the crystal in his mouth and tried to play. 
While playing, Spot tried to bark, but the crystal fell out of his mouth. All his friends saw the crystal fall and laughed. Spot felt embarrass. But his friends said, "Don't worry, Spot. We all make mistakes." They helped him find the crystal, and they all played together. Spot was happy to have such good friends.

Once there was a small turkey. He lived in a barn on a farm with lots of other animals. Each day he would gobble and flutter his wings. One day, the farmer wanted to raise him. He carefully picked up the small turkey and took him to a cozy pen. 
The turkey was happy there. He was safe and had plenty of yummy food to eat. He also started to get bigger, but still stayed small. The farmer checked in on him every day. 
Soon the turkey was ready to be raised. The farmer took him to a big, noisy market. There were lots of other turkeys there, but none of them were as small as he was. A customer saw the small turkey and knew he would make a good dinner.
The farmer's heart was heavy as he sold the turkey. But he was happy, too. He knew the small turkey was going to a good home to be loved. The little turkey will never be forgotten.

The hero met a little boy. The boy said, "I want the toy, please." The hero gave the toy to the boy. The boy was very happy. The hero felt good for helping the boy.
But then, something unexpected happened. The cheap toy broke into pieces. The boy was very sad. The hero tried to fix the toy, but he couldn't. The hero was sad too. They both learned that cheap toys can break easily.
